______
A pack’s values define its identity and the expected behavior of each member. Following the values will help you rise up the ranks. Ignore them long enough and you’ll be put on Probation. All values must be returned to good standing in order to end the probationary period. Continue to disregard the values and you risk discipline and may even be kicked out!

Distinguished Degrees
Distinguished Degree
Pay with Student Loan (Sim will owe cost + interest = {0.Money} total)\n*Loan amount will belong to the student.
Pay with Household Funds
&lt;b&gt;Paying with Household Funds&lt;/b&gt;\nTuition is taken from the Sim's household funds.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Paying with Student Loan&lt;/b&gt;\nTuition is paid with a loan that the Sim will owe. The money owed is the Total Cost + Interest.\n\nLoan information will appear in the Phone's Household panel under the Make Loans Payment option.
Sims may choose to live in university housing. This places Sims on campus, living with other non-playable roommates also attending university. Housing costs will be paid per term, and Sims are encouraged to bring everything they may need for university in their personal inventory before moving, as they will not be able to alter university housing directly once moved in. Student essentials will still be available to purchase at kiosks on the university campus.
Sims choosing to live off campus will move out of their current house and into another, allowing them to move in with other households or buy a new home. If the Sim intends to purchase a new place, it is prudent to give them enough funds to do so. Note that cancelling during Move Out will place your Sim in the My Households bin.
Off Campus
This is a distinguished degree at this university. Your Sim's skills are not sufficient to be accepted here. Feel free to join a non-distinguished degree or try another university. 
No additional cost to tuition

Core courses help students build the necessary skills for careers in their field, while electives offer a chance to learn from a wide variety of skills that may not be as relevant.\n\nBoth core and elective courses count towards degree completion.

Small Business Perks
Manage perks that will help improve the Small Business. Choose carefully—some perks will affect Alignment.
Level up to earn more Perk Points!\nSims can increase their Small Business Renown and unlock more tiers by actively working on their Small Business.\nTo increase Renown, make sure Customers are leaving positive Customer Reviews by offering them Business Activities to do, a nice venue for Ambiance, a positive Relationship with the Business Owner, High Quality services and goods, and discounted Pricing.
Perk Points: &lt;span class=&quot;balance&quot;&gt;{0.SmallBusinessPoints}&lt;/span&gt;
Child Skill
Sims can develop a multitude of different Skills, which give your Sims all sorts of different benefits! Interact with special Skill Objects or other Sims to raise Skill levels. If your Sim is happy or in the Skill's associated emotion they will raise skill faster. \n\nThe bar over your Sim's head shows you their progress towards the next Skill level that they are actively learning, and progress towards all skills can be tracked in this panel.
Skills
Fundamentals are similar to Skills but specific to Toddlers and Children. Interact with special Skill Objects or other Sims to raise these Fundamental levels and unlock new ways to interact with the world around your growing Sims.\n\nThe bar over your Sim's head shows you their progress towards the next Fundamental or Skill level and progress can be tracked in this panel.
Sims can develop a multitude of different Skills, which give your Sims all sorts of different benefits! Interact with special Skill Objects or other Sims to raise Skill levels. If your Sim is happy or in the Skill's associated emotion they will raise skill faster. \n\nThe bar over your Sim's head shows you their progress towards the next Skill level that they are actively learning, and progress towards all skills can be tracked in this panel.\n\n&lt;font color='#EC262E'&gt;Note: Children may have access to certain Object interactions that gain Skill for Teens and older which do not increase that Skill for them as Children.&lt;/font&gt;
Fundamentals
Burnout decreases skill gains. Consider stopping the grind and taking break.

Employee &lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;at {0.String}&lt;/font&gt;
Noble Rivals can be dealt with in an amicable or honorable way or by sabotaging them:\n• Encourage to Abdicate\n• Duel for Noble Title\n• Pressure to Abdicate or Seduce to Abdicate\n• Extort to Abdicate\n• Marriage\n• Rivalries can also be ended if a Sim dies or is demoted. Consider tampering with a Secret Passageway, there can be deadly consequences… 
There's more than one way to end a rivalry. The &quot;Befriend Rival&quot; and &quot;Sabotage Rival&quot; Work Tones allow you to remedy the problem while on the job. Meeting up after work is also an option, whether you choose to be friendly or try more...creative solutions.
Noble Rival:
Workplace Rival:
A Noble Rival is an adversary at court who blocks the path to promotion.
Always getting in the way, a work rival blocks the path to promotion.

Class Performance
There are many ways for students to succeed in a university course:\n\n• Going to class\n• Completing homework\n• Studying on textbooks, computers, or research archives\n• Practicing the course's related skill\n• Submitting a good final paper or presentation\n• Visiting the professor during office hours\n\nStudents may not need to do all of these, but neglecting a large number will surely result in poor grades. Students who wish to get a sense of how they're doing in a class can check with their professors via phone or computer, though final grades will only be released after the term has ended.

The best ways to improve career performance are:\n • Going to Work with a Positive Emotion\n • Maintaining High Relationships with Co-workers
Complete gigs to improve career performance. Finishing gigs quickly will result in an increased performance boost and bonus payments. Canceled or unfinished gigs will lower performance.\n\nWhile freelancers don't receive promotions, improving performance will increase their standing with their trade's agency, which leads to higher base pay and unlockable rewards!
Clients will allot a certain budget\nto use for the renovations. If you\ngo over budget, the amount will\nturn red. Going over budget will\nnegatively affect your performance \nand reputation.\n\nBetter performance and reputation\ncan lead to repeat Clients or new, \npotentially higher-paying Gigs.

Unity Stability
The state of a Dynasty is represented by its Prestige, i.e. how successful it is, and its Unity, i.e. how well its Members get along.\n\nPrestige and Unity is built (or ruined) by all the Dynasty's members collectively, and they all benefit (or suffer from) the consequences as well.
Prestige &amp; Unity
This Dynasty is experiencing a Unity Crisis! Focus on building positive relationships between Dynasty members to resolve it.
Unity Crisis

Dynasty Details
Rank: {0.Number}
View all Dynasties
Dynasty
Found a Dynasty
Leave Dynasty?
When founding a new Dynasty, the founding Sim will leave their current Dynasty. They will lose access to Perks, any relationship bonuses from Unity and Alliances, and may upset some of the other Members. Do you want to leave the Dynasty?
The Head of a Dynasty cannot create a new one unless they first Step Down as Head.
Only Young Adults, Adults and Elders can create a Dynasty.
All Dynasties
Create New Dynasty
Randomize Crest
Design Dynasty Crest
Emblem
The Emblem is the symbol on the Crest, which is placed on the Shield.\n\nSims who want to show their Dynasty pride can decorate their home with their Dynasty Crest. The Dynasty Crest Emblems can be found in the Paintings &amp; Posters category in Build Mode and comes in two versions, Vibrant and Gilded. 
Shield
The Shield is the base of the Crest, upon which the Emblem is placed.\n\nSims who want to show their Dynasty pride can decorate their home with their Dynasty Crest. The Dynasty Crest Shield can be found in the Wall Decorations category in Build Mode. 
Please enter a name between {0.Number} and {1.Number} characters.

Unity
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#E9B37E'&gt;Unity Crisis&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;\nWhile a Dynasty is in this state \nall Members experience the following:\n&lt;font color='#EC262E'&gt;• Decreased success with Friendly Socials between Members&lt;/font&gt;\n&lt;font color='#EC262E'&gt;• Reduced Relationship gain between Members &lt;/font&gt;\n&lt;font color='#EC262E'&gt;• Negative Dynasty Events occur more often &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Unity Stability&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;\nWhile a Dynasty is in this state \nall members gain the following:\n&lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;• Increased success with Friendly Socials between Members&lt;/font&gt;\n&lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;• Boosted Relationship gain between Dynasty members &lt;/font&gt;\n&lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;• Positive Dynasty Events will occur more often &lt;/font&gt;\n
Are you sure you want to Step Down?
You cannot Step Down if there is no Heir in the Dynasty
Stepping down as Head of the Dynasty will make you just another Member, and the Heir of the dynasty will become the new Head.\n\nAre you sure you want to do this?
Step Down
&lt;font color='#EC262E'&gt;This Skill is already selected&lt;/font&gt;
Add Skill
Dynasties can choose up to three Skills to embrace as Dynasty Values. \n\nMembers who engage in the Skill's Encouraged Activities will generate Prestige for the Dynasty. \n\nMembers will engage in these Activities more often on their own, but only if Autonomy is set to Full in Game Options &gt; Gameplay, and only if they do not have a Dislike Activity Preference for the Skill in question.

Do you want to delete the Dynasty?
This action will disband the Dynasty. Its Crest, Values, Unity, Prestige and associated Perks will all be lost. Alliances and Rivalries will also end immediately. Are you sure you want to remove this Dynasty?

Undeclare Outcast
The state of a Dynasty is represented by its Prestige, i.e. how successful it is, and its Unity, i.e. how well its Members get along.\n\nPrestige and Unity is built (or ruined) by all the Dynasty's members collectively, and they all benefit (or suffer from) the consequences as well.
Dynasty Progression

{0.Number}
Perk Points:
Open Alliances &amp; Rivalries
No eligible Sims to add to Dynasty.
Create Dynasty without Heir?
An Heir will be able to generate more Prestige than a normal Member. The Head of the Dynasty can designate or change an Heir at any time.\n\nAre you sure you want to create this Dynasty without designating an Heir first?
A Dynasty is made up of a group of related Sims. Anyone who is related to the Dynasty Head, or is the child, grand child, or step child of another member, is allowed to join. \n\nNot all Sims who can join want to join, or are allowed by the Dynasty Head to join! Improving the relationship between the Sim and the Dynasty Head, and increasing the Dynasty's Prestige, may help in such situations.
Members
Member

Do you want to kick this Member out of the Dynasty?
Kicking this member out of the Dynasty may have consequences.\n\nAre you sure you want to do this?

Members
The Dynasty needs a Head.
&lt;font color='#AE3CDE'&gt;In a Scandal&lt;/font&gt;\n&lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;Time Remaining:&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;{0.Timespan}&lt;/font&gt;
Dynasties can choose up to three Ideals to embrace as Dynasty Values.\n\nMembers who engage in the Ideal's Encouraged Activities, go to work in an Encouraged Career, or participate in an Encouraged Extracurricular will generate Prestige for the Dynasty. Members who engage in the Ideal's Discouraged Activities or go to work in an Discouraged Career will make the Dynasty lose Prestige.\n\nMost Members will engage in the Ideal's Encouraged Activities more often on their own but only if Autonomy is set to Full in Game Options &gt; Gameplay. However, members who have Traits who are opposed to an Ideal (for example, the Evil Trait is opposed to the Caring Ideal) may engage in Discouraged Activities more often instead!

Create Your Dynasty
Create New Dynasty
Dynasty must have a valid name.
&lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;Outcast&lt;/font&gt;
Dynasty Heads can declare Rivalries or form Alliances with the Head of another Dynasty.\n\nThe Dynasty will gain Prestige on starting a new Alliance or Rivalry, and from interacting with Members of those Dynasties, but lose Prestige if it is ended.\n\nAlliances are harder to start and maintain, but has mainly positive effects, while Rivalries are easier to start and uphold, but come with negative consequences as well.
Alliances &amp; Rivalries
Members of Allied Dynasties enjoy improved Relationships and gain Prestige when being Friendly.\n\nAsking for Blessing to Marry is more likely to succeed between Allies, and Allies are also more likely to befriend, propose dates, and visit each other.

Plan a Getaway at your own residential lot or on most Venue lots! Getaways can last multiple days, with work and school paused for the entire duration. Sims will not lose any progress in their careers or school while they are away. Be sure to place the right objects for your chosen Activities so Sims can enjoy everything on the schedule!

As a result, some objects may be located in positions that are inaccessible by your Sims.\n\nUsing Move Objects disables placement rules in Build Mode - even allowing objects to overlap each other.\n\nTry this cheat for yourself:&lt;ol&gt;&lt;li&gt;Press &quot;ctrl + shift + c&quot; to open the cheat console.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Type &quot;bb.moveobjects&quot; and press enter.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ol&gt;\nTo turn the Move Objects cheat back off, open the cheat console and enter &quot;bb.moveobjects&quot; again.

Handiness Skill
Broken objects can be repaired with a little time and effort. While repairing, Sims improve their Handiness Skill.
Sims in the Focused Emotion will generally be better at Handiness interactions.
As Sims improve their Handiness Skill, they'll be able to upgrade their household items. Upgraded items have new benefits. For example, they can be unbreakable!
Sims need to spend upgrade parts to upgrade items. Upgrade parts can be found in piles of salvage next to repaired items or can be purchased through the computer.

World Select
In the World Select screen you can see all the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Worlds&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in your game, hover the cursor over each one to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;learn more&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; about the World, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; World. Changing Worlds will open that World’s Map.\n\nIn the upper left corner, you can change between &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Residential&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Destination&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Worlds (if you have any Destination Worlds available). Destination Worlds are Worlds where you can’t live permanently, but you can visit while on Vacation.\n\nMore Worlds, of both the Residential and Destination type, can be unlocked as you get new Expansion and Game Packs.
The World Map shows the currently selected &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, but there are more Worlds to choose from! Use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Select&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to view all available Worlds.
Your Sim lives in a world full of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;stories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! As their life changes, so do the lives of those around them. With &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Neighborhood Stories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you can follow the life changes of the other Households in the world, and adjust which Households can experience which Stories.
World Map
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Map&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is where you choose which Household to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;play&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or which Lot to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;edit&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;add&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; new Households, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;manage&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; all the Households in the save. This view is also used when &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;traveling&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nTo go to the World Map from Live Mode, use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Manage World&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button.
Inventory
You can select multiple things in your Sim's Inventory. Select the Multiselect button to turn it on. You'll know when multiselect is on when the background of the inventory turns green. Now you can select multiple items in the Inventory. Once they are all selected, you can use the buttons on the bottom to either mark every item as Favorite, or Sell every item. Note that you cannot use drag functionality from the Inventory when multiselect is On.
Sims can interact with items in their personal inventories by opening the inventory (click on the panel in the lower right or use the [i] shortcut key) and clicking the item.
You can sort items in your Sims Inventory. You can sort by the name of the objects, the price, or how rare they are, among other things. Use the arrow to the left of the sort interface to sort by ascending or descending.
Sims can put items back into the world by clicking and holding an item to pick it up.\n\nWhile dragging, valid drop locations will be highlighted yellow (such as a refrigerator, or Sims). In addition to being able to place the object directly onto the ground or valid surfaces.
You can filter what you see in the Sim's inventory by using the filter interface. Select the arrow next to the Filter Items interface to display all the filter categories. You can also expand a filter category by selecting the arrow; this provides even more filter options. These sub-filters can be turned on and off for more granularity.
You can mark items in your Sim's Inventory as a Favorite item. Select the item you want to Favorite, and then select Add to Favorites. Favorite Items will be identified with a heart icon in the Inventory, and will filter in their own category.
Cell Phone
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Travel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; app has options to get your Sims moving! &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Travel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; gets your Sims exploring the Worlds and Neighborhoods available to visit. This app also has options to move to a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;new home&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Entertainment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; app has options to keep your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fun Need&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; fulfilled with things like Browse Web or Play Game.
Need a J. O. B.? The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Business&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; app is where you can join a Career! You can also Quit Job or Take a Vacation Day from this app as well.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Home&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; app is where you can hire &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Services&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; like cleaning, repair, or nanny; order food &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Deliveries&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; and track your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Or Call the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fire Department&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;… in case of fire.
Your Sim’s Cell Phone can be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;customized&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to match their style with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Change Phone Background Color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Change Phone Cover Color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; buttons. \n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Silence Phone&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will keep other Sims from calling you.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; app has options to take selfies, photos of your Sims, and the world around them.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cell Phone&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is a very handy device that has a number of uses to help your Sims &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;manage&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; their lives, and to keep them &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;connected&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;entertained&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nYou can access it with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cell Phone button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; below your Sim’s portrait.\n\nThe Cell Phone has several &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;apps&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;: Entertainment, Home, Travel, Business, Social, and Camera.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Social&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; app has your Sims social connections covered. Add a Simstagram Story, Chat, Plan Social Events, Invite to Hangout are just some of the options to fill your Sim’s Social Need.
Camera Controls
Sims 4 has two camera styles. The default style allows you to click on open terrain and drag to move the camera.\n\nBoth camera styles behave differently, so experiment with the left, right, and middle mouse buttons to find one that suits your play style.\n\nYou can modify the camera style by pressing the Sims 3 / Sims 4 camera buttons at the top right of the screen, press Ctrl+Shift+Tab, or access the Game Camera settings in Game Options.
The default camera style does not have the option to Pitch (or Tilt) the camera. As you zoom the camera in and out, it moves along a path that allows for an easier experience for viewing your Sims.\n\nYou can modify this setting in the Game Options / Controls &amp; Camera tab.
Taking Screenshots and Video in the Sims 4 has never been easier. Simply click the shutter button found next to the time controls.
Press the camera button (or press C) to take a screenshot of the game. Press the video button (or press V) to start/stop video capture. Click the picture button to view all the screenshots and memories that have been captured.
Calendar
The Calendar can also be used to book future events. These events have one hour reminders before they start.
Access the Calendar by selecting the &quot;Show Calendar&quot; button at the bottom of the Live Mode screen.
The Calendar displays upcoming events such as birthdays, school days, and work schedules.
You can filter items in the Calendar to see specific types of events. Select the heart icon next to an event to tag it for the &quot;Favorites&quot; filter. 
Toddler Skills
Imagination Skill is meant to measure a Toddler’s creativity. Being in the Playful emotion will help to boost Imagination Skill gains, along with things like Playing with Toys or the Dollhouse, or Reading.\n\nUpon age up into a Child, Imagination Skill will result in a boost to the Creativity skill.
Toddlers have 5 skills of their very own. Each skill can be built upon by interacting with other Sims or objects. Advancing in each of the Toddler Skills (except for Potty) provides a boost to future Child skills.\n\nAs your Toddler increases their skills, you might find it becomes less time consuming as you care for their Needs.
There are three levels of Potty Skill for the Toddler to advance through. Building Potty Skill can occur by using the Potty, or Asking for Potty Help from a Caregiver.\n\nAs the Toddler becomes more proficient with their Potty use, they may find they have less accidents, and adults will have less difficulty changing their diaper.
Thinking Skill gauges a Toddler's mental progression. Toddlers can build Thinking Skill by doing things like the Show Flash Cards or Ask Why interactions, or by choosing the Study interactions on Nesting Blocks.\n\nWhen a Toddler ages into a Child, Thinking Skill will boost the Toddlers Mental Skill.
Toddlers can build upon 5 levels of Communication Skill by doing things like Talk or Babble with other Sims or Learn with Flash Cards. As the Toddler advances their Communication Skill, new interactions will become available for the Toddler.\n\nUpon age up, a high Communication Skill will allow the Toddler to get a boost in their Social Skill.
Toddlers begin by stumbling about, but with time they learn to climb stairs, and eventually run. Toddlers can gain Movement Skill by going places, bobbing or dancing to music or even Stacking with Nesting Blocks.\n\nUpon age up into Child, Movement Skill will boost the Toddlers’ Motor Skill.
Toddler Care
Toddlers need others to provide for their Needs. A Toddler Bed, High Chair, and Potty will also greatly help to ensure your Toddler is getting the best care. Make sure to pay attention to your Toddlers’ Needs or you might find the Social Worker will whisk away your little tyke.
For optimal toddler happiness, you should head into Build Mode and browse the Toddler sort. Toddler Beds, High Chairs, Pottys, Tablets… everything a growing toddler needs!\n\nAll of these can be found by clicking on Objects by Room / Kids’ Room sort, and then clicking on the stack of blocks to open up the Toddlers sort.
Time for bed… or maybe it’s just time for the adults to relax. You can let your little ones sleep on the floor, couch, or a chair, but your Toddler will rest better if you click on the Toddler or a Toddler Bed and choose Put to Sleep, or Read to Sleep.
Toddlers have a special relationship with some Sims; their Parents and Caregivers. Sims that fall into one of those two groups will concern themselves with and care for the Needs of the toddler.\n\nYou can also choose to become (or remove) yourself as a Caregiver by selecting the Adopt as Care Dependent interaction in the Toddler Care menu.
Toddlers can use their diaper to fulfill their Bladder need, but maybe you don’t want a little stinker running around. Get a Potty, and Potty Train your Toddler!\n\nClick on the Potty and choose Potty Train. As your Toddler gets better at using the Potty, they will be able to go on their own with confidence!
Outfits
Identity &amp; Personality

Lot Settings

Live Mode

Create a Sim
Build Mode
World Map
The individual Sim Info Panel not only has information about the Sim's personality, but it's also a fast and easy way for you to track them down if they're away from home, even between different worlds. Click the direct play button within the Sim Info Panel to quickly dive in game and play as that Sim. It's so convenient!
If a selected residential lot is occupied, you can learn a little bit about who lives there by clicking on the household info buttons or the individual Sim buttons in the lower left corner of the screen. 
If you choose to visit a lot, the Household Picker will appear to help you choose households or Sims from either your played or unplayed households to bring with. 
In Manage Worlds mode on the Map, you'll find a number of different options that pop up in the lower right corner when you click on any lot. Depending on whether it's residential or a venue, occupied or unoccupied, you'll get options appropriate for that lot. You'll always have the option to either visit or build on any lot. Find additional actions under the more button. 
Get directly to the Map of your active world by clicking the Map button in the upper-right hud in Live mode or use the F5 hotkey.
Wants
There are multiple ways to reset your Sim's Wants. Having your Sim Wake Up for the Day or return from work can give your Sim new Wants. If you really want to see your Sim succeed at completing their Want, you can pin the Wants so they won't get reset.\n\nYou can also go to the Rewards store and spend some of those Satisfaction points you earned to buy the &quot;Want Refresher&quot; potion to reset your Sim's Wants whenever you want!
What are the benefits of completing your Sim's Wants?\n\nMoodlet Buffs are given to the Sim when completing their Wants. Allowing the Sim to do what they want will have them feeling fulfilled and happier with life!\n\nSatisfaction points are granted on completing the Wants of your Sims. This can then be used in the reward store for some awesome rewards.\n\nSome Sims might not appreciate having their Wants ignored for a long time.
Wants are back! Wants are your Sim's way of sharing their desires with you. It will be up to you to decide whether or not your Sim will follow their Wants.\n\nSims can have 3 different Wants at once, though one of them will be more about what the Sim wants at the moment.
Visitors
You can also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;invite&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; other Sims over for a visit. Open the Social app in the Cell Phone, or select a Sim in the Relationship Panel, and use the Invite Over to Current Lot option.\n\nYou’ll also find the option to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Plan a Social Event&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (for example, a birthday or dinner party) in this app, which is another way to invite Sims.
Other Sims will stop by from time to time for a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;visit&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. When you first move in, the neighbors will come over for the Welcome Wagon event—they might even bring a treat!\n\nSims will also move about in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Neighborhood&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, outside of your Home lot. Having your Sim introduce themselves to these Sims is a great way to meet new people. 
Venues
To visit a venue, click on your Sim's phone and select Travel, then select the destination!\n\nYou can also hit the [m] key to view the Map, and travel from there. Venues will have a bubble over them to indicate their venue type.
You can also create your own Venues by clicking the Build button in a lot’s option tray.\n\nChange the Venue type within the Lot Info Panel.
Sims can visit the local bar or lounge for a refreshing drink, or perhaps the park for a little outdoor excitement with friends.
Vacations
When going on Vacation, a Sim can choose to Vacation in any Residential World that contains a Vacation Rental venue lot. With certain expansions, they may also visit a Destination World instead. These are worlds that Sims may only vacation in and may not use as a residence.\n\nAfter selecting a world, choose a Vacation Rental lot for the selected Sim(s) to live in throughout the duration of the vacation.
Sims wanting to take a vacation and travel to a new locale may do so by clicking on the “Take a Vacation” interaction in the Travel section of their Phone, or from a computer. Up to eight Sims can go on Vacation together at a time. 
Turn your Sim into a walking art display by adorning their body with &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;tattoos&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! To get started, select your Sim’s body, select the Body button, and then the Tattoos button.\n\nYour Sim can have &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;multiple&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tattoos, but only one on each part of their body. Some tattoos come in different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;colors&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or swatches, which you can see once selected.\n\nIn the swatches menu you can also find a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;slider&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to change the tattoo's Opacity. Some tattoos even have sliders to edit Hue, Saturation, and Brightness!
Skin Tone &amp; Eye Color
To change your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;skin tone&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select their body, press the Body button, and then press the Skin Tone button. This button is also available in the Face menu.\n\nThere’s a wide range of Skin Tones divided into four categories; Warm, Neutral, Cool, and Miscellaneous. \n\nOnce you’ve selected a skin tone, you can further adjust it by pulling the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;slider&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. You can also save a customized skin tone by pressing the Save button.
To change your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;eye color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select their face, then their eyes. You will find many eye color options at the top of the Eye customization menu.
Hairstyle &amp; Color
You can edit the style and color of the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on your Sim’s head by selecting their head, and then their hair (or the Hair button in the menu).
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Hair color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is selected at the top of the Hairstyle menu. There are a lot of fun shades to choose from! Some even have dashing strands of gray in them.\n\nKeep in mind that your Sim will have the same hair color for every &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Outfit&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; category.
You can have different hairstyles for different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Outfits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Change your Outfit category with the Outfit buttons at the top of the Hairstyle Menu and then select a hairstyle in the menu below to set a style for that Outfit category.
There are a lot of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hairstyles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to choose from! From curly tresses and intricate braids to sharp bangs and mohawks, you’re sure to find a style that suits your Sim.\n\nTo make it easier to find what you’re looking for, you can sort by &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;category&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (Short, Medium, Long, and Updo) or use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;filters&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. For example, you can filter by Texture to look for Afro-Textured, Straight, or Wavy styles!
Face Sculpting
The most basic Preset is the full &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Face Preset&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Select your Sim's face and choose the Face option in the menu to access the Faces catalog. These are unique facial archetypes that you can select to make your Sims look appropriate for different ethnicities. \n\nYou cannot achieve the look of one shape by manipulating another, so choose carefully!
When &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;sculpting&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a Sim’s face, you have two main tools at your disposal: &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Presets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;clicking and dragging&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\nBy combining various Presets for the different parts of your Sim’s face, you can quickly create a unique look. Then you can customize it in detail by clicking and dragging to make their face match your imagination!
Then there are Presets for &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;each part&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the Sim’s face: Eyes, Nose, Mouth, Head Shape, Cheek, Jaw, Chin, and Ears. Simply select that part of your Sim’s face, and the selection of Presets will appear.\n\nSome Presets have &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;unique characteristics&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; that can’t be created by clicking and dragging, such as chin dimples.
You can adjust the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;scale&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;position&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and (in certain cases) even &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rotation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of each part of your Sim’s face! Click and drag on your Sim’s face to experiment.\n\nDepending on where you placed the cursor, you will manipulate a face part in different ways. For example, selecting the inner corner of the eyes allows you to rotate it, while selecting the outer corner resizes the eyes instead.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Rotate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim to access even more Drag options! For example, nose length can only be edited from the side view.
But wait, there’s more! While editing your Sim’s face, you can select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Detail Edit Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to get access to even more detailed click and drag options. For example, you can adjust the width and thickness of your Sim’s upper and lower lip, independently of one another!
Eyebrows, Facial &amp; Body Hair
To customize the style and color of your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;facial hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select their head, and then the Facial Hair button in the menu. You can sort by category (Beards, Goatees, Mustaches) to make your perfect style easier to find.\n\nOnly Sims with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;male&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; gender setting (found in the Identity Panel) can have facial hair.
Edit your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;eyebrow&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; style and color by selecting their head, and then their eyebrows. This will open a menu with different eyebrow styles.
Your Sim has more hair than what’s on the top of their head! You can also customize &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;eyebrows&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;facial hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;body hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nYou can select a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;unique color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for all these hair categories, or check the Match Hair checkbox to match the color of the hair on your Sim’s head.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Body hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; comes in four categories; Arm, Torso, Back, and Leg Hair. You can find them by selecting your Sim’s body, and then the Body button. You can select one option in each category, and can select a unique color for each if you wish.
Body Sculpting
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Muscle&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fat&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; adjustments apply to the entire Sim. Muscle controls define shape and size, while Fat controls a layer of 'soft' bulk.\n\n\nClick on your Sim's body to access the Muscle and Fat &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;sliders&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Click and drag the sliders to adjust them.
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;body shape&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be adjusted with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Muscle&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fat&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; sliders, and then further customized by &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;clicking and dragging&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nUse these tools to create uniquely shaped Sims!
You can also customize &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;individual body parts&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Click a body part and drag to sculpt it.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Rotate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim to access even more Drag options! For example, belly size can only be modified from a side view.
If you don't want to start from scratch, click on your Sim's body and choose the Body option from the context menu to access the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bodies&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Preset catalog. You can use these as is, or as a starting point for your sculpting.
Face &amp; Body
You can customize your Sim’s physical appearance in a number of ways! \n\nUse powerful &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Presets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to quickly create a unique Sim, or customize every little &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;detail&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to bring your imagination to life.
Camera Controls (Create a Sim)
Adding Sims
To create a Sim that &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;looks like&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; one of the existing Sims in the Household, you can select Play with Genetics. This tool makes it easy to create a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Child&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Parent&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sibling&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of other Sims in the Household.\n\n\nYou can learn more about Genetics in the Lesson &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relatives &amp; Relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Households can have up to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;8 Sims&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nA Household must have at least one Sim who is a Teen or older to move into a home.
You can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;add&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; more Sims to your Household by clicking on the Add a Sim button. \n\nChoose &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Add New Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to add a random Sim to your Household. Then you can customize this Sim to your heart’s content!
You can also add a Sim from the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by using the Add Sim from the Gallery button.\n\nOnce you’ve found a Household you want to add, use the Place Household button. You can either Merge this Household with your current Household, or Replace your entire current Household.
If you want some help to shape your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;personality and backstory&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, you can Add Sim via a Story. By answering some multiple choice questions, a custom Sim will be made for you. \n\nThe Sim’s Traits and Aspiration will be fixed, and they might get some starting Skills, Career Levels, and extra Starting Funds. You can customize their appearance, name, and gender.
Undo &amp; Redo
Use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Undo&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to undo your last action. You can then use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Redo&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to redo that action if you changed your mind. \n\nYou can undo and redo in several steps, but once you leave Build Mode, your edit history is wiped and you can’t Undo or Redo your last actions.
Time of Day
Use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Time of Day&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool to cycle between different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;light conditions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nFor example, the Afternoon setting gives great light, while the Night setting allows you to check the effects of any Lighting Objects on the lot.
Sledgehammer &amp; Bulldoze
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sledgehammer&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is used to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;delete&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a lot of Objects or features quickly! Select the Sledgehammer and either click things individually, or click and drag to delete many things at once.\n\nWhen clicking and dragging, you will delete all Objects or features in your selected area, depending on where you first clicked. Everything that will be deleted is marked with yellow.\n\nYou can also delete everything at once with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bulldoze&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool. Be careful, you can’t undo after you’ve Bulldozed!
Select
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Select&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool is used to select Objects and various architectural features such as Rooms and Roofs found on your Lot. \n\nOnce selected, they can be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;moved&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;deleted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or (in the case of Rooms and Roofs) &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;resized&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;reshaped&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nWhile using another tool, you can hit the [Esc] key on your keyboard to quickly return to the Select Tool.
Move Lot &amp; House
Do you like your house but not its location on the Lot? Don’t worry, the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Move Lot&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Move House&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tools are here to help!\n\nMove House allows you to move or rotate a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;building&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on the lot. Select a building with the tool to access the Rotate and Move buttons. You can also press the [Del] key on your keyboard to sell that entire building.
If you want to move or rotate &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;everything&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on the Lot, use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Move Lot&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool. Use the Rotate and Move buttons and then Confirm your changes.\n\nWhen you move or rotate an entire Lot, it is likely that some Objects and structures will end up outside of the Lot’s edges. These things will appear in yellow and will be sold or placed in the Household Inventory.
Eyedropper
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Eyedropper&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool is used to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;copy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; an existing Object or architectural feature, or a Wall, Floor, or Roof Pattern. \n\nClick on the thing you want to copy, and either &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;place&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the new Object or feature, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;apply&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the Pattern to a surface, as you would if you grabbed it from the Catalog.\n\nUsing the Eyedropper on an Object, feature, or Pattern will open its &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Category&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the Build Catalog.
Design Tool
Change the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the Objects on your lot with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Design Tool&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Clicking on an Object with this tool will bring up a menu of colors, or swatches. Some swatches have unique patterns.\n\nUsing the Design Tool doesn’t cost any Simoleons!
In the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode toolbar&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you’ll find all the tools needed to build a perfect home!\n\nWant to move objects and or rooms? &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Select&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool. Copy an existing Object or Pattern? &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Eyedropper&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Change the color of an Object? &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Design Tool&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. View your creation in different light conditions? &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Time of Day&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool.\n\nLearn about all these tools and more in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lessons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; below!
Object Prices
Object Catalog
Objects
This section covers how to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;buy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; new Objects from the Build Mode Object catalog; how to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rotate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;move&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;place&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Objects; Object purchase &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;price&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and more.\n\nTo learn more about which Objects Sims require to live a happy and productive lives, check out the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills Lessons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the Live Mode Category.
Lot Settings
You can change the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lot Settings&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the Venue Info Panel. \n\nChange the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lot Type&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to determine whether the Lot is a Residence or a Venue, and add &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lot Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lot Challenges&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for unique gameplay on that Lot.
Water &amp; Ponds
Landscaping &amp; Water Features
Don’t forget the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;garden&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the Lot! Create rolling hills, lush gardens, murky ponds, and refreshing pools with the various &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;landscaping tools&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Sharing &amp; Saving Your Creations
You can view all your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;shared creations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Profile&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by selecting the View Catalog button.\n\nIf you want to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;remove&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a creation from the Gallery, you can use the Remove from Gallery button in the lower left corner. If the creation is also saved in My Library, it will remain there.
Creations that you’ve saved to My Library can be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;shared later&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nSimply open the My Library tab, select your creation, and use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Share to the Gallery&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button.
This will open a window in which you can enter a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;title&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;description&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of your creation. \n\nOnce you’re done, either Save to My Library or Share to the Gallery (sharing will also save the creation to My Library). \n\nUse hashtags in the description to help other players to find it!
You can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;save&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your creations to your Library for future use, or save and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to the Gallery, so other players can download them!\n\nTo save or share a Household from Create a Sim, select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save Household&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button.\n\nTo save or share a Room or Lot from Build Mode, select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save to My Library&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the toolbar, and then either &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save Lot&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save Room&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. A Room must be selected with the Select tool for this option to be available.
Finding Creations
Upon visiting another player’s Profile, you can view their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Catalog&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of Shared Content and Favorites. \n\nYou can also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Follow&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; them, and then they show up your Feed on the News tab whenever they add something new!
Once you’ve found a creation you like, you can select it to open a more &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;detailed view&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Here you’ll find more pictures and a description.\n\nIf you like what you see, you can check out more made by the same creator. Click their name to go to their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Profile&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nYou can also use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hashtags&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the description to find other creations with similar themes. 
To &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;find creations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; made by other Simmers, go to the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery tab&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the Gallery. Let yourself be inspired by their creativity, and find content to add to your own game!
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;/b&gt;Search&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; bar, found at the top of the screen, allows you to find creations by Item Name, Hashtag, or EA Account ID. \n\nYou can also use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Trending Hashtags&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, found just below the Search, to see what’s trending among your fellow Simmers!
You can use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Filters&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; located on the left side of the screen to refine the content that is being displayed. \n\nFilters such as Popular Now and Most Popular display the creations with the most downloads. You can also narrow your results to just show Households, Lots, or Rooms.
Downloading Creations
There are two ways to download a creation to your game.\n\nIf you want to use the creation immediately, select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Place&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button in the lower right corner. If you’re downloading a Household, this will add its Sims to your current Household. If you’re downloading a Lot or a Room, these will be placed on your current Lot.\n\nYou can also add a creation to your Library by selecting the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save to My Library&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button in the lower left corner. This allows you to access the creation from the My Library tab at a later time.
Once you’ve found a creation you really like, you probably want to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;download&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; it to your own game! \n\nFirst, it might be a good idea to check which &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Packs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the creation is using. You can download it even if you don’t own all those Packs, but any item from that Pack will be removed or replaced when you place it in your game.\n\nWhen searching for creations, you can use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Filters&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to only find creations made with Packs that you own.
You can also add creations to your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Favorites&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Your Favorites can be accessed in the Catalog on your Profile page.
Gallery Overview
Go to your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Profile&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to share a Bio for yourself, view Following and Followers, and Showcase your creations. \n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;View Catalog&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is where you can go to see all of the creations you have shared or favorited from others.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;My Library&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is where you’ll find all creations you’ve made yourself and saved, as well as those you’ve downloaded from other players.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is an amazing place where you can discover thousands of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Households&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lots&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Rooms&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; shared by other &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;players&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nPost &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;comments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, get &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;updates&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from creators you are following, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your own creations for others to discover!\n\nLook for the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the top right corner of any Game Mode, or on the Main Menu, to get started. \n\nSome parts of the Gallery require an &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;online connection&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to access.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery tab&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is where you can find all of the creations made by other Simmers! Use them as a source of inspiration or download them to your own game.
Filters
It can be pretty hard to find exactly what you’re looking for in Build Mode’s huge catalogs. But don’t worry, the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Search&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Filter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; functionalities got your back!
Camera Controls
Stairs, Ladders &amp; Railings
Rooms &amp; Walls
You can also create an &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Empty Room&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by selecting one of the presets from the catalog and placing it on your Lot. \nThis is the only way to create a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Rounded Room&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
When manipulating Rooms and Walls, you may notice &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;green&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;yellow&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; highlights.\n\nGreen indicates the wall has passed through architecture that will be modified in some way.\nYellow indicates an object that will be moved to the Household Inventory, or sold.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Rooms&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are the most basic components of a building. A Room is a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;space&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; usually &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;enclosed by Walls&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, but it could also be enclosed by Fences (like a porch or balcony) or nothing at all.\n\nYou can find all the tools to create Rooms and Walls in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Walls and Empty Rooms&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; catalog.
There are many ways to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;create&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a new Room.\nClick and drag with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wall Tool&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to place a Wall. Walls can be placed along the grid, or diagonally. Once you have enclosed a space in Walls, it becomes a Room. \n\nTo create a rectangular Room in one click and drag motion, hold down [Shift] on the keyboard while using the Wall Tool, or use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Room Tool&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nThe total &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;cost&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the Room is displayed above the cursor.
You can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;move&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;resize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rotate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; an existing Room by selecting it with the Select tool and clicking the Buttons that appear. You can also rotate a Room by moving it and using the [&amp;lt;] and [&amp;gt;] keys on the keyboard.\n\nThis will also display the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wall Height&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; options. All Walls on the same Floor will have the same Wall Height. Certain structures such as Windows and Friezes may have a minimum Wall Height. They will be removed if the Wall Height is shortened to below that minimum.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Delete a Room&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with the Sledgehammer tool, or selecting it with the Select tool and pressing the [Del] key on the keyboard.\n\nYou can also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;delete an individual wall&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by clicking and dragging with the Wall Tool while holding down the [Ctrl] key.
Friezes &amp; Exterior Trims
Building
In this section you’ll learn how to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;build&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a house, or any other structure you could imagine. \n\nFrom the basics of creating Rooms and linking them together with Doors and Stairs; to the finer details such as adding Fences, Friezes, and Spandrels; you’ll find it all in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lessons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; below.
World Map
The first time you encounter the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Select&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; screen and the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Map&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, you’ll be moving your first Sims into their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;new home&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Willow Creek&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Oasis Springs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are great worlds with empty houses longing for Sims of their own.\n\nWhen moving, the Lots you can afford are &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;outlined in green&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. We suggest you pick a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;prebuilt house&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; instead of an empty lot for your first home. Hover the cursor over the lots to see the selling price and amount of bedrooms and bathrooms.
In addition to moving Sims into new homes, the World Map view is also used for &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;traveling&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;adding&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; more Households to the world, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;editing&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; existing Households and Lots, and more.\n\nLearn more in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Travel Lesson&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Map Category&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
In The Sims 4, there are several &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Worlds&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to inhabit and explore. They each have their own charm and advantages.\n\nWorlds are made up of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Neighborhoods&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and in Neighborhoods you find &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lots&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Lots can be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Residential Lots&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; where Sims live, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;public Venues&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to visit.
Welcome to The Sims 4!
Play with life in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Follow your Sims from the cradle to the grave as they explore vibrant Worlds, master Skills, climb the Career ladder, make new friends, fall in love, and start their own families! What stories will you tell?
Create your unique Sims in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Create a Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Use powerful customization features to bring your imagination to life. Create yourself, your friends, your favorite celebrities, or your wildest fantasy!
Expand your experiences by using the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to find inspiration from a community of players just like you! Add content to your game or share your own creations. Join the community, join the fun!
Build the perfect home for your Sims in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Construct the home of your dreams by planning its layout, choosing furnishings, and altering the landscape and terrain.
Welcome to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;The Sims 4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, the life simulation game in which you create and customize Sims, build and decorate their homes, and shape the story of their lives! \n\nExperience the creativity, humor, escape, and the freedom to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;play with life&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Scenarios
You can find the Scenarios in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Main Menu&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Play Scenario&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to browse the catalog, pick a Scenario, and select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Play Now&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to get started!
If you don’t know what to do in the game, or want a challenge, you should try a Scenario! \n\nScenarios kick off a story, give you additional &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;goals&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rewards&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and may change some rules in the game.\n\nIf you’re new to The Sims 4, we recommend the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Welcome Scenarios&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;: New in Town, Stuck in Their Shadow, and Parenting Predicaments.
Travel
Select your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cell Phone&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, open the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Travel app&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and then the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Travel…&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; option. This opens the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Map&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
There is a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;big world&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; waiting for your Sim outside of their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;home Lot&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\nYou can explore the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Neighborhood&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim lives in—who knows what adventure awaits just down the road—or use your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cell Phone&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to travel somewhere else.
On the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Map&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lot&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to visit and then &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Confirm&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to start your journey. You might want to visit another Sim’s home, or a public Venue such as the Gym or Bar.\n\nYou can also open the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;World Select&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; screen to visit another World!
Skills
Sims can develop a multitude of different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Why not try out Gardening, Mischief, Photography, Violin, Programming, or Fitness, just to mention a few!
Skills give your Sim all sorts of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;benefits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. For example, Cooking produces tasty meals that will make them happy, Charisma gives them a boost to relationships, and Painting a masterpiece can earn some big Simoleons!\n\nSkills are also essential to getting to the higher levels of a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Once your Sim has joined a Career, you can see any &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill requirements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. 
Practice makes perfect! Interact with special &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill Objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or other Sims to raise &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill levels&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. If your Sim is Happy, or is in the Skill’s associated Emotion, they will raise it faster.\n\nWhen they’re building a Skill, the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bar&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; over your Sim’s head shows you their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;progress&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; towards the next Skill level. You can also keep track of your Sim’s Skills in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nFor more information about specific Skills, check out the Lessons in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; section of the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode category&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Relationships
Spending time with &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;friends&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;loved ones&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is essential to (most) Sim’s happiness. As your Sim builds stronger bonds with those around them, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;new social interactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;possibilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are unlocked.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Interact&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with other Sims to build &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with them. Select the other Sim and pick &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Social Interactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from the appropriate category (select More Choices in the menu to see the categories).\n\nThe &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;outcome&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of Social Interactions largely depends on your Sim's &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. The Happy and Confident Emotions are great for making friends, while Flirty can improve your romantic advances.
Open the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationship panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to check on your Sim’s Relationships. Under each face in the Relationship panel, there’s a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bar&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; displaying your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationship score&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with that Sim. \n\nIf you attempt to romance a Sim, a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;second bar&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will eventually appear. Your Romance and Friendship score can be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;different&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; for example, Sims can be enemies and lovers at the same time! 
Needs
Your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;mental Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fun&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Social&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nInteracting with other &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sims&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and using entertainment &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; such as a TV, book case, computer, or instrument are great ways to improve these Needs.
Your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;physical Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bladder&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Hunger&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Energy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Hygiene&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nOwning and using a toilet, a kitchen with a fridge and stove, a bed, and a shower or bath tub will help you take care of your Sim’s physical Needs.
If you want to care for your Sim’s well being (or &lt;i&gt;experiment&lt;/i&gt; with it), look no further! \n\nManaging your Sim’s basic &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; allows them to live happy, fruitful lives; however, if they get low, they will experience &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;negative Emotions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and might even &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;die&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!\n\nYou can see the current state of your Sim’s Needs in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. If you click on a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Need icon&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, your active Sim will try to do something to improve that Need!
Money &amp; Work
One of the best ways to make money is joining a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Open the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Join a Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;pick one from the list&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to get one step closer to your first paycheck.\n\nYour Sim will now go to work and earn money! You can see their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;schedule&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
The key to earning big Simoleons is getting &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;promoted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Your Sim will get promoted when they fulfill their Promotion &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Requirements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and max out the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Performance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; bar. Check out the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to see your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;progress&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nUsually, Promotion Requirements are reaching certain &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill levels&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. To increase your Performance, your Sim should go to work with a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;positive Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and complete their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Daily Task&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; before going to work.\n\nYou can read more about Skills and Emotions in other &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode Lessons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
They say &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;money&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can’t buy happiness, but it sure helps to keep your Sims content! For example, you can use money to upgrade your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;house&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in it, and pay your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to keep the power and water on.\n\nFun fact: the Sim currency is called &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Simoleons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!

Smooth Terrain
This tool will smooth terrain by taking the average heights of all terrain within the brush tool. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Holding Shift and scrolling the mouse wheel will give you more granular size control.
Raise Terrain
This tool will raise terrain. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; while clicking will reverse the effects. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Holding Shift and scrolling the mouse wheel will give you more granular size control.
Lower Terrain
This tool will lower terrain. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; while clicking will reverse the effects. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Holding Shift and scrolling the mouse wheel will give you more granular size control.
Flatten to Height
This tool will flatten terrain to a specific height. Adjust height with the height slider in the UI, or hold &quot;Ctrl&quot; and the &quot;[ ]&quot; keys. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Holding Shift and scrolling the mouse wheel will give you more granular size control.
Flatten Lot
This button will flatten your lot immediately. This can be undone by clicking the Undo button in the top panel.
Flatten Terrain
This tool will flatten terrain to the height of the first clicked area. The tool will naturally snap to the minor topography lines, holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; will snap the height widget to the major topography lines. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Holding Shift and scrolling the mouse wheel will give you more granular size control.

Thinking
Thinking Skill helps toddlers throw fewer tantrums and be more capable of taking care of themselves. It reduces defiance, and helps to solve needs. Thinking Skill is improved by being curious, or by playing with Flash Cards, Nesting Blocks, or the Tablet.
Reached Thinking Level 5
{0.SimFirstName} has fully developed {M0.his}{F0.her} Thinking Skill. {0.SimFirstName} sleeps through the night and never defies. {M0.He}{F0.She} can now Learn Letters from Flash Cards and practice Spelling with Nesting Blocks.
Reached Thinking Level 3
{0.SimFirstName} can now Learn Numbers from Flash Cards with adults. {0.SimFirstName} now sleeps better through the night.
Acquired the Thinking Skill
Thinking Skill helps toddlers throw fewer tantrums and be more capable of taking care of themselves. It reduces defiance, and helps to solve needs. Thinking Skill is improved by being curious, or by playing with Flash Cards, Nesting Blocks, or the Tablet.
Reached Thinking Level 4
{0.SimFirstName} can now Ask Why of other Sims. {0.SimFirstName} now knows not to Splash in the Toilet.
Reached Thinking Level 2
{0.SimFirstName} can now Study Shapes on the Nesting Blocks. {0.SimFirstName} also defies less often.

Do it yourself! That's the motto of a handy Sim. Handy Sims aren't afraid to repair things when they break, can upgrade regular household objects, and may even dabble with a bit of woodworking.\n\nHandiness is built by repairing and upgrading objects, or using the woodworking table. Increasing this skill unlocks new craftables on the Woodworking Table and improves Sims' ability to Repair and Upgrade objects.\n\nHandiness can be mentored at Skill level 5 from a Woodworking Table or when Sims are upgrading or repairing various objects.

It can bloom with flowers and fruits galore, but such an endeavor takes time and effort, and more than a bit of Gardening Skill.\n\nGardening Skill is built by working with plants, seeds, and planters. Mega Stairs (Basic)
Look, while these charming stairs are the perfect complement to a mission-style home, you don’t literally have to live in a mission to purchase them. It just seemed like it was worth reminding people, because not a lot of people are buying these stairs.
Mega Stairs (Ooh Fancy)
Stairs are nice and all, but don’t you want stairs that will make people say “Ooh, fancy!” Well that is the exact exclamation people will make when they see the Ooh Fancy model of our Mega Stairs. And just wait until you tell them that each tile was meticulously painted by robots!
Modern Floating Stairway
Chic and contemporary in design, this set of stairs seems to float in midair.
Pragmatic Stairway
A staircase is an architectural element that allows people to move from one level of a building to another smoothly and without impediment. 
Unremarkable Staircase
Function first, aesthetics later.
Townhouse Stairway
Don't take your staircase for granted. Respect its quiet dignity and quality of construction.
Stairs
Stairs wouldn’t be complete without stairs. One floor, two floors, partial floors, all made possible with Stairs’ stairs. And each stair of Stairs is handcrafted to give Stairs that unique up and down stairs experience, only found with Stairs’ stairs. Whether your desire is upstairs, or downstairs, Stairs’ stairs will accommodate your stair needs.

{0.SimFirstName} has a piece of Plathinum!\n\nPlathinum forms magic and splendor in energy, and it's one of the needed parts used to build a time travel component.
To find Plathinum, search for rocks or dirt mounds ready to be dug up. Look closely for when they appear, or speed up the process of rock formation by using Ultra Speed from the time controls.\n\nExplore areas like parks, and seek out rocks with crystals or dirt mounds, and select Dig.\n\nA great place to look is Desert Bloom Park in Oasis Springs!\n\n&lt;i&gt;(+35 Event Points)&lt;/i&gt;
Collect Plathinum
Ironyum Obtained!
{0.SimFirstName} has a piece of Ironyum!\n\nIronyum forms the base of all matter, past and present, and it is used for building a time travel component.
Electronic Upgrade Part Obtained!
{0.SimFirstName} has an Electronic Upgrade Part!\n\nThis is a core component for all theoretical high tech devices...including coffee makers, and it's used for building a time travel component.
Electronic Upgrade Parts can be obtained in a couple of ways.\n\nRepairing a broken electronic object may yield an upgrade part. Be careful, as a fire can easily be the outcome of the unskilled.\n\nOr Select Order and then Purchase Upgrade Parts... from a Computer.\n\n&lt;i&gt;(+25 Event Points)&lt;/i&gt;
Obtain an Electronic Upgrade Part

Vegetarian-safe, Lactose free
Make Acarajé
Acarajé is a stuffed fritter made out of a dough blend of black eyed peas, salt, pepper, and onions, and is sold as a street food in Bahia, Brazil.\n\nAcarajés were introduced by the Baianas, who are prominent figures of Bahia's history. These women are the descendants of slave women who sold their Acarajés as a means of buying their freedom or that of a family member. Later on, they sold them as a source of income.\n\nThis dish, and the Baianas, are an important symbol of Bahia's African roots and everything surrounding it, are traditions that have been carefully maintained for many generations.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Acarajé
Acarajé
Power is required to cook.

Serve Fruit &amp; Yogurt Parfait
Cook Japchae
Japchae (잡채) are sweet potato starch noodles stir fried with vegetables and meat, and it is one of Korea’s best-loved dishes. It was once a royal dish, and it is now an essential dish for traditional holidays and special occasions as well. It is commonly served as a side dish but you can easily eat this as well over rice as a japchae-bap (잡채밥) or alone as a main dish.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Japchae
Japchae

To increase Cooking skill, use the Refrigerator or Stove to make food, Watch the Cooking Channel on a TV, or read a Cooking Skill Book. Skill Books can be purchased directly from a Bookshelf by using the Purchase Books interaction!

The Sims™ 4 Vampires
Transform your Sims into powerful vampires and live for eternity in an eerie new destination with The Sims™ 4 Vampires. Create a variety of vampires using all-new tools and unlock unique Powers that give your Sims supernatural abilities. Up All Night Digital Content
The Up All Night Digital Content is only available by purchasing any of the following Premium Edition, Collector’s Edition, and Digital Deluxe Editions of The Sims 4 or by upgrading The Sims 4 Standard Edition or Limited Edition with The Sims 4 Digital Deluxe Upgrade. Features the Laser Light Show, fun decorations, and outrageous party costumes to go along with two hot parties and their unique recipes!
