World Select
Recommended Worlds
I recommend checking out &lt;b&gt;Willow Creek&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;Oasis Springs!&lt;/b&gt;\n\nYou can always get more info on a World by hovering over it.
Welcome to &lt;b&gt;Residential Worlds,&lt;/b&gt; where you get to choose the perfect world for your Household to live!
This World does not have any good starter Lots for you. I recommend you select &lt;b&gt;Willow Creek&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;Oasis Springs&lt;/b&gt; instead for now!
Continue Anyway
Never Mind
This Lot doesn't have a starter home built on it. I recommend you move to one that has a starter home instead!
Bulldozing a Lot will result in no house being present. I recommend moving into a Furnished home instead!
No Starter Homes
If you decide to start on this World, you'll need to &lt;b&gt;build&lt;/b&gt; the entire home for your Household. But don't worry! You can always go back to the &lt;b&gt;Residential Worlds!&lt;/b&gt;\n\nI'd recommend going back and selecting &lt;b&gt;Willow Creek&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;Oasis Springs&lt;/b&gt; instead.
Furnished
This screen allows you to select a move in option. Since this is your first starter home, try selecting &lt;b&gt;&quot;Furnished&quot;&lt;/b&gt;\n\nDon't like the flow of things? You can always redecorate or change your furniture later!
Emily's Recommendation
Search
Focus the Camera
Interaction
Adding a new Vacation Rental lot to any world is easy! Travel to any lot that does not have a Household already occupying it. Once in Build Mode, on the upper left hand side of the screen, select the Venue Info icon. From there, the venue can be changed to “Vacation Rental” from the Lot Type drop down. This lot is now a Vacation Rental Lot. While in Build Mode, be sure to place any objects you’d like to have available to future vacationers.
While on vacation, Build Mode is locked. Sims on vacation in Residential Worlds may purchase necessities on their phone in the Household section with the “Order Supplies Now…” interaction. Destination Worlds have unique locations to purchase supplies for that world.
When Sims reserve their home away from home, the active Household must pay daily rent up front. Rent is dependent on the Lot Value for the selected Lot. There is a drop down that allows players to choose how many days they would like their vacationers to rent the lot. A total tally of cost is displayed on the bottom right hand side of this menu. Helpful Tip: Once in game, Sims may use the Travel section of their Phone to choose to extend their vacation or end it early. 
Upgrades
Some Upgrade benefits will make objects perform better, not break, or provide emotional benefits to Sims.
As your Handiness Skill improves, you'll be able to find rare Upgrade Parts and unlock more powerful upgrades.
Sims in the Focused Emotion will generally be better at upgrading household items.
Sims need to use Upgrade Parts to upgrade items. These can be found in piles of junk next to broken objects or even in garbage cans!\n\nYou can also purchase upgrade parts from the Order menu, if you have enough Handiness skill.
Traits
Sims gain Reward Traits by completing Aspirations or can purchase new Traits with Satisfaction at the Rewards Store.
Sims gain new Personality Traits when they age up, up to 3 total when they become young adults.
Personality Traits give Sims unique interactions, behaviors, and preferences throughout their life.
Writing Skill
Writing is an art that takes time. As Sims develop their Writing skill, they'll be able to write more interesting Books which will earn more Simoleons in Royalties.
Sims who are dedicated enough writers can write as their career.
Sims in the Inspired emotion will generally be better Writers.
Violin Skill
Sims with a higher level Violin skill will learn new, more challenging Songs, unlock new musical interactions, and will be able to Write Songs.
Sims in the Inspired emotion will generally be better Violinists.
Sims who write Songs via the Violin can License them on the Mailbox to earn Royalty Payments.
Video Gaming Skill
Increasing your Sim's Video Gaming skill will unlock new Socials, as well as new Interactions on the Computer.
Sims gain the Video Gaming Skill by playing on the Computer, Motion Gaming system, Tablet, and Phone.
Choose Play Game from an objects Pie Menu. Playing will build Fun, but can cause Fatigue, so take a break every once in awhile.\n\nReal world tip: Blink.
Rocket Science Skill
The Rocket Science skill is built using the Rocket Ship.  What Rocket Ship?  That's classified.\n\nOr… you could try being an Astronaut.
Space, a frontier. Some say the final one--but not the Rocket Scientist!  Sims with the Rocket Science skill see space as only the beginning!
Increasing the Rocket Science skill will increase your build speed and unlock new Upgrades for your Rocket Ship.
Programming Skill
Programming begins on the Computer. Click on the Computer and choose the Programming… menu. You can also purchase a book from the Bookshelf to learn the basics.\n\nNote: Skilled programmers can Mentor others to help them increase their skill.
Increasing the Programming skill will allow Sims to create Plugins, Games, Mods, and Mobile Phone Apps.\n\nExperienced programmers will also be able to Hack to make a few Simoleons.
Piano Skill
Sims in the Inspired Emotion will generally be better pianists.
Sims who write songs via the piano can license them on the mailbox to earn royalty payments.
Sims with a higher level Piano skill will learn new, more challenging Songs, new musical interactions, and will be able to Write Songs.
Painting Skill
Higher quality paintings can provide powerful Emotional benefits.\n\nHave your Sim paint while in an Emotion, hang your creation on a wall, and choose View to recreate the Emotions imbued within the paint into your Sim.
Sims who are good enough at Painting could sell their paintings as an alternate career!
Sims in the Inspired Emotion will generally paint better, but explore all of the emotions while painting to bring out your inner artist.
Sims with higher Painting skill are able to work in different styles and create better paintings.
Mischief Skill
Increasing this Skill will unlock new Mischievous socials on Sims and Mischievous interactions on the VooDoo Doll, Computer, and Phone.
Mischief is mainly tied to Social interactions and the Voodoo Doll. The easiest way to begin your adventure in Mischief is to click on another Sim and choose a Social from Mischief.
Logic Skill
The Logic skill benefits Sims in some careers and in Interactions like Hacking via the computer.
Sims in the Focused emotion will generally find it easier to keep their mind logically focused.
Play Chess or Read a Book to begin your journey of logical pursuits. Sims with a stronger Logic skill will be better at Playing Chess.
Logically the fourth slide should not exist, but here it is.
Guitar Skill
Sims in the Inspired emotion will generally be better Guitarists.
Sims who write Songs via the Guitar can license them on the Mailbox to earn Royalty Payments.
Sims with a higher level Guitar skill will learn new, more challenging Songs, new musical interactions, and will be able to Write Songs.
Gardening Skill
There are several ways you can speed the evolution process of your plant. Fertilization is often the fastest method. You can Fertilize plants with almost anything--from fruits to fish. The more valuable your Fertilizer, the more of a boost your plant will get.
As you level your Gardening skill you will gain access to new gardening techniques such as fertilizing or splicing. All of which you can use to become the best agriculturalist you can be.
To have your Sim start gardening, you will need to acquire some seeds. Seeds can be purchased through Planter Boxes found in Build Mode or from a computer.\n\nPurchased seeds can be found in your Sim's inventory.
When you plant your first seed click on it to Water, Weed, or Spray for Insects. Your plant's visual state should provide information about what it needs. Your plant's happiness is determined by three factors: Infestation, Water, and Weeds.\n\nThe better you take care of your plant, the faster you can Evolve it.
Once you become skilled enough, you will be able to combine plants by taking a cutting from one plant and grafting it to another. Doing this will cause the plant to grow both crops from one plant. It may also create special seeds.
Having a high Gardening skill allows you to Evolve plants. There are five Evolutions in total, stage one being normal and stage five being perfect. The more evolved your plant, the more valuable their harvest will become.
Cooking Skill
Sims with the Focused emotion will generally prepare better food.
Higher quality kitchen appliances also lead to better quality food. 
Cooking improves your Sims' Cooking skill, unlocks new Recipes, and allows your Sims to prepare tastier, more fulfilling food.
Sims with a high Comedy skill will be able to Perform Routines at a Microphone to the delight (or annoyance) of other Sims.
Eventually, your comedic timing will increase to the point where you can start writing actual Comedy Routines at the computer.
The Comedy skill allows you to Write Jokes on the computer, laying the groundwork for becoming a hilarious comedian.
Comedy Skill
Charisma Skill
Charisma is built by executing positive Social interactions and developing friendships.
Some careers will require high levels of Charisma skill, so be sure to direct your Sims to improve this and have plenty of friends!
Mixology Skill
Crafting drinks improves your Sim's Mixology skill, which unlocks new, more powerful drink recipes that are sure to delight and even change a Sim's Emotions.
The Mixology skill is crucial for hosting Great Parties and is very useful in some careers.
Sims in the Focused emotion will generally be better at Mixology.
Controlling Sims
When you select something in an Interaction menu, it will appear in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Action Queue&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nIf you’re in a hurry (or changed your mind), you can click on any actions in the queue to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;cancel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; them.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Right-click&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on a Sim’s thumbnail to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;center the Game Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on them.\n\nThe &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Home icon&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will appear when your Sim is away from their home lot. Clicking this will send them home.\n\nAn &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Away Action icon&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; appears on Sims who are not in the currently loaded Neighborhood. Clicking it will display different options for you to direct your Sim from afar. You can also choose to bring that Sim to you, or send yourself to that Sim through this menu.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Click&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on the ground, an Object, or a Sim to reveal the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Interaction menu&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\nHere you will find all the Interactions your controlled Sim has available with the thing you clicked on. More interactions can be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;unlocked&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with higher Relationship scores, Skill levels etc.
Sims will do things &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;on their own&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, but why let them have all the fun? Shape your Sims’ lives by giving them some much needed &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;guidance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!\n\nAt the bottom of the screen, you can find a row of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;thumbnails&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, representing each Sim in your current household. This is where you select which Sim to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;control&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nYou can also use the [Spacebar] to change your active Sim.\n\nYour active Sim has a green, yellow, orange, or red crystal hovering above their head. That's the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Plumbob&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Its color indicates the state of the Sim's Needs.
Sentiments
Sentiments are how a Sim feels about another Sim based on recent past experiences. There are Positive and Negative Sentiments, which can influence a Sim’s Mood and behavior when the other Sim is around! These are discovered naturally through gameplay and will fade over time. The amount of time it takes for a Sentiment to fade depends on if it is a Long-Term or Short-Term Sentiment. \n\nNew experiences together can also make existing Sentiments fade more quickly or more slowly. Positive Sentiments are easily eroded by very negative experiences, and a successful apology goes a long way towards healing any Negative Sentiments. The colored backdrop behind a Sentiment icon indicates how far it is along in the fading process.\n\nA Sim may have up to four Sentiments about another Sim at a time. If a Sim acquires more than four Sentiments about a particular Sim, the least important Sentiment will be replaced.
You can see which Sentiments your Sim has about another Sim while they are having a conversation by clicking the Sentiment icon on the Conversation Panel at the top center of the screen. This will reveal details on any acquired Sentiments with that Sim.
You can also see which Sentiments your Sim has about another Sim from the Sim's Profile, as well as the Sentiments that the other Sim has about your Sim. To view a Sim's Profile, click on the Relationships panel and find the desired Sim. Click on the Sim’s picture and choose “&lt;b&gt;Open Profile&lt;/b&gt;”. Sentiment information is located in the “Sentiments” dropdown.
If you complete a Scenario goal, your Sims will be rewarded with things like Traits, Potions, or even Satisfaction Points to use in the Rewards Store. \n\nThe Rewards Store can be accessed from a Sim's Aspiration Panel.\n \nThere are many ways to complete a Scenario, so try out new strategies and ways to play!
Romance
Different relationships offer different and interesting social possibilities available to your Sims. Begin exploring all the Romance options!
Successfully Romancing with a Sim improves the romantic aspect of their relationship.
A secondary relationship bar will appear to track your Romance. Your relationship with other Sims change as a result of both friendship and romance levels.
Relationships
The better the relationship, the more interesting the social possibilities available to your Sim!
Information a Sim learns about another Sim is stored within the &lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Sim's Profile&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;. This includes information on their current relationship.\n\nTo view a Sim's Profile, click on the &lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Relationships&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt; panel and find the desired Sim. Click on the Sim’s picture and choose “&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Open Profile&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;”. Relationship information is located in the “&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Relationship&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;” dropdown.\n\nYou also can open the Profile of another Sim by clicking on that Sim and choosing “&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Open Profile&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;” from the “&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Actions&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;” category.
Socializing with other Sims is a great way to improve your Sim's Social Need.
Relationships between Sims of different ages will now face different advantages and challenges. Sims will gain or lose relationship at different speeds depending on both the types of interaction &lt;b&gt;and&lt;/b&gt; the age of the other Sim.\n\nFor example, Child Sims will become friends much faster with other Child Sims, since they understand each other so well. But a Child Sim will find it a bit more difficult to raise their relationship with a Teen or Young Adult Sim, who might take the Child less seriously than their peers. Adult Sims will struggle to raise their relationship with Teen Sims, as Teens will often see them as uncool. But Adult Sims will have a much easier time befriending Elders.
Sims improve relationships when having positive social interactions with other Sims.
Fitness Skill
Athletic Sims lead healthier lives and will push back any excess weight gain from over-eating.
Sims in the Energized Emotion will generally exercise better.
Sims with higher Fitness Skill can Mentor and Train others of lower Fitness Skill.
Positive Emotions
Experiment with different activities to discover new positive Emotions. Be sure to inspect the Emotion's benefit by hovering over your Sims portrait in the HUD, to take full advantage of them.
Different positive Emotions convey different benefits. For example, Inspired sims are better at creative activities. 
New interactions become available and others disappear based on your Sims' emotions.
Positive emotions should be seen as an opportunity to accomplish great things. Experiment as your Sims navigate the emotional landscape.
Paying Bills
Additional Power or Water utility that the player generates for the week is detailed on the right side of this menu. These utilities are automatically set to Auto Sell and will deduct from the weekly bill when it arrives. Toggling them to Store will allow the player to accrue Power or Water until a cap is reached. Excess Power or Water utility may be sold at any time by pressing the Sell Now button.
As Sims buy more items and increase the value of their home, their bills will increase. Bills are primarily comprised of a tax on the lot’s value as well as the utility usage of objects in the form of Power and Water. 
Not paying bills will result in the possible loss of your utilities, such as Power and Water. If bills remain delinquent long enough the Repo Person will arrive and take objects to pay off any debts. 
Bills arrive in the mailbox. They can be paid via the computer, your phone, or on the mailbox.\n\nYou will get a notification reminder before your bills become late.
Click the “Show Bills Information” interaction on any mailbox to view additional information pertaining to Bills and Utilities. Hover over any line item title in the Current Billing Estimate section of the menu to learn what is affecting your upcoming bill. See the current estimate to the right.
Off-the-Grid
Family
Falling in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;love&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, having &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;children&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and spending time with &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;relatives&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be a very meaningful part of your Sim’s life! 
When your Sims develop a romantic Relationship, you can eventually ask to become &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;romantic partners&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and then &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;propose&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. You can find these social interactions in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Romance category&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nOnce engaged, two Sims can get &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;married&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;elope&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; interaction or plan a wedding by using the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Plan a Social Event&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; option in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cell Phone’s Social app&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
There are two ways to have &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;children&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Try for Baby&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Social interaction, or the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Adoption service&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; found through Hire a Service in the Cell Phone’s Home app.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Try for Baby&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; becomes available once a Sim who can get pregnant and a Sim who can impregnate build a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;strong romantic Relationship&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Adoption service&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is available for couples as well as singles.
Emotions
Taking care of your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and participating in activities associated with their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (such as reading books if you have the Bookworm Trait) are good ways to get &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;positive Moodlets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nYou can make &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;negative Moodlets go away&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; faster with some &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;self care&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Taking a shower, using the mirror for a pep talk or to calm down, or crying in bed may be helpful, depending on what Emotion your Sim is dealing with.
Sims are feeling creatures! Their current mood, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, has a big impact on what they do and how they do it. \n\nA &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;positive Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; may help your Sim to build &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, develop &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and get promoted in their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Negative Emotions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, however, may cause your Sims to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;fail&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; at things or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;stop&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; them from doing those things altogether until they feel better.\n
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is based on their current &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Moodlets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nEach Moodlet has a different strength, duration, and associated Emotion. The main &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;source&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of Moodlets are your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and recent &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;experiences&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nYou can see your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;current Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Moodlets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;portrait&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Hover the cursor over the Sim or a Moodlet to learn more!
Aspirations
Hover the cursor over each &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Goal&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for more information. As your Sim completes these Goals, they will get &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Satisfaction Points&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; that can be spent in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Reward Store&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is what they aspire to be, do, and experience! In &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, this is represented by the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration Goals&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. These can help you set the course of your Sim’s life!
Most &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspirations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; have multiple &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Stages&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, each with their own set of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Goals&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. When all of them are completed, your Sim will get a powerful &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Reward Trait&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\nYou can see your current Stage and the Reward Trait by hovering the cursor over the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration icon&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nTo &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your current Aspiration, use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Select New Aspiration&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button.
Aging &amp; Death
Follow your Sims from the cradle to the grave. As time goes on, Sims will &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;age&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and go through seven &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Life Stages&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Baby&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Toddler&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Child&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Teenager&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Young Adult&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Adult&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Elder&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nEach Life Stage offers unique &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;experiences&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;challenges&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Some Sims may have an &lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;accident&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt; before they reach the golden years of elderhood. \n\nBeware of fire, swimming while tired, and huge chunks of rock hurling towards you from the sky. Or you know, don’t, and see what happens!
You can modify the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lifespan&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of Sims, and which Sims age and which don’t. Open the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Game Menu&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Game Options&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and navigate to the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gameplay&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tab.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Auto aging&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is on by default for Played Sims. This includes your current &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;active Household&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and other &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Households&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you have &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;played&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; previously. \n\nIf you want your active Household to age, but not your other Households, select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Only Active Household&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Auto Age (Played Households)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; setting.
Dying isn’t the end! When Sims meet their untimely (or timely) demise, a Sim can begin a new chapter by becoming a Ghost.\n\nBy choosing &lt;b&gt;Become a Playable Ghost&lt;/b&gt;, the Sim will remain in the Household and continue to be playable as a Ghostly presence.\nChoose &lt;b&gt;Become a Freeroaming Ghost&lt;/b&gt; if you would prefer this Sim &lt;i&gt;live on&lt;/i&gt; as a Ghost in an unplayed Household. These Sims will no longer be a played Sim but can still be found in the World.
Live Mode
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is the game Mode in which your Sim, well, live! You can tell your Sims what to do in order to shape their lives, or see what they get up to on their own.\n\nThere’s a lot you can do in Live Mode, but to get you started, here are some basic tips: manage your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Emotions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; so they can be their best selves, join a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to make some money, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;explore&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the world to meet other Sims and discover new activities!
Lessons
Lessons are divided into &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Categories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, which each cover a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Game Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Pack&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Within Categories there are also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Subcategories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you can open to find even more Lessons. \n\nSelecting a Category or Subcategory gives you a short &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;overview&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of its content.
In the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lessons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; library you’ll find information about everything from how to customize unique Sims and mastering the build tools to how you make your Sims rich and happy (or poor and miserable, if that’s your style.)\n\nCurrently, you’re in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Getting Started Category&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of Lessons. Here you can find all the basic knowledge you need to start playing.\n\nOnce you’ve mastered the basics, feel free to browse through the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;other Categories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for more in depth information and inspiration.
What Should I Do Next?
Some Sims want to be the best, maxing out as many &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Careers&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspirations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; as they can!\n\nA true &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;virtuoso&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; might work hard to climb the ranks of the Musician branch of the Entertainment Career while leveling every instrument Skill, while a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;foodie&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; dedicates themselves to the Cooking, Gourmet Cooking, and Mixology Skills as well as the Food Aspirations.\n\nMastering Skills is also a great way to make &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Simoleons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; why not build your fortune creating &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;masterpieces&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with the Painting Skill or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hacking&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with the Programming Skill?
Last but not least, let your creative juices flow in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Play around with the tools and explore the Object catalog to discover the depth of possibility this game mode has to offer.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Recreating&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a building you’ve visited or lived in, or a floorplan you found online, can be a fun challenge. You could also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;research&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; different architectural and interior design styles, and create your own &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;interpretations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Leave reality behind&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and pull your inspiration from fairy tales and science fiction; who wouldn’t love to live in a giant mushroom or spaceship?
A popular playstyle among Simmers (Sims fans) is playing the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;same family, generation after generation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and growing an impressive family tree! \n\nHaving babies and nurturing them as they age up to Toddlers, Children, and Teenagers allows you to play with all the different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;life stages&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nDid you know the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fertile Trait&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from the Reward Store increases your chances of having &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;twins and triplets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;?
In The Sims 4, only your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;imagination&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; sets the limits! But sometimes, with near endless possibilities, it can be hard to know where to start. Let us offer some &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;suggestions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!
The world is full of things to discover! &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Explore each Neighborhood&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and experience what they have to offer. New places also offer new &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Collectibles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; such as harvestable plants, fishes, fossils, and crystals.\n\nWhy not &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;show off your discoveries&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; at home with shelves filled with fossils, aquariums with rare fish, or a flourishing garden with rare (perhaps even &lt;i&gt;supernatural&lt;/i&gt;) plants? \n\nSome &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;secrets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; exist outside the edges of the World Map. If you were to encounter a strange tree or an old mine entrance, perhaps you should take a closer look… 
Why not experiment with how Sims &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;interact&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and what impact different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Social Interactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; have on their relationships? Become the life of the party, an irresistible heartbreaker, or spread chaos wherever you go! \n\nTry one of the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspirations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Love&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Popularity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Deviance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; categories for some inspiration, or work on the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Charisma&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Comedy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Mischief&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Skill to unlock unique interactions.\n\nSims who reach Mischief level 3 can buy a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;voodoo doll&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; via a computer. Better stay on their good side…
Explore every facet of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Create a Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and see how far you can push the customization tools! Why not try to create yourself, a friend, a fairytale character, or a celebrity?\n\nWhat kind of character would make for a great &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;friend&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;enemy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;love interest&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for your Sim? Create them, add them to your world, and see what happens!\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Media tropes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be a great source of inspiration. Who is your version of the gold digger, the nosy neighbor, the hopeless romantic, the secretive hacker, or the evil genius?
Gallery
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is an amazing place where you can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your creations, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;download&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; creations made by other Players! There are thousands of Households, Lots, and Rooms to discover.\n\nUse the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to open the Gallery. It’s available in all Game Modes.
To share one of your own creations, select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save Household button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in Create a Sim or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save to My Library button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in Build Mode.\n\nThis will open a window in which you can enter a description of your creation and either &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save to My Library&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Share to the Gallery&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
In the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gallery tab&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you can browse through all &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;uploaded creations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;filters&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to the left and the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;search bar&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; at the top to help you find what you’re looking for.
Once you’ve found something you like, you can add it to your game with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Place button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or save it for later with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save to My Library button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!
Screenshots &amp; Videos
Capture your best (or worst) Sims moments with &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;screenshots&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;videos&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! In Live Mode, in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Camera Options&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, you can access buttons to take a screenshot, start and stop recording a video, and open the Screenshot Capture Manager.\n\nYou can also take screenshots with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;[C]&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; key and record videos with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;[V]&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; key on your keyboard. These shortcuts allow you to take screenshots in Create a Sim, and take screenshots and videos in Build Mode.\n\nCheck out the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Camera Control Lessons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to learn more about how to control the Game Camera so you can line up the perfect shot!
In the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Screenshot Capture Manager&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, you can delete and add descriptions to screenshots.\n\nYou can also access your screenshots and videos in a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;folder&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on your computer. It’s located at Documents &gt; Electronic Arts &gt; The Sims 4  &gt; Screenshots, or Recorded Videos.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Time&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; goes by, hour by hour, day by day. But in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;i&gt;you&lt;/i&gt; have the power to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;control&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; it!\n\nAt the bottom of the screen you can see the&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt; current day&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;time&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and access the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;time control buttons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (Pause, Normal Speed, Fast Speed, and Ultra Speed). You can also use the [0], [1], [2], and [3] keys on your keyboard.\n\nWhen all the Sims on the Lot are &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;asleep&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and you go to Ultra Speed, time goes by even faster!
Camera Controls (Build &amp; Live Mode)
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; also has a secret &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;First Person Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Hold down [Shift] and press [Tab] on the keyboard to toggle it.\n\nLeft click with the mouse as usual to interact with the world around you. You can right click through walls to move to the other side.
To &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;pan&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (move around) the camera, hold the scroll wheel (TS4 Camera) or the right mouse button (TS3 Camera) and move the mouse, or use the arrows or [W], [A], [S], and [D] keys on the keyboard.\n\nTo &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rotate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the camera, hold the right mouse button (TS4 Camera) or the scroll wheel (TS3 camera) and move the mouse. You can only tilt the camera vertically with the Sims 3 Camera Style.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Zoom in and out&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; using the mouse scroll wheel or the [+] and [-] keys on the keyboard.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Free Cam&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is great for taking screenshots and videos. Toggle it with the [Tab] key on the keyboard.\n\nMove the mouse and then use the [W], [A], [S], [D], [Q], and [E] keys on the keyboard to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;position the Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and use the scroll wheel to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;zoom in and out&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
To &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;move between floors&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, use the Go Up to Next Floor and Go Down to Lower Floor buttons, or use the [Page Up] and [Page Down] keys on the keyboard.\n\nTo &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hide or show the walls&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, use the Walls View button or the [Home] and [End] keys on the keyboard to rotate between the settings.
In &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; there’s a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;top-down Camera angle&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you can toggle with the Top Down View button or the [T] key on the keyboard.
The game has three different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Camera Styles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;: The default &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;The Sims 4 Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;The Sims 3 Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Free Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nYou can change the Camera Style in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Camera Controls menu&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Game Camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; section of the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Game Options&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (in The Sims 3 Camera, you also can invert the camera rotation).
Controls
How does one move the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;game camera&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, take &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;screenshots and videos&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;control &lt;i&gt;time itself&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;? Look no further, you’ll find all the answers in the Lessons below!
Cheats
A great Build Mode cheat is &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bb.moveObjects on&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. This allows you to place items in locations that would otherwise be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;invalid&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Be aware that some Objects might not work as intended when placed at an invalid location, but it works great for things like lush gardens and cluttered corners.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bb.ignoreGameplayUnlocksEntitlement&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be used to unlock otherwise locked Objects in the Build catalog, such as Career rewards.
Who said you had to work hard to make &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;money&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;? Just use the following cheat codes in the console:\n \n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;motherlode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; gives the Household 50,000 Simoleons.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;kaching&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; gives the Household 1,000 Simoleons.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;FreeRealEstate on&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be activated in the World Map to make all houses cost 0 Simoleons.
Bend the rules a little and try some &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;cheats&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Cheating is not a bad thing if it makes your experience more fun. \n\nTo toggle the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;cheat console&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, press &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;[Ctrl] + [Shift] + [C]&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on your keyboard. Then, write a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;cheat code&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the console and press &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;[Enter]&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to activate it.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;testingcheats on&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is a very special cheat code that unlocks more &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;advanced&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; cheats. \n\nFor example, after using this cheat code, you can use &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sims.fill_all_commodities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; cheat code to fill the Needs of all the Sims in the Household. \n\nYou can also hold down the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;[Shift]&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; key on the keyboard while &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;clicking&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a Sim, select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cheat Need…&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and then select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Make Happy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to max out all Needs, or disable Needs decay entirely by selecting &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Disable Need Decay&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Identity &amp; Personality 
Outfits
You can also browse the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Styled Looks&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; library for Outfits! Use them as they are, or as a starting point for your own styling. \n\nSwap between Styled Looks with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;arrows&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; at the bottom of the menu. Each Styled Look comes in several &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;colors&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to choose from.
The most important part of an outfit is the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Clothes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Or the lack thereof. Select your Sim’s body to try some on!\n\nYour Sim can either wear a top and a bottom piece, or a full body piece. To browse each category, select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Tops&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bottoms&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Full Body&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; buttons.
To further &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;style&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your outfits, you can add makeup, nail polish, jewelry, glasses, shoes, hats, gloves, socks, and leggings!\n\nSelect your Sim’s head to reveal the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Hat&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, head &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Accessories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Makeup&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; categories. \n\nYou can access the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Shoes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and body &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Accessories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; categories by selecting your Sim’s body.
An &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Outfit&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is a combination of clothes, hair, accessories, shoes, hats, and make up. Your Sims have several &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Outfit categories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; Everyday, Formal, Athletic, Sleepwear, Party, Swimwear, Hot Weather, and Cold weather!\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Switch&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; between the Outfit categories to create an outfit for every occasion!
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is what they aspire to be, do, and experience! Your Sim will get optional &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;goals&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; based on their Aspiration that can be completed for &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rewards&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nPick something that sounds fun! You can always &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Aspiration later if you change your mind.
To customize your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Personality&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Pick a Trait&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button and pick Traits until all Trait slots are filled.\n\nTraits have an &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;impact&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on everything from Emotions and Skills to Hobbies and Relationships. Hover the cursor over the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Trait icons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to learn more.\n\nSome &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;useful Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are Cheerful, Creative, and Flirty. These will help your Sim have &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;positive Emotions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!
Who is your Sim? You can customize their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;name&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;age&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;gender&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and more in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Identity panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nYou can open and close the identity panel with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Plumbob button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the top left corner. 
Hair
You can also change the style and color of your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;eyebrows&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Select them to display these options. \n\nMale Sims can have beards and mustaches. Click their face and then &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Facial Hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to try it out!
Does your Sim have raven locks, beach blond braids, or blue spikes? Customize their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hair&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by clicking it!\n\nYou can select your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hair color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; at the top of the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Hairstyle&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; menu, and select a style below.
Face &amp; Body
To customize your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skin Tone&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select their body, then the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Body&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button, and then &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skin Tones&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nThere’s a wide range of tones to choose from!
Select your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;face&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to customize it! You can either &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Click and Drag&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a part of the face to sculpt it, or click a part of the face and choose a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Preset&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the menu on the right.\n\nIf you select the eyes, you can also change &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;eye color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;body shape&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be adjusted with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Muscle&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fat sliders&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to the left of your Sim.\n\nIn the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Body&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; menu you can also open the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bodies&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; catalog to choose from a list of body type &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Presets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Adding Sims &amp; Relationships
To create a Sim that looks like one of the existing Sims in the household, you can select&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt; Play with Genetics&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nSelect a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;starting Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (or Sims), what kind of &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;relative&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you want to add (Parent, Child, or Sibling), the new Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;age&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;gender&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and then hit &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Randomize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; until you’re happy! Don’t forget to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Confirm&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. 
Households can have up to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;8 Sims&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Add more Sims by clicking on the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Add a Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button.\n\nChoose &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Add New Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to randomize a new Sim to customize. If you want some help setting up a backstory and personality for your new Sim, select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Add Sim via a Story&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
You can set &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; between the Sims in your household in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Household Relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; menu in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Identity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; panel.
Create a Sim
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Create a Sim&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is the game mode in which—you guessed it —&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sims are created&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\nYou can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;customize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim’s appearance, identity, personality, relationships, and more! So why not try to recreate yourself and your friends, or make the most unique Sims you can imagine?
Useful Objects
The most &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;essential&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Objects help you care for your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. A bed, toilet, shower, fridge, stove, counters, and an entertainment Object such as a TV or bookcase cover the basics!\n\nAs your Sim makes more money, it’s a good idea to buy more &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;expensive&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; versions of these Objects, as they fill Needs more &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;effectively&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Objects that help you build &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are also very useful. You can see which Skills an Object can raise in the Object’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;tooltip&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nSome good &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;examples&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are the chess table (Logic Skill), computer (Programming, Writing, Video Game Skills), mirror (Charisma Skill), instruments (Guitar, Violin, Piano Skills), bar (Mixology Skill), and garden pot (Gardening Skill).\n\nYou can find most Skill Objects in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Activities and Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; category if you browse by Function.
Here are some other &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;useful&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Objects!\n\nA &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;trash can&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;sink&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;fire alarm&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will help your Sims keep their home clean and safe.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Dining or Desk Chairs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are required to use Objects such as Desks and Chess Tables. Make sure the Chair snaps to the Table when you place it!\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Lights&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will make it easier to see at night and nice &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Decorations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will give your Sims Happy Moodlets.
Styling Homes
You can change &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;swatch&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, on most Objects with the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Design Tool&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. This is totally free!
Changing the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Floor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Ceiling&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wall patterns&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of a room can give it a huge lift for a very small cost!\n\nFloor, Ceiling, and Wall patterns can be placed one floor tile or wall at a time, or a whole room at a time by switching the setting above the Pattern categories.\n\nSelecting a pattern while in the Ceiling category will allow you to preview and change your Ceiling.
You can find &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;decor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, such as rugs and houseplants, by browsing Objects by Function and selecting &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Decorations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the dropdown.\n\nWhen the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;value&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the decor in a room is high enough, your Sims will get a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Happy Moodlet&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; when they spend time there!
The right &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;styling&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; truly makes a house a home! Changing &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Floor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Ceiling&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wall patterns&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, customizing the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;color&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of furniture, and adding &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;decor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; go a long way. Just be mindful of your budget!
When you &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;extend&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your home, you might find yourself with exposed drywall, missing windows, and mismatched roofs.\n\nThe &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Eyedropper&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; tool allows you to click on something you &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;already own&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and then either &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;apply the same pattern&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to an existing feature or buy a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;new copy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, depending on what you clicked.
Building with Styled Rooms
Buying &amp; Placing Objects
You can browse the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Object Catalog&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Room&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Function&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. It’s a good idea to familiarize yourself with where Objects are located in the Catalog. Don’t forget to scroll!\n\nYou can also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;search&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for types of Objects or individual Object names.
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in your house help your Sims to manage their Needs and Emotions, improving their Skills, and socializing with other Sims.\n\nWhen you &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;buy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; new Objects, it’s important to keep your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Household funds&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (how much money they have) in mind. \n\nOr use a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;money cheat&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, more on that in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Cheats Lesson&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Eyedropper&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is a very useful tool for &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;buying a copy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of something you already own, such as adding more chairs to a table! \n\nSimply select the Eyedropper from the menu at the top of the screen, select an Object in your house, and place the new copy.\n\nYou can also use the Eyedropper as a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;shortcut&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to a specific &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Catalog&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; category (for example, selecting a bed to open the Beds category).
To &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;buy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;place&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; an item, simply select it from the Catalog, move the cursor to where you want to place it, and click! The Object’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;footprint&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; must be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;green&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, which means there is enough space.\n\nTo &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rotate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a held Object, click the right mouse button, [CTRL + RMB] will rotate in the opposite direction. \n\nYou can also select an already bought Object to move and rotate it, or sell it by pressing the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sell button&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Basic Building
When you add or extend a Room, you probably want to adjust the house’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Roof&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to match.\n\nYou can either select an existing Roof piece and use the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;resizing arrows&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or place a new &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Roof piece&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from the Roof menu.
You can also make &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;new Rooms&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by using the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wall and Room Tools&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; found in the Walls and Empty Rooms category. Simply click, drag, and release to place a new Wall or Room!
To &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;modify&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;upgrade&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your home, there are some essential &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode tools&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; you should know about.\n\nSelecting an existing Room by clicking on its floor or walls reveals arrows that allow you to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change the shape&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; of the room. You can also change &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wall Height&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; this way!
To allow Sims and light to enter your new Room, it needs &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Doors&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Windows&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, found in the Doors and Windows Catalogs respectively. They are sorted by Wall Height.\n\nSelect a Door or Window from the Catalog, move the cursor to a wall, and click to place. The Door or Window will snap to the Wall if there’s enough space.
Build Mode
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is where you spend your hard earned Simoleons (the Sim currency) to buy better &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and upgrade your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;home&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!\n\nSelect the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button to get started.
Selecting an Aspiration Track is not a permanent decision - Sims can pursue any and all Aspiration tracks at once.\n\nSelecting an Aspiration to track will displays Notifications when those objectives are completed.
Aspirations are mid- to long-range goals for Sims that help guide them through their lifetime.
When creating Sims in CAS, you select an initial Aspiration Track to put that character on a suggested progression path.
Learn More
Lunar Cycle
As a Default Setting, there are eight phases of each Lunar Cycle. The current and upcoming phases can be tracked in the calendar, and the current phase can be viewed in the UI at the bottom-center of the screen. 
You have some control over how Lunar Cycles behave in your game. These settings can be edited in the Game Options menu under the Environment Tab. \n\nThese settings include: \n• Lunar Cycle Length\n• The Option to Set a Phase as Permanent\n• The Ability to Disable Lunar Effects on Sims

Digital Artist
&lt;b&gt;Trade: Freelance Artist&lt;/b&gt;\n\nCan a digital painting make you cry? Right now, no one knows. This is partly because many would consider the very idea frivolous. But it's also because whoever successfully answers this question must first have answered several others.\n\nWhy do we cry? Why do we laugh, or love, or smile? What are the touchstones of our emotions?\n\nUntil now, the people who asked such questions tended not to be the same people who created digital art. Instead, they were writers, filmmakers, painters, musicians. They were, in the traditional sense, artists.\n\nWe're about to change that tradition. The name of our agency is Electrified Artists.

Archery
Hitting bullseyes isn't as simple as nocking arrows and sending them flying! It can take hours of practice with a bow to be the best archer around.\n\nThe Archery Skill can be improved by practicing at an Archery Target or participating in Archery Competitions. Improved Archery Skill means more bullseyes, better competition performance, and cooler bows. It also unlocks new interactions, catching fish via Bowfishing, and some sweet archery-related accessories in Create a Sim.\n\nArchery can be mentored from Skill level 4 at an Archery Target.
Reached Archery Level 3
{0.SimFirstName} can now Discuss Archery Techniques with other Sims and has access to an upgraded bow.
Reached Archery Level 2
{0.SimFirstName} can now Start Archery Competitions at Archery Targets, and Acclaim about Archery to other Sims.
Acquired the Archery Skill
&lt;b&gt;Bullseye!&lt;/b&gt;\n{0.SimFirstName} can improve {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Archery skill by selecting to Practice Archery at an Archery Target, or participating in an Archery Competition.
Reached Archery Level 5
{0.SimFirstName} is a master archer! {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can now attempt to shoot an apple off another Sim's head, if {0.SimPronounSubjective}{S0.'s}{P0.'re} willing to risk it...
Reached Archery Level 4
{0.SimFirstName} can now go Bowfishing at fishing spots. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can also mentor other Sims in archery. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} will also use a fully upgraded bow!
Diving
For Sims who wish they could fly through the air (and look super cool while doing it) diving is the ideal water sport!\n\nDiving can be practiced at both tall and short diving boards placed beside pools. Increasing this skill will unlock new, more complex dives to perform.
Reached Diving Level 5
As a master of Diving, {0.SimFirstName} can now perform the Front Twister Flip from diving boards. 
Reached Diving Level 4
{0.SimFirstName} can now perform the Reverse Pike Dive from diving boards.
Acquired the Diving Skill
{0.SimFirstName} can head to a diving board to continue to Practice Diving. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can also perform all classic jumpstand dives from diving boards!
Reached Diving Level 2
{0.SimFirstName} can now perform the Lounger Jump from diving boards.
Reached Diving Level 3
{0.SimFirstName} can now perform the Front Pike Flip from diving boards.
Putting pen to paper (or more likely, fingers to keys) is no easy task. The blank page can be one of the most daunting foes, but writers take on the challenge of finding a way to put emotions into words day after day.\n\nWriting is primarily done on the computer. Increasing this skill will unlock new Writing Interactions on the Computer as well as the ability to Publish and Self-Publish books!\n\nWriting can be mentored at Skill level 5 from a Computer.
Reached Writing Level 2
{0.SimFirstName} can now Self-Publish Books.

{0.SimFirstName} can now Write Biography.

I have received word of suspicious activity regarding some of the ancient treasures being kept outside of the kingdoms. I have come to ensure the safety and security of these items. I am hoping to do this as swiftly as possible. I do not want to bother any of the dukes with this matter. They're just so busy, as noble people tend to be. &lt;i&gt;Coco loco, aplacando esta sed que me abraza, coco loco, que un buen rato contigo se pasa.&lt;/i&gt;\n\nCoquito is a traditional Christmas Holiday drink from Puerto Rico and some say it can be called the Puerto Rican Eggnog. Coquito is served usually after dinner and in a small glass and its taste is sweet and strong. If you are brave enough feel free to add Eggs - personally it is ok without.\n\nMany families have their own variations that are passed down through generations, but we hope your Sims enjoy this simified virgin rendition of this drink as prepared by our wonderful Sim Mixologists.
Make Coquito
Coquito
Considered often the National Drink of Brazil. This is a very refreshing and simple to make option to enjoy any festivity. According to historians, it was invented by landowning farmers in the region of Piracicaba, interior of the State of São Paulo, during the 19th century as a local drink for 'high standard' events and parties, a reflection of the strong sugarcane culture in the region.\n\nWe hope your Sims enjoy this simified virgin rendition of this drink as prepared by our wonderful Sim Mixologists.

Utranium is composed solely of Selium.
Socialite has a large amount of Peryllium in it and a small amount of Volenton.
Simtanium is mainly composed of Selium and Wolfium, with small amounts of Plumbobus.
Sadnum is made mostly of Selium, with a bit of both Plumbobus and Firaxium.
Romantium is half Melacoo, with the rest of the composition being equal parts Peryllium and Plumbobus.
Pyrite is composed of Phozone and Melacoo, at a ratio of about 2 to 3.
Punium is composed entirely of Oxypin.
Plathinum is composed primarily of Goobleck but also has some Plathium, which is what makes it so shiny.
Phozonite is made up solely of Phozone. Go figure, huh?
Ozinold is composed of both Ozinate and Alcineat, with a bit more Ozinate than Alcineat.
Obtainium is mainly composed of Alcineat, though it also has a decent amount of Goobleck mixed in.
Literalite is composed of equal parts Selium and Volenton, with a small amount of Crytacoo to boot.
Ironyum is composed of Wolfium and Plathium, with a touch more Wolfium than Plathium.
Heavy Metal is primarily comprised of Phozone, though it does have some Goobleck, which gives it that distinctive smell.
Furium is primarily Firaxium but has almost as much Oxypin and Alcineat in it.
Flamingonium is mainly composed of Melacoo but has a good percentage of Peryllium in it as well, giving it the pink hue it has.
Death Metal is made up of Plathium and Ozinate. There's more Plathium, but not by much.
Crytunium is mostly composed of Volenton, but has a decent amount of Crytacoo as well.
Baconite is composed of equal parts Sydrolin and Ozinate.
Alcron is composed of equal parts Sydrolin and Selium.
Environment: 2
Fossil Rock
An ancient deposit of sedimentary rock embedded with odd materials. Perhaps further investigation will reveal something special.
Turquoise is composed of equal parts Oxypin and Alcineat.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Uncomfortable energies.
Simanite is composed of Ozinate and Volenton, with there being a touch more Ozinate than Volenton.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal periodically makes other sims like you more and recharges the Social need.
Shinolite is half Alcineat and half Wolfium.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal doubles the chance of finding crystals in the world and recharges the Bladder need. (Thirst for Vampires, Water for Plant Sims)
Sapphire is made entirely out of Melacoo.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal recharges the Social need.
Ruby is almost all Sydrolin, but has trace amounts of Peryllium in it.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal recharges the Hygiene need. 
Rose is composed primarily of Phozone, with a decent amount of Peryllium.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Anger energies.
Rainborz is composed of a number of elements: Firaxium, Peryllium, and Melacoo, all in almost equal proportions.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal periodically makes nearby Sims happy and recharges all needs (except energy).
Quartz is composed mainly of Sydrolin, with a small amount of Volenton.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Uncomfortable energies.
Plumbite is composed of both Phozone and Plumbobus, with there being a touch more Phozone.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal boosts Athletic (Motor for Children) skill gain and recharges all needs (except energy).
Peach is composed of Alcineat and Sydrolin, with a ratio of about 3 to 1.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal recharges the Bladder need. (Thirst for Vampires, Water for Plant Sims)
Orange Topaz is composed primarily of Phozone, with a good bit of Selium.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Sad energies.
Jonquilyst is composed primarily of Crytacoo, with a large amount of Phozone as well.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal boosts Charisma (Social for Children) skill gain and recharges all needs (except energy).
Jet is composed mostly of Wolfium, with equal parts Plathium and Plumbobus in smaller amounts.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal boosts Whim Satisfaction Point gain and recharges all needs (except energy).
Hematite is composed entirely of Wolfium.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal boosts career performance gain and recharges the Fun need.
Fire Opal is composed mainly of Selium, with small amounts of Plathium and Crytacoo.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal ensures Friendly socials never fail and recharges the Hygiene need.
Emerald is composed of Goobleck and Sydrolin, with more Goobleck than Sydrolin.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Embarrassed energies.
Diamond is composed mostly of Plathium, with a small amount of Firaxium.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal boosts Fame Point gain and recharges the Social need.
Citrine is composed mostly of Ozinate, though there is some Plathium mixed in as well.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Bored energies.
Amethyst is composed of equal parts Oxypin and Volenton.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal boosts Logic (Mental for Children) skill gain and recharges the Hunger need.
Alabaster is composed primarily of Selium, but has a small amount of Alcineat as well.
When slotted into the Celestial Crystal Crown, this crystal clears a Sim's mind of Tense energies.
