Widow’s Watch
This house once belonged to a nervous sailor’s wife, who installed a plethora of windows so she could scan the sea for signs of her husband returning home. Nowadays, it makes for a beautiful family home with pleasant views of the water. 
Tiny Home Starter
This beautiful modern style tiny home is 90% completed and is perfect for those who want to get into living tiny, very fast! Move in Ready!
Centurial Harmony Garden
The perfect venue to host a lavish, traditional Chinese-inspired wedding banquet. Renewing gardens welcome guests upon arrival, their winding paths leading to the venue's various spaces. Enjoy tea with family in the wedding suite, celebrate at the private bar next door, take photos against the lobby's cherry blossom backdrop, or simply bask in the illuminated glow of the ceremony hall.
Garden Palace of Vows
Celebrate the fire of love and take your vows at this romantic, Indian-Inspired Wedding Venue. Your Sims may not be royal, but they'll certainly feel like they are, whether they're strolling the palace's halls or dancing with friends and family in the garden. It'll be the ceremony of a lifetime.
Seaside Stories
An archive of some of the best sea-shanties and sailors’ tales. Take a walk up to the top-floor deck for a beautiful view!
The Diving Pelican
Feel the salty fresh air as if you were a pelican looking for its meal, feel the rush of the water...OK, not the rush of the water, but luckily you won't need to dive in for your meal at The Diving Pelican! Elevated above sea level seafood for the masses, we just recommend to get a bigger napkin.
Casa de Flores
Rent one of the beautiful apartments at Casa De Flores today. Whether your style is vintage, modern, or more down to earth we have a rental for you! With its beautiful views, you'll never want to leave.
Commodious Residence
This Residence has generous space for the family of your dreams! With 2 stories, 4 Bedrooms, and 3 Bath, this home has enough room for entertaining, dealing with tantrums, and enjoying quiet times as a family.
Peppy Puppy Playpark
Every puppy needs a place to play! The Peppy Puppy Playpark is the perfect venue to get your little doggo outside and exercising.
Uptown Glass
This modern glass box has views of the entire city. Relax on the rooftop and enjoy the views, play a friendly game of hoops, or throw the house party of a lifetime. The Uptown Glass estate has everything you need to live your life like a true rockstar!
Bachelor's Abode
Perched up high in the quaint arts quarter, the Bachelor's Abode has everything a single bachelor could ever need. Perfect for swank rooftop parties overlooking the most creative district in all of San Myshuno.
Rooftop Treble
Let your hair down and go wild at the Rooftop Treble! One of the hottest spots in all of San Myshuno. Show off your singing skills and woo the crowd!
Newcrest Park
Perfect for a night stroll, a casual jog or a candid game of Chess. Newcrest Park is perfect to get away and indulge in much needed outside air and family quality time.
Willow Creek Picnic Spot
Have a BBQ or simply enjoy yourself in the shade of this cozy patch of nature. The Willow Creek Picnic Spot lets you dine out…outside that is!
Oasis Springs Picnic Spot
Nestled between palm trees and other desert vegetation, the Oasis Springs Picnic Spot is a great spot to spend a weekend and bask in the outdoors.
Paw-Reader’s Palace
It doesn’t take a psychic to know that the previous owner of this house was a feline fanatic.
Lost Gardens of Healing
Hidden for nearly a century, the Lost Gardens of Healing have been lovingly restored, allowing visitors to step back in time and experience a turn of the century Victorian garden. Come and share a romantic moment within the serenity of the park’s grounds, or toss a coin into the fabled well on a wing and a wish.
Willow Museum of Fine Arts
Home to some of the most esteemed pieces of art in the world, this museum also houses a cozy café on its first floor. Come for the masterpieces, stay for the caffeine!
The Cadenza Lounge
Looking to de-stress after a long week? The Cadenza Lounge has a soothing atmosphere and live music to help you relax into the weekend.
Halvsies
Halvsies is a trendy new lounge that embraces today’s multi-natured lifestyle. Even though you’re crazy busy every day, you can always come to Halvsies and embrace your other, more relaxed half.
Desert Muse
Unlike the Ancient Library of Alexandria, this desert library hasn’t been burned to the ground and lost to the ages. Check out a book now!
Llama Land Library
This 3-story garden of knowledge boasts tons of bookshelves and a rosy red interior. There’s even a kid’s play area for those little ones so the rest of the building stays nice and quiet. Come to browse, stay to learn!
Villa Bovine
Expertly and perfectly cooked Italian cuisine served daily! Enjoy a delicious pasta or a succulent steak. Bring your appetite, because you will need a lot of it!
Felicità sulla Sabbia
Ensure your Sims' &quot;I do's&quot; are set against the romantic backdrop of sea and sky. Enjoy a relaxing, easy-paced ceremony on the beach with music, dancing, lounging, and love. What better opportunity to make the promise of a lifetime than here on the beach as waves usher in a hopeful future!
Duplantier Dwelling
This old estate was a place that Claude René Duplantier Guidry once called home. It is filled with trinkets and curiosities from his travels around the world. After he died and the home was sold to the one and only Dr. Ashley, who took over the home and modernized many of its rooms while keeping the charm of the old estate. Now, this home is available once again, but nobody is quite sure what happened to the most recent owner...
Movers &amp; Shakers
This 24 Hour fitness establishment directly confronts the squishy, soft exterior of Willow Creek and throws some muscles on it. Enter the Movers &amp; Shakers and build a new you.
Burners &amp; Builders
Just because it’s steaming hot outside doesn’t mean you can get the sweat running inside. At Burners &amp; Builders, you will walk in a wrinkled sack of skin and leave a taut, well-oiled machine of peak fitness. Step in and get some gains.
The Fitbox
The place to see and be seen! Step up to the window, flex, and demonstrate those gains for passersby. Hit the treadmill, throw back a few more pounds, and pose again. The FitBox is a glamour show for peak fitness.
Green Gardens
Show off some Simoleons in this gorgeous home and its accompanying gardens. Just make sure you can pay those bills before moving in!
Jardín de mis Amores
Host a memorable and festive, Hispanic-inspired wedding celebration in this botanical Wedding Venue. Relax indoors amongst the greenhouse gardens or spend the evening dancing away in the courtyard! There's plenty of space for both romance and merrymaking.
Chez Llama
Partake in science and taste test Chez Llama’s most experimental dishes. If it doesn't look like what you think you ordered, then it is a successful and delicious meal! What? Don't be scared, they only serve edibles.
Sunny Side Up Diner
Serving the most important meals of the day any time of day.
Yin &amp; Yang
Complementary atmospheres of dark indoors and naturally lit outdoors are what this club is all about. Yin &amp; Yang displays a balance between two opposites with a little bit in each.
Club Slate
Dance the night away at this chic nightclub! If you prefer to observe, there’s a second floor balcony surrounding the dance floor. But, please come dance to avoid bothering dancing patrons.
Country Clinic
Need to go to the vet, but hate that sterile, medical feeling? Renovated from an old home in the countryside, this Vet Clinic feels warm and welcoming.
Glasswork Lover's Chapel
The perfect venue for a classic, chapel wedding. Say your vows against a stained-glass backdrop, with hopes that your marriage will be as colorful as the day you were married. Then head outside for a charming reception in the flower garden.
Hogan's Burger Bar
A restaurant crafted around the idea of a BBQ picnic - minus all the ants. This is the place to be on those days when we feel like we want to dine outside. Also, what better combination than Meat, Cheese and Carbs? Bring these all together and you have the ingredients for a great restaurant.
L’Attente Bistro
You will want to line up and wait many hours for a spot to try their delicious recipes. No, we don't have a clue as to what their dishes are. We are still waiting in line!
Oasis Springs Dust Bowl
Is it a mirage? No, it's an oasis of affordable entertainment! Finally bowling has come to Oasis Springs so you don't have to kick rocks in the desert to pass the time.
Creekside Smooth
A Willow Creek classic, Creekside Smooth is the high end bar for lovers of a smooth, jazzy atmosphere and the crisp libations of veteran mixologists. Fill your glass and strike up a conversation - you’re in smooth!
Patchy’s
With a scruffy, “hairy guy next door” name like Patchy’s, you know you’re in for a fun when you step foot in this local neighborhood bar. Saunter up to the bar for a cold beverage then meet some cute young things on the dance floor. When you’re at Patchy’s, you’re in for a good time!
Suspended Modern
Take a relaxing walk through the museums garden to gather inspiration. Climb the spire to enjoy life's greatest creations, from the top artists around the city. All locally curated, and put on display for your enjoyment.
Classic Wooden Ladder
You can climb it up. You can climb it down. Then back to the top and slide waaaaaay down!

Live Houseplants
The household has acquired a Live Houseplant!\n\nLive Houseplants look fabulous in any space, both outdoors and in, with far less commitment than Gardening plants. Houseplants won't grow larger or produce harvestables, but caring for them is easier and more pleasurable for most Sims. Just don't neglect them! &quot;Easy&quot; care doesn't mean no care, and Sims will feel guilty about letting Live Houseplants die.

Self-driving cars are yesterday's news. Our company is developing self-piloting hang gliders. Transportation of the future! We're just having a few fairly insignificant problems keeping them away from power lines. Would you take a look?
I'm having trouble with my robot army. They just want to sit around and drink coffee. Will you look into why they're so lazy?
After seeing one at that conference, I NEED to have a mechanical mixologist. I built one from household scraps, but can't get the UI working. It's only making soda water! I'll pay you to fix it. No price is too high!
My phone icons seem drab and dull. Could you write an application that would make all of the icons wear tuxedos? Now that would be fancy!
We just did a security analysis of our company systems and let's get to the point, things are bad. How is it possible that everyone's password is ********? You have to help us!

Royal Palm
Dramatic of profile and with over 2,500 species worldwide, the palm  is a symbol of victory and abundance.
Majestic Palm
Palm trees are low-maintenance ornamental trees that offer dramatic foliage and lend a tropical ambiance to any landscape.
Ponderosa Pine Tree
Bright green needles and a pleasantly pronounced fragrance distinguish these trees, which are particularly suitable as windbreaks and for erosion control.
Mesquite Tree
Not just a barbecue flavoring, mesquite is a drought-tolerant if rather thorny tree, making it a good landscaping choice for arid settings. 
Upright Cypress Tree
Plant a row of fast-growing cypress trees for an instant, evergreen privacy screen.
Slender Cypress Tree
Prune this fast-growing ornamental tree early and often for best landscaping results.
Elm Tree
Elms are among the most widely planted ornamental trees in the world. They make excellent shade trees.
Ornamental Bamboo Tree
Botanically speaking, bamboo is classified as a grass rather than as a true tree. Bamboo grows quickly and can be a pest when not properly maintained.
Quaking Aspen Tree
So named because its leaves appear to tremble in the slightest of breezes, the quaking aspen provides spectacular color in the fall.
Weeping Cherry Tree
Observe the charming practice of &quot;hanami,&quot; or pickinicking under a cherry tree in spring, beneath the hanging branches of this beauty.
Upright Cherry Tree
Cherry blossoms signify the ephemeral beauty of life. Cherries also symbolize innocence and love; they are a popular flower at weddings.
Weeping Willow tree
Why does the willow weep? Enduring symbols of grief and lost love, weeping willows favor marshy ground and grow aggressively.
Pine Tree
Pine trees are the ultimate coniferous evergreen, known for their decorative cones and resinous sap. They smell nice, too.
Oak Tree
The mighty and regal oak tree is a symbol of courage and endurance; druids gathered in sacred oak groves to perform their secret rites. 
Southern Magnolia Tree
Magnolias are prized for their showy, fragrant flowers. They are among the first trees to bloom in spring.
Ornamental Magnolia Tree
Magnolias have a wide, shallow root system and do not tolerate being crowded; make this tree a centerpiece of your landscaping instead.
Graveyard Cypress Tree
Cypresses are traditionally planted in graveyards and are thus a symbol of mourning -- perfect for your uber-Gothic garden.
American Beech Tree
Nature lovers are fond of beech trees, as their nuts provide an important food source for wildlife such as turkeys, porcupines, chipmunks, wood ducks, and jays.
European Beech Tree
Beech trees require a humid atmosphere and well-drained soil to thrive. They prefer slightly shady conditions and should be given plenty of space to grow.
Evergreen
For a pine-scented evergreen, this is your go-to choice.
Hawthorne Tree
Also known as the thornapple, whitehorn, or mayhaw, the hawthorne produces masses of small white flowers and small apple-like fruits.
Norway Spruce Tree
Unlike other conifers, spruces tolerate humid weather well. They are also highly resistant to deer damage, and their handsome looks last all year round.
Birch Tree
The birch tree is best-known for its striking white bark dotted with large dark &quot;eyes.&quot; Birches are tolerant of a wide range of conditions and thrive in poor soil.
Japanese Beech Tree
Beech trees are durable landscaping trees particularly noted for their beautiful bark.

Year of the Pig Statuette
&lt;i&gt;This Pig statuette was granted for the New Lunar Year of the Pig, starting in February 2019.&lt;/i&gt;\n\nEvery new lunar year, the countryside animals celebrate in a grand hall decorated with symbolic sycees and paper lanterns.  This year, the new year arrived without the honored animal.\n\nThe Pig arrived near the party's end and sat at a table in quiet embarrassment, noticed by the Goat. With all red envelopes gifted and food eaten, the Goat plucked a kumquat from a potted citrus tree and offered half to the Pig. She accepted with relief and explained she could not find anyone to care for her piglets until friendly Crows returned to her farm. With the Goat's understanding and help with introductions, the Pig's embarrassment melted away to happiness during the remaining festivities.\n\nThe celebration ended at sunrise, and the Goat accompanied the Pig home. They decided their children should meet and exchange panda toys as friends, just as they had become.\n\nIt is okay to be last and late. Good friends will wait for you.

With her arrival, the Crows awoke and recounted how excited her children were for the new year.\n\nAs they were leaving, the Pig retrieved a metallic object from a mantle and offered, &quot;I have nothing of value that matches the good fortune I've had tonight save for this heirloom, so I wish to pass that luck to you in gratitude.&quot; The Crows left with a promise to visit again soon.\n\nAt their nest, the Crows examined the sycee quizzically for a while, and tried prying it open. Study of the Human Form
Before painting his most famous opus, artist Jean-Jacques PePe did sketch after sketch of his maîtresse Jeanne. She grew so old in the process, he had to start over with her daughter Deanne. These sketches are from the 27th year of sitting, and include a rare male form.

Painting the most ordinary things can take extraordinary talent. In this masterpiece, the artist has depicted an astonishingly vast array of objects. It is said he began with two apples, but took so long to finish, he devoured one halfway through.
Ode to Jazz Triptych Trio
One thing Princess Cordelia simply couldn’t fit on her submersible was her beloved jazz band. She so missed their music that she painted a series of pictures to commemorate it. Framed in celebratory gold frames, this collection reunites three of her favorite musicians-may they play together in peace on your wall.
Ode to Jazz Wall Painting 2: “Goldentips” in Gold
When Princess Cordelia was forced to flee her kingdom, she had to leave her beloved jazz band behind. Framed in a celebratory gold frame, this wistful silhouette portrays the sax legend Jacob Goldentips still playing in the depths of the sea, which was how the Princess liked to imagine him. [Must be placed on at least a two-story wall.] 
“Blooming Beauty” Wall Painting
Of course, there were no flowers in Princess Cordelia’s subaquatic life, but she had an acute memory of the vases and vases of them that once adorned the Royal House. Oh, the fragrance! Princess Cordelia couldn’t replicate the scent of course, but her painting was quite lifelike.
Land-Coral Garden
Princess Cordelia painted this before gradually fleeing from the giant sloths. Photographs were not commonplace yet, so this painting was all she had to remind her of her old palace’s painting studio. While sitting comfortably on her escape submarine, she changed the name from “Flower Still Life,” to “Land-Coral Garden.”
The Pianist
Not all of Princess Cordelia’s entertainers perished in the Great Sloth Invasion. This pianist knew that if his body was to perish, his name must live on for him. So, he rolled his piano out atop the submersible and played until it went under.
Etude in Blue
Just like music, art can be a celebration-of things we love, of experiences we adore, of people left behind. This abstract painting is a beautiful reverie, a nostalgic tribute to the ne’er-to-be-forgotten performances of years past.
Ode to Jazz 6: “Ghost Quartet”
Some days, the thought of her long-lost jazz musicians was simply too much for Princess Cordelia to bear. She even went so far as to have new instruments made, but with no one to play them, all she could do was paint pictures of them.
Jazz Cats: Whiskers of a Forgotten Past
One thing the Princess was thrilled to leave back in her former kingdom was cats. They shed everywhere and made her sneeze! But nostalgia is a funny thing, and so the princess found herself painting them. As you can tell from this design, her portrayals were a touch romantic.
Saxophone in Silhouette 
Great jazz is hard to come by, especially in the depths of the sea, so Princess Cordelia commissioned a mute reproduction of glorious jazz music. 
Floored by Symmetry Standing Mirror
There it is again. The pure, clean lines of an adulterated rectangle. And shining forth from the heart of its simplicity? You. Stunning!
Captain Chaz MacFreeling Mirror
Princess Cordelia’s second pirate boyfriend was handsome and, relative to other pirates, had good hygiene! Things started off great, but the princess noticed him looking in the mirror all the time; so vain. She promptly sent him on his way, giving him a handful of citrus for any future scurvy outbreaks, and naming all her mirrors after him.

Vision Of You Mirror

The Obverse

OTP Split Mirror

The Food Annihilator
Our microwave will blast your leftovers with radiation so thoroughly and with such intensity that no living thing should approach it for decades. Other microwaves just raise your food’s temperature slightly, but when you want food that’s been permanently sterilized, there’s only one name in the business: FOOD ANNIHILATOR.
The Wavescatter
Built with salvaged materials from discarded 80’s electronic children’s toys and assembled by haphazardly-trained gerbils, the Wavescatter is the perfect microwave for the budget-conscious bachelor who loves his meals burnt on the outside and frozen in the center.
The Omniwaver
For the finest in microwave cooking, it has to be the Omniwaver. This incredible device bombards your food with a previously undiscovered form of radiation. We can’t promise that the omicron waves will cook your food faster, or hotter, than conventional microwaves, but man they really bring out the flavor somehow!
The Schmapple Micro
What if a microwave could give you less of what you don’t want, and more of what you don’t realize you need? Things like a larger viewing area, and three life-changing colors? Well you can have it right now. Introducing: The Schmapple Micro. It’s Microwaves, to the Power of You.

Meteorite

It was going to be spectacular, and had to settle for a slightly less graceful landing, but nonetheless! It demonstrated a high caliber of professionalism. Island Mahogany Grand Sliding Door
The closest form of civilization to East Shore Chateau was a small coastal fishing village. The community watched from afar as Mason Lupoe first purchased the estate and soon after began repairs. The sounds of saws and hammers echoed through the dense surrounding jungle, washed out by the nearby waves breaking against the beach. Then one day... nothing.\n\nNo sim came or went from East Shore Chateau, and it remained disturbingly quiet as weeks stretched on. Mason Lupoe, himself, was declared missing. Investigators and anyone looking into the disappearances also seemed to vanish in the shadow cast by East Shore. It was at that point, the community made a decision. The estate was to be torn down from the outside in.\n\nAnd so it was done. Plank by plank, window by window, the estate was dismantled—its fine furnishing and trim re-purposed around the island. The doors were sold in an auction. It is said... that on humid summer nights the doors can be heard sliding open and closed as the spirits of those missing pass through.

Various species of vibrantly plumed birds and neon specked frogs called its dilapidated remains home. Few locals who remained on the island remembered the mystery surrounding its downfall—even fewer still spoke of it.\n\nIt was inevitable that when Mason Lupoe bought the mansion, it would cause quite a stir...

Preliminary readings suggest that this &quot;skeleton&quot; emits a constant stream of short-wave transmissions--often involving what appear to be numerical tallies.
Dead Blue Slug
Extracted from the body of its prior host, the specimen continues to move even after other life signs have long since faded. 
Dead Pink Whale
This organism's vital fluids contain traces of phosphorus, glowing for a short period of time when exposed to oxygen. The next &quot;fossil&quot; fuel?

Fossilized Udder
Every scientist knows that prehistoric cows had rows of jagged teeth like a mako shark. No wonder, then, that their udders evolved to be very tough. That's why this specimen is almost perfectly preserved eons after these gentle giants roamed the world.
Fossilized Whatzit
This fossil has stumped experts from every conventional scientific discipline. No one knows what it really is.
Fossilized Alien Skull
This could be the evidence needed to confirm that there are other forms of life in the universe!! Or it could be papier mache -- science has no way of telling!
Pre-Pre-Pre Sim Head
Australosimicus afarensis, or &quot;Pre-Pre-Pre Sim,&quot; lived between 3.9 and 2.9 million years ago! Not that WHOLE time, of course, that's just a range of possible… Look, this is a rare find and it should be treasured!
Perfectly Preserved Mustache
This fossil marks the passing of an ancient gentleman of true class. A gentleman who fell face-first into some ancient mud.
Prehistoric Bird
This is a near-perfect preservation of Raptor Erraticus, which was known to fly in random, crazy patterns to distract predators. A downside to this particular defense was that the bird often flew into trees or rocks and was immediately killed.
Prehistoric Rock
In prehistoric times rocks were shaped like sharp little triangles, which ancient hunters would use to catch food. Over time people began to plant, farm, and raise livestock. They had no more need for these rocks, and so the rocks evolved into the smooth blobs we see today.
Enormous Trilobite
Trilobite means three lobes. It does not mean being bit at a strength three times a normal bite. If that were the case, arthropods would be terrifying!
Pre-Historic Hoofprint
An ancient caveman preserved animal footprints as a hobby, displaying them in a popular museum-cave for all the other cavepeople to cave-enjoy. What an amazing convenience it was for modern anthropologists to find these preserved footprints all in one place!
Fossilized Sim Hand
This fossilized hand serves as a somber reminder that excessive and overzealous high-fiving can lead to tragedy.

FitzHerbert Column
An architectural column reminiscent of antique staircase spindles.
Annesley Square Column
A column designed to imply classical influences without actually committing to them.
Grosvenor Column
There's no such thing as excess when it comes to outfitting your architectural column.
Soledad Square Column
A solid square column enhanced by sharp corners and severe lines.
Buenaventura Column
Square geometric patterns help to add interest to an otherwise rather plain architectural column.
Mega Column (Basic)
Just because you decorate your house in a simple arts and crafts style doesn’t mean you can’t add a little class to the place. A few marble columns will make people say “Whoa. Where’d all this class come from?” You gotta get yourself some marble columns!
Mega Column (Budget DeLite)
We were admiring the use of straight lines in mission-style design, and someone said “Hey, you know what’s really straight? Columns!” So we designed a series of columns. Here’s the Budget DeLite version for beginning column collectors.
Mega Column (Deluxe)
Are you prepared to start collecting columns with the big boys? Ready to take that next step? You will NEVER find another column that is both as straight and as round as this one. We know because we asked robots to design it. The Deluxe Mega Column: because you are seriously not messing around anymore.
Capistrano Round Column
This column stands tall, free of extraneous adornment, its simple round shape enough to enliven the eye.
Tintoretto Column
Square column, round cap, Italian inspiration.
Greco-Roman Column
A round column with a square cap reminiscent of ancient architecture but without the frills.
Design Calabria Hexagonal Column
A hexagonal fluted column with a wide cap.
HBD Classic Column
Not to be outdone by the classic simplicity of the rest of its series, this stately column stands tall at any height without making you feel like it's looking down at you.
Check and Mate!
Sleek boards and nimble fingers. Come for the chess but be prepared to stay for the night.

Platforms are found in the Build catalog in the same section as Walls and Rooms. Customize your Platform Trims with options that can be found in the Walls and Empty Rooms Section.
Add a platform to any lot or room by placing one of the platform shapes provided in the catalog. Make a platform taller or sink a platform lower using the new “up” and “down” arrows present in the UI when a platform or room is selected. Platforms that are higher than one stair step need stairs or ladders in order to be accessed by Sims.
Move Whole Lot
The Move Lot tool can be found at the top tool bar under Move Lot and House.\n\nWhen the tool is selected, everything on the lot is grouped together and selected. A context menu provides options to pickup, rotate, and confirm placement.
The &quot;Move Whole Lot&quot; tool allows players to move and rotate the entire contents of a lot. This tool is helpful for lots placed from the Gallery as well as moving houses along any landscape. 
Portions of the lot can be positioned outside the lot boundary. Anything outside the lot boundary is highlighted yellow and will be not be placed. Objects removed from outside placement will be stored in the Household Inventory.
Community (Venue) Sort
In Build Mode, players can easily sort items needed for Venues using Venue Sorting. Under Objects by Function, the default drop down displays all objects that satisfy the specified venue type.
Of course - if you want to just see EVERYTHING - you can do that as well.
Players can also choose to only show Community items.  These objects are not required to be in venues, but are generic Venue items.
Basements
Since basements are set below terrain, you cannot place windows or doors along the outer walls of the basement.  Exterior walls also cannot be deleted.
Basements have a ton of new possibilities!  Create underground labyrinths, or   underground laboratories that are surrounded by pools.
Basements can be placed at ground level by using the Basement tool, or by moving the camera below-ground and placing rooms as normal.
Basements can be placed up to four levels deep. Floors and ceilings can also be removed. In order for Sims to access basements, make sure to place some stairs!
Basements can be placed as functional rooms below terrain level. In Build Mode, the basement tool can be found under Walls and Empty Rooms.
Use the Day/Night indicator to change the lighting in Build Mode in order to view your lot under different lighting conditions. The lighting does not persist when you exit Build Mode.
Once you get going in Build, you will want to familiarize yourself with the various tools that are available to make customizing your home easier. Eyedropper, Sledgehammer, Design Tool, Move House, Select, and Bulldoze Lot… to name a few.\n\nSo dig in, and start building!
Save to Gallery
To share your Room for other Sims players to view, click on the Share Room to the Gallery button.\n\nAfter your Room has been shared, you can add and remove comments, and share your lot to Facebook.
Use the Gallery to manage your saved Lots and Rooms by selecting the My Library tab, and clicking on your saved Lots and Rooms.\n\nFrom here, you can Share and un-Share your Rooms and Lots, Delete them from My Library, or Bring your Room or Lot into Build Mode to play with once again!
Saved Rooms can be found in the Gallery menu under the My Library tab, as well as in the Rooms and Walls build catalog sort by choosing the Saved Rooms sort.
Click to open the Save to Gallery menu and choose Save Room if you just want to save a single room, rather than your entire lot.\n\nNote: You will need to select the room you want to save before choosing this option.
To share your lot for other players to view, click on the Share Lot to the Gallery button.\n\nAfter your lot has been shared, you can add and remove comments, and share your lot to Facebook.
Open the Save to Gallery menu and choose Save Lot in order to save your lot to My Library in the Gallery.\n\nAdd a lot name, description, and set the bed and bath count for your lot, then click on the Save Lot to My Library button to add it to the Gallery. This does not share it for others to view.
Save Lot and Save Room are both ways in which you can save your creations for future use or to upload to the Gallery to share with other players.
Click to learn more about Styled Rooms.

Room Tool
Drag to create a room. To delete, hold Ctrl and draw over the existing room to delete it. While in draw mode, hold Shift to switch to the Wall Tool.
Wall Tool - B
Drag to draw a wall. To delete, hold Ctrl and draw over the existing wall to delete it. While in draw mode, hold Shift to switch to the Room Tool.

Pool Tool
Hint: Click and drag to create desired pool shape. To quickly delete, hold CTRL and draw over the existing pool.

Wiggly Infant
{0.SimFirstName} is a Wiggly Infant. These infants are always on the go and want to play and move about; however, they often struggle to fall asleep or pay attention for extended periods of time.
Vegetarian Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Vegetarian. Vegetarian Sims avoid foods made with meat, such as chicken, beef, and fish. These Sims also may get sick from consuming foods made with meat.
Sunny Infant
{0.SimFirstName} is a Sunny Infant. These infants are bursting with smiles and giggles and enjoy engaging with other Sims, but they do require more social attention.
Snob Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Snob. Snob Sims love to critique the work of others and prefer the companionship of fellow Snobs.
Slob Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Slob. Slobs aren't bothered by filthy surroundings and tend to create messes more quickly.
Sensitive Infant
{0.SimFirstName} is a Sensitive Infant. These infants are inclined to get diaper rash, be picky with food, and can more easily become overstimulated by too much play and social interaction, however they also rest more peacefully through the night when soothed.
Self-Assured Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is Self-Assured. Sims with this trait feel good about themselves and often experience extra Confidence. 
Romantic Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Romantic. Romantic Sims tend to be Flirty and need to infuse their lives with Romance often.
Perfectionist Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Perfectionist. Perfectionist Sims take longer to craft things, but tend to craft items of superior quality. 
Outgoing Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is Outgoing. Outgoing Sims need to socialize more often, but are Emotionally strengthened by doing so.
Neat Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is Neat. Neat Sims are deeply uncomfortable in a cluttered home, but thankfully are Happy when cleaning and can Clean House.
Music Lover Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Music Lover. These Sims need music in their lives often and are Happiest when playing music or discussing it with others.
Mean Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is Mean. Mean Sims become Happy when they say Mean things to other Sims.
Materialistic Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is Materialistic. Materialistic Sims need to buy new things and enjoy admiring and discussing their belongings.
Loves The Outdoors Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} Loves the Outdoors. Getting outside often is a requirement for these Sims, but the Emotional reward is worth it.
Loner Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Loner. Loner Sims are happiest in solitude and are wary of groups of strangers.
Lazy Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Lazy Sim. Lazy Sims enjoy TV more than others, can lounge anywhere, and don't care much for physical activity.
Kleptomaniac Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Kleptomaniac Sim. Kleptomaniac Sims become tense if they have not Swiped any objects recently, and will also gain a boost of energy after a successful object Swipe, careful not to get caught Swiping objects as this can make a Kleptomaniac Sim embarrassed.
Jealous Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Jealous Sim. Jealous Sims gain a boost of confidence when near their Significant other but can also get uncomfortable when they are not around them.
Intense Infant
{0.SimFirstName} is an Intense Infant. These infants have big emotions and are easily entertained, but they are also more difficult to calm when in a bad mood.
Erratic Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is Erratic. Erratic Sims live an Emotional roller coaster that is unpredictable. 
Hot-Headed Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} is a Hot-Head. These Sims tend to be Angry, often to the detriment of those around them.
Hates Children Lesson
{0.SimFirstName} Hates Children. These Sims fear parenthood, loathe the presence of children, and become Happy from being mean to younger folk.
Grouch Lesson
Grouch Sims will claim that they aren't really grouchy, just misunderstood. Either way, they definitely get great joy from making those around them miserable with their pranks and approach to social interactions.

Ondarion
The regal Kingdom of Ondarion takes its name from the emerald sea that unites its three great shores. It is upon these same coastlines that three distinct cultures, connected by one sea, live together and exchange traditions. Together they have forged a grand legacy of Nobility and aristocratic Dynasties, which has lasted for countless generations. To this day the Nobles of Ondarion duel each other through political plays and battles of succession, in the race to the ultimate goal: the Kingdom's Royal Crown.

Forgotten Hollow
The small town of Forgotten Hollow has remained virtually unchanged for the four generations it has existed. All of its original town founders disappeared shortly after the town was founded. All except for Vladislaus Straud. His great grandson, Vladislaus Straud the IV, still watches over the town to this day.
Unique Flora
Local History
Rare plants like Plasmafruit and the Sixam Mosquito Trap can be only found here
Tour relics of founders and meet residents that have “lived” here for generations

Moonwood Mill
Once upon a time, Moonwood Mill was filled with the bustle and sound of the nearby lumber mill. Today, the town is transformed. The rusted shells of its former industry provide cover for a handful of mysterious denizens who've sought out this wilderness-shrouded community, basking in its remote and anonymous nature. It's a place with a hidden history, and those who live here know that if you dig deep enough, you're bound to discover some fascinating secrets.
Mysterious Sightings
The mysterious silhouettes lurking in the wilderness' trees are enough to make any visitor's fur - erm, hair - stand on end.
Natural Wonder
Surrounded by miles of wilderness and enriched by rare fauna and flora like the Luna Fish and Moonpetal Flower, Moonwood Mill is a nature-lover's paradise.
Local History
This former lumber mill town may be a bit quiet, but dig a little and you're sure to surface some secrets from the past... and present!

Businesses &amp; Hobbies
Businesses &amp; Hobbies
Nordhaven
This northern coastal city is known for its thriving, independent local businesses and the enchanting beauty of its cold seasons. Take a walk through the historic views of Gammelvik with its cobbled streets, classic architecture, and picturesque canals. Or hop on the train to Iverstad and explore how the locals are reinventing the industrial city center. Whether you seek to make your business flourish or just want to practice your hobbies with a cozy community, you will always find an opportunity here.
Get Inked
Feeling daring? Visit a tattoo studio in Iverstad to mark your skin with a good memory.
Practice Your Hobby
Visit the market squares for daily hobby meetups, where you can learn a new skill while making new friends!
Old Town Charm
Spend a romantic day in historic Gammelvik! Grab a hot drink from the market, walk the canals, and stop at a fishing spot to help keep them clean.

Play with The Sims™ 4 Snowy Escape!
Here is a list of some of the experiences you can have during your trial of Snowy Escape:\n\n&lt;ul type=&quot;circle&quot;&gt;&lt;li&gt;Style your Sim with Japanese-inspired outfits&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Tackle the mountain by foot, ski, sled, or snowboard&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Meet forest spirits and Yamachan, the town mascot!&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Create a Zen Retreat with Shoji Doors, Paper Lanterns and Tatami Mats&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Warm up in the hot springs of the Onsen bathhouse&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Bond two Sims during an epic mountain climb&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Learn and get the benefits of a Lifestyle, by repeating favorite activities&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;
Snowy Escape
Mt. Komorebi
Locals have enjoyed the healing hot springs of Mt. Komorebi for centuries. Now, thanks to the modern snow sports resort in Yukimatsu, everyone else can, too! The region has become a hotspot for tourists looking for a vacation that's equal parts relaxing and adventurous. With so many new visitors, there have been a lot of changes to the rolling forests that surround Mt. Komorebi. Hopefully, the area will be able to maintain the charm that drew so many Sims to it in the first place.
Mountain Climbing Excursion
Plan a group Excursion and attempt to reach the summit of Mt. Komorebi
Onsen Venue
After a fun (or painful?) day of frolicking in the snow, relax and recover in the Onsen’s healing hot springs
Snow Sports
The mountain town of Yukimatsu is a snowy escape for skiing, snowboarding, sledding, and rock climbing

Bedroom Bliss
Bring the neighbors together – literally – and experience multi-family lots as a tenant or property owner in The Sims™ 4 For Rent Expansion Pack!
For Rent
For Rent
Tomarang
Grown from humble roots off the coast of Shih Sea, Tomarang is lively with local fare, community chaos, and legends of lore. Known for its tight-knit communities and sun-filled shared spaces, Tomarang is a lush landscape of possibilities. Come cozy up with nature or fish around for neighborly niceties and whim-simsical secrets. Whether you're flying solo or raising generations, this region offers a warm welcome to any multi-living lifestyle! Sul Sul De-Kah!
Rich History
Dive into the lore of the land and discover hidden secrets, historical battles, and legendary &lt;i&gt;tails&lt;/i&gt;.
Local Living
Embrace community and take a minute to get to know the local neighbors. Poke for local gossip, join in a game of marbles, and enjoy the warmth of this tight knit locale. 
Night Market
Visit the famous Tomarang Night Market for some after-dark shopping and mouth-watering cuisine!
Closeness can create harmony – or drama! Sims in Residential Rentals will get tangled up in each other’s lives. They’ll socialize at potlucks, meet in the garden, and have opportunity to discover each other’s secrets by eavesdropping and snooping.
The New Lot Type in Town
New Residential Rental lots give you the chance to get creative with multi-family dwellings. Give your Sims a basement suite to rent out, create a duplex to keep two families close, or even build apartments.
Property Management
Property Owner Sims can be present, living among their tenants, or they can live in a separate residence while generating income from several property investments. If property owners don’t keep their Unit Ratings high, they could face a Tenant Revolt.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Spooky Stuff
New Costumes and Makeup
A spooky party is only as good as the Sims who show up – in costumes! Play dress up from Pirates to Super Llamas, there are fun options for Sims young and old.
Invite Sims over for a Spooky Party
Decorate your Sim’s home with a collection of fun décor objects. Treat your guests to the Eyeball Cheese Plate and other new edible delights. 
All-new Spooky Candy Bowl!
See what surprises await for your Sims as they take their chance with this mischievous object. Oh, the things they will do for a piece of candy.
All-new Pumpkin Carving Station!
Carve a pumpkin! But beware of Sims who like to stomp. Ghost Sims will even be able to put a candle-lit pumpkin on their heads!
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Cats &amp; Dogs
Explore Brindleton Bay
Discover the coastal shores of Brindleton Bay, a new world where your Sims and their pets can live and enjoy outdoor activities. Play fetch near the harbor docks, take a walk to the lighthouse, or visit a park to setup an obstacle course.
Become a Vet and Run a Clinic
Build a veterinary clinic, hire a dedicated staff, and further your career as the town’s most promising animal doctor. You’re in control of daily operations from the services offered to what you charge.
Bond with Your Pets
Experience the companionship and fun that furry friends bring to your Sims’ lives. Cats and dogs have minds of their own and form special relationships with Sims based on their daily interactions.
Create Cats and Dogs
Use the powerful Create A Pet tool to express your creativity as you customize your Sims’ perfect cats, dogs, puppies, and kittens. Choose from a variety of breeds, give them distinct personalities, and directly manipulate their features.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Perfect Patio Stuff

Dress down to kick back.
From swimsuits to slim-fit polos, choose from a collection of chic apparel. Master the grill in the new “kiss the cook” apron. Top off your Sims’ laid-back look with new hairstyles.
Relax in the all-new Hot Tub!
Adults and children love soaking in the tub, while handy Sims will find a plethora of upgrades. Couples enjoy quiet moments together to discover new romance. Find it in Build Mode under Outdoor Activities.

Precious Memories
Add a little history to your décor. Do these items have sentimental value to your Sims or are they simply what they’re making do with? Maybe that was their mom’s favorite recliner, or their grandparents’ old television. Create new memories from the old.
Just a Little Dusty
Sometimes you have to sift through the basement to uncover a few gems. They might look a little scuffed up, but they still have plenty of use and a whole lot of character.

A slinky dress, flowing shirts, and smart jackets are staples that are always in style. Help your Sim find that romantic spark with fashions built to last (even if the romance doesn’t).
Modern Parisian Style
Pair shorts with sneakers for casual fun or dress up your look with some silk or sparkles. The youthful fashion of today draws inspiration from classic styles to build something new and trendy.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Realm of Magic
Dress for Supernatural Success
Get in the spirit of sorcery with outfits that suit your Sim. Collect wands and brooms to finish the look, then decorate rooms with enchanting objects.
Get Real Familiar

Learn the Craft
Study up on classic teachings, get experts to train your Sim. Collect and cast spells to make Sims fight, conjure food, or even turn others into objects. Create drinkable potions to make Sims fall in love, remove unwanted curses, or live forever!
Discover the Neighborhood
An unreal world awaits your Sim, and when you stumble upon the secret portal, there are mystical discoveries at every turn.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Restoration Workshop Kit
A Functional Space
Create a workshop that’ll inspire Sims to improve their skills! This space has modular shelves so you’ll have ample storage, plus interactive objects like a water heater, fuse box, floor fan, and woodworking bench.
A Job Well Done
This kit includes four antique appliances – a microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator, and stove – in need of a little TLC. Sims with the Handiness skill can go to work restoring them to their former glory and making them functional again.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Parenthood
Personalize Your Household
Customize your Sims’ looks and their home with new family fashion and build items. Give the kids’ bedrooms extra personality, remodel the kitchen to feel homier, and let your Sims express their sporty or artistic sides with new outfits.
Enjoy New Family Activities
Gather your Sim’s family to participate in new activities and spend quality time with each other. Sims of all ages can work together to complete a variety of school projects, express their creativity using construction blocks, or volunteer their time for good.
Shape Your Sim’s Childhood
The decisions you make influence how your Sim parents and leave a lasting impact on their child’s future. Each choice shapes their personality, affects their traits, influences their family relationships, and guides their path into adulthood.
Develop Parenting Skills
Level up your Sim’s parenting skills to satisfy their child’s needs and influence their behaviors. Gain new abilities through experience and choosing when to discipline bad actions, encourage good behavior, or just let kids be kids.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Seasons
Grow Your Gardening Career
Create beautiful bouquets and unearth new discoveries in the gardening career. Advance your Sim’s budding talents to unlock fresh skills, new outfits, and handy objects.
Celebrate the Holidays
Decorate your home and bring Sims together to celebrate heartfelt holiday traditions. Watch as your Sims countdown the calendar days for the next holiday. You can even create custom holidays and choose how your Sims celebrate.
Revel in Seasonal Activities
Bundle up to build a snowpal with friends, toss on a raincoat to splash in a spring shower. Dress Sims in new swimwear to cool off in the sprinkler, harvest honey in the fall, play in leaves, or have child Sims make homemade holiday crafts.
Experience Impactful Weather
From hot and sunny to blustery and snowy, every world’s climate is unique and impacts your Sims’ choices, relationships, and daily activities.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Fitness Stuff
Shape Up Your Space
Invite the outdoors into your Sim’s home with nature-inspired objects and décor that convey a sense of motion. Build a spacious fitness studio to watch workout videos, or create a modern bathroom space that’s perfect for a post-exercise soak.
Get Fit in Style
Dress your Sims in athleisure apparel that’ll inspire them to reach their fitness goals. Choose an outfit from the collection of vibrant tops and bottoms, then pop in some earbuds and hit the gym, or wear the new look out on the town.
Scale the Climbing Wall
Improve your Sim’s fitness skills and physique by ascending the all-new rock climbing treadmill. Complete climbing challenges, compete for the high score, and learn advanced bouldering techniques that’ll leave spectators in awe.

Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Life &amp; Death
Friendly or Fiendish?
Linger as a Ghost, helping or terrorizing the living. Grow abilities, assist with chores, or levitate Sims for fun. Earn Fear or Goodwill essences from interactions. Enjoy afterlife activities, including special spectral WooHoo with another Ghost.
Goodbye (For Now)
Sims grieve in 4 ways based on personalities and relationships. Customize Grieving Rituals to fit your story. Create Wills to pass down Heirlooms, assign guardians, and distribute Simoleons. Honor the departed with memorials, urns, and Custom Gravesites.
A Ghastly, Gorgeous Life
Join Grim’s career to reap souls and help ghosts, or become a Mortician to deal with death in another way. Explore Crypts, build Thanatology skills, and pursue the Ghost Historian Aspiration. Bond with a Pet Crow or collect Tarot Cards; ideal for Macabre Sims.
Build your Sim's Bucket List with goals based on traits and relations. Complete them for powerful rewards. They can also be finished in the afterlife as Unfinished Business. The ultimate reward is Rebirth, but you can also Move On or stay as a Ghost.
An Endless Journey
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Businesses &amp; Hobbies
A World of Possibility
Build your future in historic Nordhaven, perfect for creative hobbies. Attend Meetups, find mentors, or become one. Host Classes and Lectures to earn Mastery Perks. Explore Gammelvik and Iverstad to connect with like-minded Sims.
Mold Your Future
Improve your Pottery skill to unlock designs like tea sets and planters. Use the Pottery Kiln for glazing. At higher levels, practice Kintsugi to craft art from broken ceramics.
Make Your Mark
Master the Tattooing skill to give Sims custom tattoos, unlocking stamps and stencils as you level up. Create designs in Tattoo Paint Mode, layer tattoos, and share or browse in the Gallery for more.
Open Your Dream Business
Explore the Small Business system. Create a fulfilling small business for your Sim, like selling crafts or services. Use the selection tool to set up a workspace. Charge customers with the Ticket Kiosk. Hire family or others.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Country Kitchen Kit
Make It Homey
The kitchen is the heart of the home for a reason! Every object works together to foster a warm atmosphere with vintage furniture, decor, and materials.
Cook in Comfort
Build the kitchen of your Sim’s dreams with a completely new set of counters, islands, cabinets, and mix-and-match pieces. Small details add charm to the items, complete with multiple color palettes.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Romantic Garden Stuff
Dress in Modern Floral Fashion
Romantically inspired modern fashion and hairstyles add a touch of floral fun to your Sim’s wardrobe.
Splash in the Water Fountain
A magnificent garden centerpiece that is also a great spot for your Sims to enjoy each other’s company. Feeling playful? Jump in, splash around, and add soap for a bubbly good time.
Whisper a Wish in the Wishing Well
Toss a coin in to see if your Sim’s wish comes true. With a bit of luck, Sims can be granted eternal youth, extravagant riches, or even the love of their life. Be careful, because you may not always get what you wish for.
Build A Victorian-Inspired Garden
With a variety of stunning flowers, moss covered statues, and ivy wrapped arches, you can create a romantic garden space so lovely your Sims’ hearts will skip a beat!

Dark and Dreamy
Challenge your Sims to a game of bowling on the all-new bowling lane object. Start off using bumpers and improve your skills to unlock impressive trick shots. Dim the lights and turn up the music for an out of this world moonlight bowling experience.
Build a Bowling Hangout
Create your own space complete with neon lighting, bowling-themed décor, and even a bar for your Sims to enjoy refreshments between frames. Customize its look with retro-modern furniture that looks awesome in the alley or at home.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 High School Years
Explore Your Style
Make your bedroom your own, plan outfits, and become a Simfluencer! Teens can earn money by selling outfits and hyping up looks they design on Trendi right from their bedrooms, which are now more interactive than ever. 
Shake Things Up 
High school is a time of self-discovery! Find the confidence to ask your crush out or the guts to skip class. Teens will explore their own likes and dislikes. Pranks and sneaking out after dark can have consequences, so be careful you don’t get caught.
Iconic Teen Moments
Dance the night away at prom and celebrate your graduation ceremony with family and friends. Make lifelong friends, participate in after-school activities, and experience the rollercoaster of puberty.
Experience High School
Experience all the ups and downs of high school. Attend classes in person, get to know your teachers, hang out in the cafeteria, and even decorate your locker!

As your Sim’s status skyrockets, you gain Fame Perks. Decorate a gorgeous mansion with gold-plated furniture and take home a unique set piece to put on display as a tribute to the golden age. . . of you.
Run This Town
Join the glitz and glamour of Del Sol Valley, a new world where your Sims discover fame. Get a starter home in Mirage Park or work your way up to a house in the hills in The Pinnacles.
Act the Part
Be your own muse and direct your Sim toward a brilliant acting career. Get your big break with commercial gigs or land a part in a television series. 
Claim Your Fame
Now your Sims can live out their wildest dreams of fame and fortune! Rise to stardom in your current career, or catapult to fame with a new pursuit. Bask in the limelight as an aspiring actor or livestream your every moment as an influencer.

Combine elements featuring Regency, Chinoiserie, and Abstract Modern aesthetics with a plethora of prints, shapes, and colors. Delve into self-expression by getting surreal with gilded pastel tones, geometric patterns, and intimate textures.

Play with patterns and let colors collide with mix-and-match furniture in a variety of styles. Layer in contrasting and complementary details like new wallpapers and rugs to coordinate over-the-top looks that build a busy but beautiful atmosphere.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Vampires
Live the Immortal Life
Experience the life of a vampire and choose how to live. Will you drink from Sims or eat Plasmafruit to quench your thirst? Embrace evil and stir up trouble or blend in and start a vampire family? Whatever you choose, always avoid sunlight and garlic foods.
Escape to Forgotten Hollow
The dark, mist-covered land of Forgotten Hollow, is the perfect place for vampires to socialize and let loose. Visit the abandoned mansion to discover its secrets, collect ingredients for gruesome new recipes, or move in and build your own lair.
Unleash Supernatural Powers
Earn and wield dozens of unique Powers that give vampires the ability to control Sims’ minds and conjure spiritual energy. Balance your skills by taking on weaknesses and unlock new Powers by winning epic duels to advance your rank.
Create Vampires
With all-new Create A Sim options, create vampire Sims that are alluring or frightening. Choose their fangs, add mysterious glowing eyes, and even customize a unique Dark Form to transform into when enraged or spooking other Sims.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Island Living
Rock the Island Vibes
Dress Sims in tropical garb inspired by sun, sand, and waves. Or, gear up for water activities like snorkeling and swimming. Decorate a rustic oasis with home objects and unwind at the tiki bar.
Engage in Local Culture
Tradition runs deep on Sulani, and your Sims get to experience it. Immerse Sims in their newfound lifestyle by attending a pit barbecue event, learning about local folklore, tasting tropical delicacies, and chatting with Elementals from the island.
Pitch In or Help Out
Become a Conservationist, and watch your Sims’ impact bloom all over the island. Take to the waves for fishing or diving, become a lifeguard to keep the locals safe under the sun. Sims can do a few odd jobs or fish for their next meal.
Sit Back and Relax
Welcome to Sulani! Set sail on the glistening water in your island canoe, swim to your heart’s content, and explore the scenery on a watercraft. Build a spectacular sand castle, catch some rays, and even meet a mermaid!

This is a space where imagination can soar, whether kids are playing or learning. With fanciful bookshelves, a matching desk, and a chess set, this playroom doubles as a place for kids to learn and grow.

What is a Kit?
Kits are mini bits of content designed to enhance the way YOU play!
Macabre Mementos Digital Content
Plumed Elegance Mask
Slip on this luxurious downy mask when you’re feeling at your most deliciously wicked. Masquerading in this fowl finery will ensure nobody can see what nefarious plans you’re plotting.
Mournful Melodies Music Box
This antique music box features a tiny Grim Reaper figurine and plays a haunting lullaby, merging timeless elegance with the allure of the macabre. As an heirloom, this would withstand the test of time.

Adorn your finest room with an heirloom that captures timeless family bonds. This vintage portrait adds a touch of historical charm while boasting the personal touch of the residing household.
Street Eats Digital Content
Peak Freshness Fruit Basket
Street markets are the best place to get fresh food. The stalls are all around with delicious aromas wafting through the streets. While this basket of fruit is more of a display piece, it still makes the mouth water as it reminds you of the nearby night market.
Streetside Stars Shade
Spend the evening under an umbrella that brings the stars to you. The strategically strung lightbulbs give it a soft glow in a unique experience that's perfect for dining under and makes it feel like the stars are within arm's reach.
Quick Treats Grill
It's said that food from the Night Market is the best, so here's a way to make street eats right at home. With this cart shaped grill that makes it feel like you're cooking in the streets, and everything is hot off the grill ready to eat.

Minor
Medium
Major
Severity: &lt;font color='#1E81E6'&gt;{0.String}&lt;/font&gt;
Whippets are quiet and not prone to barking, but require regular exercise. They are generally gentle dogs and may be content to spend much of the day resting.
Italian Greyhound
The Italian Greyhound makes a good companion dog and enjoys the company of people. However, the breed's slim build and short coat make them somewhat fragile, and injury can result from rough or careless play with children.
Weimaraner
The Weimaraner is a large dog that was originally bred for hunting in the early 19th century. Early Weimaraners were used by royalty for hunting large game such as boar, bear, and deer. Jill will change this.
Tabby
A tabby is any domestic cat that has a coat featuring distinctive stripes, dots, lines or swirling patterns, usually together with a mark resembling an 'M' on its forehead. Tabbies are sometimes erroneously assumed to be a cat breed. Jill will change this.
Papillon
The temperament of a papillon is a happy, friendly, adventurous dog. They are not shy or aggressive. Papillon's make excellent family dogs but should be watched around little children, as should any dog, due to a small child's lack of understanding of a dog's behavior and the likelihood that they will do something to upset the dog.
Airedale Terrier
The Airedale can be used as a working dog and also as a hunting dog. Airedales exhibit some herding characteristics as well, and have a propensity to chase animals. They have no problem working with cattle and livestock.
Javanese
Javanese are noted as an intelligent cat that tends to vocalize, though often for no apparent reason. They are notably fond of play, jumping and human contact and allegedly depressed if regularly not entertained by humans or other pets. They are reportedly good mouse hunters.
Rottweiler
Rottweilers are a powerful breed with well-developed genetic herding and guarding instincts. Potentially dangerous behaviour in Rottweilers usually results from irresponsible ownership, abuse, neglect, or lack of socialisation and training.
Mastiff
Mastiff type means a large molosser dog. The term &quot;mastiff type&quot; has been used synonymously with the term &quot;molosser&quot;. For example, the bulldog breeds, the Great Dane, the mountain dogs, the pit bulls and even smaller dogs such as the Boston terrier, may be considered &quot;mastiff types&quot; in this broad sense.
Bichon Frise
The Bichon Frise loves human company and demands much of your attention. They are generally very sociable and do well with an owner that takes them along on outings.
MaineCoon
The Maine Coon is a large and sociable cat, hence its nickname, &quot;the gentle giant.&quot; It is characterized by a prominent ruff along its chest, robust bone structure, rectangular body shape, a silky flowing coat, and a long, bushy tail.
Ibizan Hound
Ibizan Hounds are &quot;escapologists&quot;: they are able to jump incredible heights from a standstill, so they need very tall fences. They also have been known to climb, and many can escape from crates, open baby gates and even locks. 
Manx
The Manx is considered a social and gregarious cat, and very attached to humans, but also shy of strangers. The breed is said to be highly intelligent, playful, and in its behaviour reminiscent of dogs.
Colorpoint Shorthair
The Colorpoint Shorthair is a highly intelligent, playful, and people-friendly breed. They are extremely affectionate and outgoing and enjoy lounging around and playing with people, causing them to also be described as &quot;extroverts&quot;. They can also be very sensitive with nervous temperaments, which do not adapt well to changes of environment or to strangers.
Vizsla
Vizslas are very high energy, gentle-mannered, loyal, caring, and highly affectionate. They quickly form close bonds with their owners, children and even strangers. Often they are referred to as &quot;velcro&quot; dogs because of their loyalty and affection.
Puggle
Puggles are great family dogs, they love to be around kids and are very friendly. They have characteristics of beagles, meaning they love to sniff for things and are excellent jumpers.
Irish Setter
Irish Setters get along well with children, other dogs, and will enthusiastically greet visitors. Even though they do well with household pets, small animals may pose a problem for this breed, as they are a hunting breed.
German Shepherd
The German Shepherd (German: Deutscher Schäferhund, German pronunciation: [ˈʃɛːfɐˌhʊnt]) is a breed of medium to large-sized working dog that originated in Germany. The breed's officially recognized name is German Shepherd Dog in the English language, sometimes abbreviated as GSD and was also formerly known as the Alsatian in Britain. Jill will change this wikipedia sourced text.
Scottish Terrier
Scotties are territorial, alert, quick moving and feisty, perhaps even more so than other terrier breeds. The breed is known to be independent and self-assured, playful, intelligent and has been nicknamed the 'Diehard' because of its rugged nature and endless determination.
Ragdoll
The extreme docility of some individuals has led to the myth that Ragdolls are pain resistant. Some breeders in Britain have tried to breed away from the limpness owing to concerns that extreme docility &quot;might not be in the best interests of the cat&quot;.
Staffordshire Bull Terrier
Although individual differences in personality exist, common traits exist throughout the Staffords. Due to its breeding, and history, the Staffordshire Bull Terrier is known for its character of fearlessness and loyalty. This, coupled with its affection for its friends, its off-duty quietness and trustworthy stability, make it a foremost all-purpose dog.
Tonkinese
Tonkinese are intelligent, active, vocal and generally people-oriented cats, playful and interested in everything going on around them; however, this also means they are easily susceptible to becoming lonesome or bored.
American Shorthair
The American Shorthair is a breed of domestic cat believed to be descended from European cats brought to North America by early settlers to protect valuable cargo from mice and rats. Jill should replace this wiki text as this is Placeholder
English Setter
A gentle but at times strong-willed, mischievous gun dog, the English Setter was bred for a mix of endurance and athleticism, it is used to hunt for game such as quail, pheasant, and grouse.
Redbone Coonhound
The Redbone Coonhound is affectionate, gentle, and should have a strong desire to please its owner.The breed is known for its distinctive &quot;drawling&quot; bark, also known as a bay. Hunters who use the breed follow the sound of the voice as the dogs track quarry.
Australian Shepherd
The breed is typically highly energetic, requiring a great deal of exercise and attention. An Australian shepherd enjoys working, whether it is learning and practicing tricks, competing in dog agility, or engaging in any other physically and mentally involving activity.
Borzoi
The borzoi is a quiet, but athletic and independent dog. Most borzois are almost silent, barking only very rarely. They do not have strong territorial drives and cannot be relied on to raise the alarm upon sighting a human intruder.
Poodle
The poodle is a group of formal dog breeds, the Standard Poodle, Miniature Poodle and Toy Poodle. The Fédération Cynologique Internationale (FCI) recognizes four sizes of one breed: standard, medium, miniature, and toy. Poodles exist in many coat colors. The origins of the poodles are still discussed. Jill will change this.
English Cocker Spaniel
Cockers are compassionate, determined, kind, intelligent, athletic, alert and resilient and make great family pets. The breed does not like being alone, and will bond strongly to an individual person in a family, usually the one who feeds it.
Giant Schnauzer
Giant Schnauzers are usually a quiet breed. Due to its breeding, the Giant Schnauzer is inherently suspicious of strangers and can be very territorial. Once introduced, it is usually accepting of novel people or situations.
Pointer
Pointers are even-tempered, congenial dogs, and despite their large size, make good house pets so long as they get sufficient exercise due to their extremely high energy levels. Pointers are intelligent, affectionate, clean and intensely loyal.
Korat
The Korat is a natural breed, and one of the oldest stable cat breeds. Known colloquially as the &quot;good luck cat&quot;. Traditionally, they are given in pairs to newlyweds or people who are highly esteemed, for good luck. Until recently, Korats were not sold, but only given as gifts.
American Longhair
American Longhair description placeholder.
Siberian
Known to be an exceptionally agile jumper, the Siberian is a strong and powerfully built cat, with strong hindquarters and large, well rounded paws and an equally impressive large full tail.
Bull Terrier
Bull Terriers can be both independent and stubborn and for this reason are not considered suitable for an inexperienced dog owner. A Bull terrier has an even temperament and is amenable to discipline.

Jack-O'-Meduso

Meduso
The gelatinous texture of Meduso's body can be deceptive. Its amorphous shape is as weightless as the feathers that adorn its head, giving it the ability to drift through the air and avoid danger. While often mistaken as a mouth, the cavity in its face is in fact an enlarged nostril, giving it a predilection to track down the source of intensely fragrant smells.\n\nEpisode 20 of the hit TV show Voidcritters saw a flock of Meduso latch themselves onto a perfume saleswoman, causing chaos at the local mall. Our hero, Leif, cleverly helped lure the Meduso away with the scent of succulent meat when he fired up the grill in a nearby park.&#xA;

Infinity Modern Mansion
Super smart and determined, Camille is passionate about food and nutrition, and how it fuels people in living their best lives. Camille grew up in France, and often visits her relatives in Morocco. Her multicultural background, and passion for building connection through food, has helped inspire the unique flavors of her cuisine. Camille runs a cafe, and is always thinking about testing new recipes on her customers-turned-friends.
Fashion-forward. A bit cocky. A family man. Oh, and evil. Brent dreams of world-domination—preferably from his own private Island where he eats kalua barbecue and lives with his mum and the future Mrs. Hong. Though his love for Kierra Tilo is no secret, he's noticed she only has eyes for another. Will this development put a halt to his plans for world-domination or will the young villain find a way to preserver and build his evil empire?
Babs' time as a Mixologist was the perfect opportunity to meet—and date—a lot of interesting people that came into and out of her life. Ultimately, she fell completely in love with Ollie. After a picturesque wedding (and three beautiful children), she found herself wanting a new line of work away from the bar scene. Turns out, she's had a talent for writing pent up inside her this entire time. 
Some Sims have taken to avoiding Armand, as his snobbish attitude can rub others the wrong way. In reality, it's a public persona he's developed to hide his sensitive side. In the privacy of his home, he enjoys a good cry in the bathtub to put his emotions at ease. Whenever he's feeling down, he calls his bestie Amber Stein—it's impossible to feel gloomy around her!
Andre is a tough nut to crack. Anyone who works with him recognizes his genius, but his mood swings drive people away. He can go from silly, to embarrassed, to angry in a flash. When he's not staring at his computer screen, he tends to be hatching a mischievous scheme... but it's difficult for him to recognize when his pranks cross the line. Ultimately, it's cute, cuddly, innocent animals that he bonds best with.
Amber's a lovable goof who puts a smile on the face of anyone she encounters. As a self-professed comedian, she even manages to practice her set on occasion at local lounges. In fact, that's where she met Armand. There he was in the audience, in one of his moods, trying to get cheered up... There she was, telling bad jokes on the stage, and dancing awkwardly. They immediately hit it off, and have been best friends ever since!
Fashionista, social-climber, party-girl, secret genius. All of that outward materialism–it's mostly a persona. Aliya is exclusive when it comes to her private life and goals. Since she was a little girl, she's dreamed of becoming a Super Villain, hidden in plain view within the dazzling spotlight of Del Sol Valley. She has the brains to pull it off, but can she keep it a secret in such a high-stakes environment?

In this household, there is one or more Sims in the Noble Career. As they are moving to a new Kingdom, they will be demoted by one career level, unless at level 1. Any Sims Promised to Inherit will also lose their claim, and will need to be re-promised in their new Kingdom.

This unit's quality rating is determined by four categories, which together create an overall Unit Rating. Each category consists of three tiers of quality. Units with higher ratings attract more Tenant applicants, allowing Property Owners to command a higher Rent Per Day for the unit.

Beds &amp; Baths
This section displays Sims without a designated residential interested in this unit, including played and not played households. The Rent Cap for each household represents the maximum amount of Rent Per Day they can afford. Look for the green checkmark, as it indicates a compatible match ready to move in. It's also a good idea to choose a household with a Beds Wanted count that matches the number of beds available in this Unit.

Additional Traits
Likes and Dislikes
◴ Likes
◵ Dislikes
Choose your Sim's Likes and Dislikes. Sims gain positive or negative moodlets from doing things they Like or Dislike, and find it easier or harder to do Friendly interaction they Like or Dislike. When a Sim is in a good or bad mood, they can gain a Like or Dislike for what they are currently doing in Live Mode (such as Cooking.)

Mods Disabled
Your game has just been updated. All Mods have been disabled because it is possible that they conflict with the update. Please use caution if you choose to re-enable Mods. Mods can be re-enabled in the Options panel.\n\nFor more information on Mods and game updates please visit&lt;span class='link'&gt;&lt;a href='event:http://help.ea.com/article/mods-and-the-sims-4-game-updates'&gt; HERE.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n\nNote: Maxis does not pre-screen or support Mods.

Script Mods
Custom Content
Script mods may cause your game to crash or result in other unexpected behavior. Use at your own risk. You will need to restart the game for this setting change to take effect.
Mods
Maxis does not pre-screen or support Mods.\nPlease use with caution.
Enable or disable Lunar Effects on Sims in Live Mode. Current Lunar moodlets will remain until they have naturally disappeared.
Disable Lunar Effects:
Set a specific Lunar Phase to appear every night.\n\nChanges will go into effect the following Sim morning.
Disabled
Set Permanent Phase:
Set the length of the Lunar Cycle. Longer Lunar Cycles' phases last longer, and shorter Lunar Cycles have phases removed from them.\n\nChanges will go into effect the following Sim morning.
Lunar Cycle Length:
2 Days
24 Days
16 Days
4 Days
8 Days (Default)
If disabled, acne will no longer appear or grow on Sims through Gameplay. This does not apply to Game Pack: Parenthood acne facial details.
Enable Acne
Opt out of discovering new Personality traits
If disabled, Sims will no longer have Self Discovery moments that offer new or changed Personality Traits.
Self Discovery
Disabling this will stop Layoffs from happening for your sims.
If disabled, Sims will not experience layoffs in their careers.\n\nSims in a current layoff period will not be laid off and the period will officially resolve at the end of the next work day.
Career Layoffs
If disabled, Sims will no longer experience the positives of Good Luck and the negatives of Bad Luck. Luck will no longer appear in the Simology Panel.
Enabling this option means the result of a Sim's actions may be influenced by their Luck.
Enable Luck:
If checked, Fairy Sims outside of the Active Household will not appear autonomously in Fairy Form in Worlds other than Innisgreen. Certain player-directed actions will still cause Fairy Sims to reveal their Fairy Form.\n\nThis change will not be applied to Fairy Sims that are currently spawned until after the next load.
Enabling this option means you will not see Fairy Sims in their Fairy Form outside of Innisgreen, except through player action.
Limit Fairies to Innisgreen
If disabled, Sims will not experience any effects related to Balance or Imbalance. This may mean a Sim experiences fewer Ailments but will not eliminate them overall. Balance &amp; Imbalance UI will not appear in the Simology Panel.
Enabling this option means that Moods will influence Sims' state of Balance over time, leading to effects that impact Needs and Ailments.
Enable Balance &amp; Imbalance:
If disabled, Ailments will no longer spread contagiously. Once disabled, Sims who already have Ailments will need to wait it out or seek a cure, but no more Sims will contract Ailments through spontaneous spread. Being near or interacting with Sims who have an Ailment will no longer have any risk of contagious spread.\n\nWhether or not this is disabled, Fairy Sims in your Household can still give Ailments to other Sims if they have unlocked the Cure or Apply Ailments Fairy Ability. Naturopath Sims who choose to Work From Home will still be able to receive clients with Ailments who need treatment.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Note:&lt;/b&gt; Sims who become Very Imbalanced will still contract an Ailment. Uncheck both &lt;i&gt;Enable Balance &amp; Imbalance&lt;/i&gt; and &lt;i&gt;Enable Ailment Spread&lt;/i&gt; to disable all natural sources of Ailments.
Enabling this means Sims can develop Ailments from everyday exposure, especially being around other Sims who already have an Ailment.
Enable Ailment Spread

Planning a Getaway at an active household's residential lot can earn you Simoleons. Earnings are based on the residential lot’s value and the number of non-household Sims attending the Getaway. Check the bottom of the planner for the estimated total earnings from this Getaway.
Planning a Getaway at any lot outside of the active household's residential lot comes with a daily fee. Getaway fees are calculated based on the lot value and total number of Sims attending. Check the bottom of the planner for the estimated total cost of this Getaway.

Turn off Auto-Scaling with OS setting?

UI Scaling is reading your OS scaling settings and it is too large for this resolution.  This will cause the UI to overlap in some cases.

Not Right Now
Where the Getaway Begins!
With Custom Venues and Getaways, you can build the perfect backdrop for any kind of adventure. Picture a neighborhood pool that serves smoothies by day and transforms into a dance party at night, or a butterfly-catching park that becomes a spinning class hub in the afternoon. You choose the activities, assign roles, and set the schedule to bring the lot to life!\n\nNot quite ready to build from scratch? No worries! Two Custom Venue lots, &lt;b&gt;Camp Gibbi Gibbi&lt;/b&gt;, an adventurous outdoor kids camp, and &lt;b&gt;Revive and Thrive&lt;/b&gt;, a relaxing Fitness Retreat comes fully set up and ready to host a Getaway right away. The Addam's family also hosts &lt;b&gt;Love Highland&lt;/b&gt; right at their home for singles looking for love! Just open the Calendar or Phone to start planning a Getaway and let the adventure unfold! If you're ready to learn more, these lessons will help you get started:
Learn about Getaways
Learn about Custom Venues
