That's it, we're done. It's up to you now. From here, you can add another Sim to this household, which we recommend, keep playing as you are, or, start a new household entirely. Don't worry, this one will still be available to you.
If you're ever confused or need a refresher, read the Lessons Alex wrote for your Sim in the Options menu.
If you're in need of inspiration, head to The Gallery. Simmers from around the world upload amazing creations to our safe community of creators. Poke around and download anything you like. It's free!
Now that your Sim has the home to themselves, you can enter Build Mode to redecorate it to your liking. Add rooms, buy new furniture, move things around, and more. Take a look! You can tinker as long as you have money to spend!
Your Sim now has the option to Join a new Career that best matches their new Aspiration. Use the Phone or Computer to find a new job. There are many interesting professions to pursue, so don’t be afraid to Quit and try out any until you find one that suits your story.
You've learned the basics and are now ready to play on your own. Alex is leaving to help other new players. Bye, Alex!
Your Sim completed their Aspiration. This means they earned Satisfaction points to spend on rewards. Sweet! But, this is just the first step, and there are many more Aspirations from which to choose. Choose a new Aspiration, which will open up new story possibilities for your Sim.
Your Sim was promoted! This means a new title, more money, rewards, but also, more work opportunities!
It's time to head back home. Your Sims can always return home no matter where they are by selecting the Go Home button on their portrait. It's the teeny tiny little house.
Your Sims might build several relationships over time. Keep tabs on their social life by clicking on the Relationship icon down at the bottom. Generally, if you need to learn something about your Sim, click a button down here.
The park is full of friendly folks. Your Sim should talk to some of them!
Your Sim can bring Alex along for the ride, at least today. In the future, as your Sim makes friends and romantic partners, they can invite these Sims to meet out on the town.

Play around for a few hours by clicking on household objects, or watch what your Sim chooses to do. Have fun! 
Your Sim received an assortment of goodies from Alex. The gift included some seeds for a garden, a book, and something to decorate the home.  Thanks, Alex!
Alex has a welcome gift for your Sim. What a great tour guide! You should open your Sim's inventory to see what it is.  Think of the Inventory as your Sim's personal pocket, with unlimited space. Hmm, magic pockets.
Actions that you give your Sim will appear in a queue on the left side of the screen. You can mouse over actions in the queue to find out more information, or click to cancel an action you don't want your Sim to take.
Sims need money to pay Bills, buy better household items, and even purchase food. Luckily, we had Alex pull a few strings to get your Sim a sweet job, which starts tomorrow. You can choose a different job later if you don't like this one. You always have choices to make for your Sims.
There's many ways to interact with items in your inventory. You can click for options, such as choosing to read the book, or opening the seed packet. You can also click and drag an item to place it in the world, such as placing the seeds to be planted.
Your job starts tomorrow, if you need to find the time it's right next to the time controls on the bottom center of the screen. Here you can also control the game speed if you need to speed up, slow down, or pause things.
Shift your gaze to the top of the screen to see how the conversation is going.
Relationships are very important to Sims, both for their stories and their Social Need. Click on Alex and select &quot;Get to Know&quot; to see your Sim start a conversation. Feel free to experiment with friendship or romance to tell the stories that interest you.
Click on objects to give directions to your Sim. For example, click on the delicious food prepared by Alex and tell your Sim to &quot;Grab a Serving.&quot;
You can always get a preview of your Sim's needs, such as hunger or social, by the color of the diamond indicator above your selected Sim. As it goes from green to red, look to the Needs Panel to see what your Sim needs.
Sims have basic Needs, and right now your Sim is hungry. Don't worry - Alex will prepare a meal for your Sim.
Your Sim should follow Alex inside the house. Right click on Alex's portrait to have the camera follow them. Then, click anywhere on the ground and select &quot;Go Here.&quot; If you ever lose track of a Sim, double click their Portrait to find them.
You'll need to know how to control the camera so you can see the things you want to see. Use the buttons and scroll wheel on your Mouse to control the camera. Try it now.
Now is a great time to greet your new housemate, Alex. Click on her to bring up a menu of possible Introductions.
Sims must Sleep to improve their Energy Need. Click on the bed and tell your Sim to sleep. This way, they'll be fresh and ready for their new job in the morning. Happy Sims make for better employees!
Welcome to The Sims 4! We can't wait to show you all the wild stories you can tell in this game of life.
Who is your Sim? What will they accomplish? First, choose an aspiration, which is a life goal. Click one of the buttons on the left of the screen.
Looks are important! Click the Sim to choose their clothing, hair, skin tone, makeup, body shape, and more. Create yourself, someone you know, or even a celebrity.
Welcome to Create A Sim! This is where your story - and characters - begin. Click around and experiment! Click the buttons at the top to give your Sim a name.
Use the Phone to Travel
Take a Photo on the Phone
Spend Time Outside and Keep Track with This Moodlet
Select a Nature Aspiration and Complete One Level
Open Inventory
There are some powerful and easy-to-use tools that'll help you quickly build things. Let's examine a few of them now!
Energy
Take quick naps or drink coffee when your Sims don't have time for a proper sleep.
If you don't let your Sims sleep, they'll eventually pass out.
Sims require sleep every day in a bed, chair, or even on the floor.
Sims will take care of their Energy Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Bladder
Sims will take care of their Bladder Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
You can prevent an embarrassing moment by directing your Sim to Use the Toilet. 
Travel
There is a big world waiting for your Sim outside of their home Lot! \n\nIn addition to a change in scenery, traveling has many perks. As your Sims visit new places, they’ll encounter new &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sims&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Collectibles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;experiences&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Why not order a drink at the Bar or get some help with their exercise from the trainer at the Gym?\n\nBefore your Sims can afford more expensive Objects, they can visit a Venue and use them for &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;free&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. For example, computers can be found at the Library.
Moving
Moving will open the World Map. Lots that you can move to without any modifications are &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;outlined in green&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Lots &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;outlined in yellow&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are either too expensive to buy fully furnished, or another Household already lives there.\n\nPick a Lot and press the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Confirm&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button in the lower right corner to start moving!\n\nRemember that you can use the World Select button to move to another World.
Once you’ve picked a Lot, you will get options to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;keep&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;sell&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your current furniture (keeping the furniture puts them in the Household Inventory) and whether to buy the new Lot &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;furnished&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;unfurnished&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bulldozed&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. You can see your remaining funds under the Household portrait.\n\nIf you’re moving to a Lot where someone already lives, you will get a choice whether to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;move in&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with them or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;evict&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; them first.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Finalize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the move with the Purchase Home or Move In button!
So it’s time for your Sims to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;move someplace new&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Perhaps they have outgrown their current home, want independence from their parents, or they’ve earned enough Simoleons to buy a fancier house. Or maybe you just want a change of scenery!
You’ll find the options for moving in the Cell Phone’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Travel app&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nUse the Move Household option to move the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;entire Household&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to a new Lot, or Split from Household and Move option to move &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;parts of the Household&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to a new Lot.\n\nThe Split option opens a new menu. Here you can decide &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;which Sims&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; will move out and how much &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;money&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; they will bring with them. You can press the Select another Household button to move them into another Household.
There is a big world waiting for your Sim outside of their home Lot! You can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;explore&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; the Neighborhood your Sim lives in—who knows what adventure awaits just down the road—or use your Cell Phone to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;travel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; somewhere else.\n\nIf you want a more permanent change of scenery, or simply need more room for a growing family, you can also use the Cell Phone to move to a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;new home&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Game Speed
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Time&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; goes by, hour by hour, day by day. But in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;i&gt;you&lt;/i&gt; have the power to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;control&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; it!\n\nLearn all about controlling the Game Speed and how to keep track of the passing of time in the Lessons below.
Mentoring
Mentoring can be offered or asked for in two different ways. When a Sim is &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;already practicing a Skill&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, the Mentor can select the Offer Mentoring interaction on them, or the Mentee can select Ask for Mentoring on the Mentor.\n\nYou can also select an Offer Mentoring or Ask for Mentoring interaction on a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill-building object&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. If accepted, this will make the Mentee start practising the Skill before Mentoring starts. Handy, huh?\n\nMentoring is free by default, but Mentors can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Offer Paid Mentoring&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on Skill-building objects to Sims from other households. Ka-ching!
When a Sim receives Mentoring, this speeds up the rate of their Skill gain. The biggest impact on the speed is the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Mentor's Skill level&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;—a Sim at Skill level 10 will be better at Mentoring than a Sim at Skill level 5!\n\nThere are other ways to boost Mentoring. For example, a Mentor can buy the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Super Mentor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Reward Trait from the Rewards Store.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Mentoring&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; allows skilled Sims to pass on their knowledge to other Sims. Once they reach &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;level 5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in a Mentorable Skill, they can Mentor other Sims in that Skill (as long as the Mentor's Skill is a higher level than the Mentee's), which speeds up Skill gain.\n\nTo find out if a Skill is Mentorable, you can check its description in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Here you can also learn on which objects Mentoring is available.
Child Skills
Children have 4 skills of their very own, called Fundamental Skills. Each Skill can be built upon by interacting with other Sims or objects. Advancing in each of the Fundamental Skills unlocks new ways for Children to interact with the world around them. \n\nChildren may also start developing certain &quot;adult&quot; Skills that are available for Teens and older. However, because they are children, they gain these skills at a slower rate. Like Fundamental Skills, these basic Skills may unlock new ways for Children to interact with the world, but some interactions will require them to age up to Teen before they become available. 
Sims need &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skills&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to pay the bills! Skills are essential for advancing in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Careers&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and can also help your Sims earn some extra &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Simoleons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on the side.\n\nSkills have other benefits as well; as your Sims improve their Skills, they will unlock new &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;interactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, craft &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;unique objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, get better at building &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and so much more.\n\nSo what are you waiting for? Buy a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill Book&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from the bookshelf, or a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Skill building Object&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from the Build Mode catalog, and get started!
There is also information on Skills located in the Skills panel at the bottom right. This can be accessed by clicking on the Lightbulb Icon or pressing the [L] shortcut. Progress across all Skills is easily visible in this panel, and the right column indicates current Skill Level. Hovering over a Skill Icon or Name also gives additional information about that skill and what objects allow your Sim to gain it.\n\nWhen a Skill (or multiple Skills) are actively being gained the affected Skill(s) will glow to indicate active progress.
Most Skills have a total of 10 Levels, though some will occasionally have 5. Progress for Skills can be tracked in two places. \n\nThe first place is in the game window. While actively gaining a skill, a Progress Bar will display above a Sim's head with the Skill icon. This bar indicates how close a Sim is to gaining a new level, and once the bar has completely filled a new Level in that Skill will be gained.
Romantic Boundaries
If a Sim is exploring &lt;b&gt;Romantic Boundaries&lt;/b&gt;, they may Reconsider if asked by another Sim. Select another Sim, choose the &lt;b&gt;“Relationship”&lt;/b&gt; category, then choose the &lt;b&gt;&quot;Change Relationship&quot;&lt;/b&gt; subcategory. Find the &lt;b&gt;&quot;Ask To Reconsider Romantic Boundaries&quot;&lt;/b&gt; category. In this category there are social interactions that Sims can use to ask another Sim to Reconsider specific Romantic Boundaries.\n\nIf a Sim is &lt;b&gt;not Exploring Romantic Boundaries&lt;/b&gt; they cannot be asked to Reconsider.\n\nLearn more about setting up your Sims' Romantic Boundaries in Lessons under &lt;b&gt;Create A Sim &gt; Identity &amp; Personality &gt; Romantic Boundaries&lt;/b&gt;
Sims must learn each other's Romantic Boundaries by asking! Select another Sim, choose the &lt;b&gt;“Relationship”&lt;/b&gt; category then the &lt;b&gt;“Learn More”&lt;/b&gt; category, and finally choose the &lt;b&gt;&quot;Ask about Romantic Boundaries&quot;&lt;/b&gt; interaction.&#xD;&#xA;Once a Sim agrees to share this, their reply will appear as a text notification. Their Romantic Boundaries will also be recorded in their Sim Profile page.&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;
Even though some Sims are Loner, they are all social creatures. &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Socializing&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with other Sims is essential for their happiness.\n\nAs your Sim builds stronger (or at least more &lt;i&gt;intense&lt;/i&gt;) &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with those around them, new social interactions and possibilities are unlocked. \n\nMeet new Sims and become BFFs, partners in crime, enemies with benefits, soulmates, and more! 
Pie Menu Subcategories
Within each of the main categories of the pie menu, such as &lt;b&gt;Friendly&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;Mean&lt;/b&gt;, there are now a collection of subcategories present to sort interactions. Each subcategory will further classify the interactions your Sims can perform on each other, making it easier for you to find that specific &lt;b&gt;Joke&lt;/b&gt; you wanted to tell, or &lt;b&gt;Argument&lt;/b&gt; you wanted to start.\n\nUniquely important interactions, such as Proposals or Divorces, can still be found outside of subcategories.
Personality
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Personality&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, which is mainly based on their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, influences the way they experience and interact with the world around them in a number of ways. Learn more below!
Managing Needs
Another tip for efficient Needs management is &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;multitasking&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Sims can do some things at the same time, such as eating in front of the TV to fulfill their Hunger and Fun needs at the same time.\n\nYou should also consider your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; when managing their Needs. A Bookworm will have more Fun reading, while a Music Lover prefers to listen to music.
Managing your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is essential to ensure their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;happiness&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;productivity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and even &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;survival&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!\n\nYou can see the current state of your Sim’s Needs in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Needs panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. If you click on a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Need icon&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, your active Sim will try to do something to take care of that Need.
More &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;expensive Objects&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are more &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;effective&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; at fulfilling Sims’ Needs. \n\nYou can check which Need an Object can fulfill, and how efficient it is, in the Object’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;tooltip&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Build catalog&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Needs
If you want to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;care&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;well being&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (or… experiment with it), look no further! \n\nManaging your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;physical&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;mental Needs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; allows them to live happy, fruitful lives; however, if they get low, they will experience negative Emotions and might even die!
They say &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;money&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can’t buy happiness, but it sure helps to keep your Sims content! Learn all about how to earn big Simoleons so your Sims can put food on the table, pay their bills, and build their dream home!
Life Stages
While Sims are still growing up, they experience many “firsts”. \n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Infants&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are entirely reliant on their caregivers to ensure their basic needs are met. Giving them lots of attention will help them in these early formative days.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Toddlers&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are still largely dependent on their caregivers, and will need help learning things like how to walk and talk.\n\n&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Child&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; Sims take on some more advanced Skills, have their first Aspiration, and start School. \n\nSchool continues as Sims become &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Teens&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Now they can get a Part-Time Job and begin to explore their romantic interests, too!
As your Sim reaches &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;adulthood&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, they are able to join full-time Careers, get married, have or adopt children, and more. \n\nOnce your Sim become an &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Elder&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, they’re able to Retire and cash in on their lifetime of hard work with a daily pension check! Elderhood is also a great time to indulge in hobbies and spend time with loved ones.
There are eight Life Stages your Sims can experience: &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Newborn&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Infant&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Toddler&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Child&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Teen&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Young Adult&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Adult&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Elder&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nAs your Sims age and grow, there are new life events, relationships, and more to try!
Follow your Sims from the cradle to the grave. As time goes on, Sims will age and go through seven &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Life Stages&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; Baby, Toddler, Child, Teenager, Young Adult, Adult, and Elder; each with their unique experiences and challenges.\n\nAfter a long and eventful life (or a shorter one, if your Sim has an &lt;i&gt;accident&lt;/i&gt;), all Sims must face the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Grim Reaper&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;—unless they’ve found a way to cheat death…\n\nDeath doesn’t have to be the end. Keep the remains of your late relatives around, and you might have a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;nightly visitor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;!
Falling in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;love&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, having &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;children&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and spending time with &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;relatives&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be a very meaningful part of your Sim’s life! \n\nFollow the newest additions to the family as they &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;grow up&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; from adorable babies to inquisitive toddlers, have their first day of School as a Child, and begin to explore their identity, responsibilities, and relationships as Teens. \n\nAnd who knows, perhaps they will continue the family &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;legacy&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with a child of their own one day! 
Your Sims are feeling creatures! Their current mood, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, has a big impact on what they do and how they do it. Learn about the effects of Emotions, good and bad, and how to manage them in the Lessons below.
Camera Controls
The tiny people living in your computer have big dreams (and worries)! Learn all about &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspirations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Wants&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Fears&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and how your Sim can master them to earn powerful &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rewards&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Play with Life&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (and Death) in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Live Mode&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Follow your Sims from the cradle to the grave as they experience the joys and challenges of each stage of life.
Infant Care
Much like Newborns, Infants require bottle or breastfeeding for nourishment. All caregivers can bottle feed. To allow parents to breastfeed, enter &lt;font color=&quot;#199C2C&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Create A Sim&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;. Under &lt;font color=&quot;#199C2C&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Customize&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;, select whether your Sim can produce milk.
Sims will autonomously want to check on and care for Infants, especially when an Infant is fussing or crying. Frequency and quality of care is impacted by a Caregiver's Traits, Ages, and Relationship with the Infant.\n\nSims who do not share a relationship with the infant won't care about them as much. Not all Sims start out as Caregivers. If a Sim in the household would like to become a Caregiver for the Infant they can click on the Infant and choose to Adopt as Care Dependent.
Time for bed! Although Infants can sleep on the floor or be given a nap, your Infant will rest better if you click on the Crib and select &lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;&lt;b&gt;Put Infant to Sleep&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;.\n\nSims can add a Baby Mobile to play lullabies for Infants. You can also read Infants a bedtime story and soothe them to sleep.
Infants rely on their caregivers to get their needs met, and for help with navigating the world around them. They need to be fed, changed, and paid attention to! A well-cared-for Infant is a happy Infant that is sure to grow into a successful Toddler.
Infants can also be fed in the High Chair! At this stage in their life, &quot;adult food&quot; is more about exploration and bonding. It probably won't fill them up fully, but they will enjoy the variety real food provides. \n\nInteract with the Infant or High Chair to choose this method of feeding. Each Infant will have a preference for each type of food. They can either Like, Love, Dislike, or be Unsure about a particular food.
Sims can clean up their messy infants by giving them a bath! Bathing is not just a routine, it's also an occasion to bond with family members. But beware—some splashing may occur! \n\nInteract with the bathtub or select the infant and choose to give a bath or a bubble bath.
To stay entertained, Infants can play with toybox toys, dollhouses, nesting blocks, and stuffed animals. Sims can also read Toddler Books to Infants.
Keep Infants and Toddlers in an area with baby proofing! Click on a door or gate and select &lt;font color=&quot;#199C2C&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Apply Baby Proofing&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt; under the &lt;font color=&quot;#199C2C&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Lock For...&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt; category.
Welcome to The Sims 4 Lessons!\n\nSelect a category from the list to the left. Then choose a topic to learn more about it.
World Map
Gallery
Dine Out
Create A Sim
Getting Started
Relatives &amp; Relationships
You can set the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;relationship&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; between your Sims in the Household Relationships menu. \n\nSome relationships are restricted by age; for example, a Sim has to be a Young Adult or older to have children, and their children must be younger than them.
You can find the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Play with Genetics&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button in the Add a Sim menu. Selecting this button opens the Genetics panel.
When creating a Sim by Playing with Genetics, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;relationships&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; are automatically applied.
When creating a new Household, you can decide if the Sims are roomies, relatives, or partners. \n\nBy using the Genetics tool, you can make new Sims that look like your existing Sims by using their “genes”. This is an easy way to add children, parents, and siblings!
In the Genetics panel, choose a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Relationship&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (Child, Sibling, or Parent), pick &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;who&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; they are related to, select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gender&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Age&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and roll your new Sim by clicking the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Randomize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button.\n\n\nIf you like the result, select the Done button to add the new Sim to your Household.
Makeup
Most makeup swatches include &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;sliders&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to customize your Sim's look further. Adjust the Hue, Opacity, Saturation, and Brightness to customize the makeup for that perfect look.\n\nYou can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Save&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; a customized swatch to use it again later.
To customize your Sim’s makeup, select their face and then the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Makeup&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; button. This will show you all makeup options, or you can view each subcategory at a time.
Most makeup have multiple color options, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;swatches&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. You can find an item’s swatches below it in the menu.\n\nIf you want to find every makeup option that has a swatch of a specific color, you can use the color filter. Learn more in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Filters Lesson&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Elevate your Sim's look with &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;makeup&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Add some flair to your Sim's face with eyeshadow, eyeliner, blush, lipstick, and face paint to bring out their unique sense of self.
Clothes
Each category has a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;preset filter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; that determines which clothing options are available. The preset is only a suggestion; feel free to remove or change these filters as you wish!\n\nAlmost all Create a Sim items are available for all genders and Outfit categories if you remove the preset filters.
Most clothing pieces have multiple color options, or &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;swatches&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Some swatches even have unique patterns and prints! You can find an item’s swatches below it in the menu.\n\nIf you want to find every piece of Clothing that has a swatch of a specific color, you can use the color filter. Learn more in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Filters Lesson&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Accessories, Shoes &amp; Hats
In some categories, you can select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;multiple&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; items. Why not flaunt your bling by wearing a ring on each finger and bracelets on both wrists?
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Shoes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;socks&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;leggings&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rings&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;bracelets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;nailpolish&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be accessed by selecting your Sim’s body.\n\nSelect &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Shoes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to show all shoes, or use the subcategories to browse a more specific selection. \n\nIf you select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Accessories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; it will show all socks, leggings, rings, bracelets, and nailpolish, or you can select a subcategory’s button to browse just those items.
Nothing adds character and flair to an outfit like &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;accessories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Dress your Sim up in hats, shoes, bracelets, glasses, earrings and more to express their unique sense of style.
To try out some &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;hats&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;piercings&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;glasses&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;necklaces&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select your Sim’s head. \n\nSelect &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Hats&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to show all hats, or use the subcategories to browse a more specific selection.\n\nSimilarly, you can select &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Accessories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to view all piercings, glasses, and necklaces, or you can view each subcategory at a time.
Outfits
You can have up to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;5 Outfits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in each category. Select the arrow above the outfit category button and then the plus button to add more Outfits to that category.\n\nYou can delete an outfit by pressing the x, but you must have at least one outfit per category.
Voice &amp; Walkstyle
Does your Sim speak in a high pitch or a low rumble? Do they saunter, strut, or bounce down the street? You can customize your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Voice&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Walkstyle&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the Identity panel.
Traits &amp; Aspirations
A Sim’s Aspiration is what they aspire to be, do, and experience! Sims will be given &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;goals&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; based on their Aspiration that can be completed for &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rewards&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nSelect the Pick an Aspiration button to pick your first &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. Most Aspiration &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;categories&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; have multiple options. For instance, click on Food and choose between Master Chef and Master Mixologist!\n\nYour first Aspiration will also give your Sim a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Bonus Trait&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; that you can see next to your selected Aspiration!
What’s going on inside your Sim’s head? Their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Traits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; define their personality, and their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Aspiration&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; gives them goals and dreams!
To customize your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;personality&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, select a Pick a Trait button and pick Traits until all Trait slots are filled. These Traits affect everything in the game from Emotions and Skills to Hobbies and Relationships.\n\nSome Traits can't be &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;paired&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with other Traits. For example, you can't be both Good and Evil. \n\nSome traits may be more &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;challenging&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; to play with, but they will provide unique opportunities for your Sims!
Romantic Boundaries
&lt;b&gt;Romantic Boundaries&lt;/b&gt; control what does or doesn't make Sims experience romantic Jealousy. By default, all Sims experience Jealousy if a partner engages in any kind of romance with other Sims. You can change this!\n\nRomantic Boundaries can be configured in the &lt;b&gt;Identity Panel&lt;/b&gt; in Create A Sim. The first three settings control if your Sim experiences Jealousy when a partner engages in certain types of romantic interactions with other Sims. The settings are:\n\n&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;b&gt;Non-physical romance&lt;/b&gt;, which is any romance where the Sims' bodies do not touch. These can be found in the &lt;b&gt;Affection and Flirtation&lt;/b&gt; categories of the &lt;b&gt;Romance&lt;/b&gt; interaction menu when you select another Sim.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;b&gt;Physical romance&lt;/b&gt;, under the &lt;b&gt;Physical Intimacy&lt;/b&gt; category of the Romance interaction menu. This setting controls Jealousy caused by a partner having romantic physical contact, but &lt;i&gt;does not&lt;/i&gt; include Mess Around (Teen Sims) or WooHoo (Adult Sims.)&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The third setting specifically covers &lt;b&gt;Mess Around&lt;/b&gt; (for Teen Sims) or &lt;b&gt;WooHoo&lt;/b&gt; (for Adult Sims.) These interactions are also found in the Physical Intimacy category.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;
The last setting says if a Sim is &lt;b&gt;Exploring Romantic Boundaries.&lt;/b&gt; If the Sim is exploring, they may reconsider each of the three boundaries listed above, by talking about it with other Sims in Live Mode. If the Sim is not exploring, their boundaries are firm and they cannot be asked to reconsider.\n\nUse these settings to decide how Jealousy does (or doesn't) unfold in Live Mode. Learn more Romantic Boundaries in Lessons under &lt;b&gt;Live Mode &gt; Relationships &amp; Socializing &gt; Romantic Boundaries&lt;/b&gt;
Pronouns
Name &amp; Age
&lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Name&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim! Who are they? Click on the text to expand the Name panel, and type in First and Last names for the Sim. No idea what to name your Sim? Click Randomize Name and let us pick one for you!
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Age&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, or Life Stage, is set in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Identity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; menu. Select their Life Stage, from Infant to Elder.\n\n\nKeep in mind that changing a Sim’s Life Stage might remove their Traits, Aspiration, and Relationships if they’re no longer valid.
Gender &amp; Sexual Orientation
There are powerful ways to customize a Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gender&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sexual Orientation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Sexual Orientation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is also set in the Customize menu under the Gender buttons. It's available for Sims who are Teens or older.\n\nYou can set which gender(s) a Sim is attracted to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;romantically&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (who they can build a romantic relationship with) and which gender(s) they’re interested in &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Messing Around&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; or having &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Woohoo&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; with. \n\nFor example, to make a biromantic and asexual Sim, set them to be romantically attracted to men and women, and to be interested in Woohoo with no gender.\n\nYou can also decide if a Sim is &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;exploring romantically&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;; if not, they will turn down advances from Sims who aren’t of the gender(s) they’re attracted to.
A Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Gender&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; can be set in the Identity panel. If the Sim is a Teen or older, you can further customize their Gender by selecting the Customize button below the Gender buttons and opening the Gender tab.\n\nIn this menu, you can select your Sim’s Physical Frame (their basic body shape); their Clothing Preference (this determines the preset filter when editing Outfits, but you can always remove these filters); whether your Sim can become pregnant, get others pregnant, or neither; and if your Sim can use the toilet standing up or not.
You can change your Sim’s &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Pronouns&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; in the dropdown menu next to their name. Expande the Name panel to access it. If no Pronouns are selected, Pronouns in texts will be based on your Sim's Gender.\n\nPick between the preset Pronouns, or create &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Custom Pronouns&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. The latter option will open the Custom Pronouns window. Use the example sentences below each version of your Custom Pronouns to make sure it will work correctly in text.
Create a Ghost
Ghost Sims can be customized to wear any regular outfits available for living Sims, in addition to those exclusive to Ghosts! From casual wear to formal, the choice is yours to give your Ghost Sim a unique and personalized look that reflects their otherworldly style.
In Create a Sim, you now have the option to create a Ghost! Next to the Aspiration trait icon, you'll find a new molecule that lets you choose from various death types. To revert your Sim back to a living state, simply select the 'X' on the cause of death icon. Please note that Toddler and Infant Sims cannot become Ghosts, and certain death types are restricted to specific age groups.
After selecting a death trait and transforming your Sim into a Ghost, it’s time to customize! Use the Ghost Overlay toggle to preview your Ghost Sim without the overlay for more detailed customization. You can switch the overlay back on at any time to view your Ghost Sim in the default view!
Identity &amp; Personality
In addition to creating your Sims’s appearance, you can customize their &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;identity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;personality&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! \n\nThis covers everything from Age, Gender, and Sexuality to Traits and Aspirations.

Papercraft
The art of making two- or three-dimensional objects and designs using paper. Creations are made in a variety of ways, which can include cutting, folding, bending, stitching, layering, or gluing. Sims can gift their papercrafts to other Sims or proudly display them around the house.\n\nThis Skill can be developed using a Papercraft Kit. Increasing this Skill will unlock new paper creations and paper colors.\n\nPapercrafting can be mentored at Skill level 5 from the Papercraft Kit.
Reached Papercraft Level 2
{0.SimFirstName} can now Craft:\n• Paper Mache Plants\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Butterflies\n• More Paper Mache Funky Animals
Reached Papercraft Level 5
{0.SimFirstName} can now Craft:\n• Paper Mache (Better) Animals\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Frogs
Reached Papercraft Level 7
{0.SimFirstName} can now Craft: \n• Origami Cranes\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Llamas\n• More Paper Mache (Better) Animals
Reached Papercraft Level 9
{0.SimFirstName} can now Craft:\n• Wall-Mounted Paper Mache Animal Heads\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Cranes\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Jellyfish
Reached Papercraft Level 10
{0.SimFirstName} has become a master of Papercraft! {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can now Craft: \n• Totally Realistic Paper Mache Critters\n• More Paper Options for Origami Jellyfish\n• More Wall-Mounted Paper Mache Animal Heads
Reached Papercraft Level 8
{0.SimFirstName} can now Craft: \n• Origami Jellyfish\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Cranes\n• More Paper Colors for Origami Llamas
Reached Papercraft Level 4
{0.SimFirstName} can now Craft:\n• More Paper Mache Plants\n• Origami Frogs
Acquired the Papercraft Skill
{0.SimFirstName}'s new skill in Papercrafting will allow {0.SimPronounObjective} to construct two- or three-dimensional objects and designs using paper. The higher the Skill level, the more paper creations and paper colors {0.SimPronounSubjective} will unlock.

Reached Papercraft Level 3

Knitting
Get comfortable and turn on some tunes, because it's time to knit! Use your talents to dress your family, decorate your house, or make some Simoleons on the side. No wrong answers here, just get to stitching! \n\nKnitting is primarily tied to the Yarn Basket. Your Sim must have a Yarn Basket in their inventory to start knitting. Increasing this skill will unlock new Knitting recipes, both clothing and objects!\n\nKnitting can be mentored at Skill level 5 from a Yarn Basket.

Social
Gross Motor Milestones capture an Infant's progress in developing whole body movement for strength and coordination. These can only be unlocked when your Sim is an Infant.\nAchieving the more advanced Gross Motor Milestones will give your Infant a boost as they age up to a Toddler by getting a head start on their Movement skill.
Gross Motor
Firsts Milestones capture the first instances of major moments in a Sim's life.
Firsts
Fine Motor Milestones capture an Infant's progress in developing their smaller muscles for precision and control. These can only be unlocked when your Sim is an Infant.\nAchieving the more advanced Fine Motor Milestones will give your Infant a boost as they age up to a Toddler by getting a head start on their Thinking skill.

Make Zaatar Manakeesh
This well-known Arab savory pastry can be enjoyed as a snack or appetizer. \nIt’s comprised of a flatbread topped with olive oil and za’atar, a mixture of the herbs, spices, and sesame seeds, and can sometimes include white cheese.\n\nVegetarian-safe.
Serve Zaatar Manakeesh
Zaatar Manakeesh

Serve Tomato Soup
Grill a Pot of Tomato Soup
Simple, creamy tomato soup. From a can or fresh tomatoes - either way it's the perfect companion to grilled cheese.\n\nVegetarian-Safe, Lactose Free
Tomato Soup
Also known as Sliced Rice Cake Soup, it is a traditional Korean dish eaten during the celebration of the Korean New Year. The dish consists of the broth/soup (guk) with thinly sliced rice cakes (tteok). It is tradition to eat tteokguk on New Year's Day because it is believed to grant the people good luck for the year and gain a year of age.\n\nThe origin of eating tteokguk on New Year's Day is unknown. However, tteokguk is mentioned in the 19th-century book of customs Dongguksesigi (동국세시기, 東國歲時記) with the custom of having a bowl of tteokguk in the morning of New Year's Day to get a year older, and the custom of saying &quot;How many bowls of tteokguk have you eaten?&quot; to ask a person's age. How many bowls have you eaten?\n\nLactose Free
Make Tteokguk
Tteokguk
Cook Steamed Fish
There is a Chinese saying that explains how important fish dishes are to Chinese cuisine: 无鱼不成席 (Wú Yú Bù Chéng Xí) - meaning that you can’t call it a feast if there is no fish present. Fish prepared in this fashion are the centerpiece of a multi-course meal, either for special occasions or festivals.\n\nFor this recipe, the fish is steamed with its tail, head, and fins intact to best preserve the natural taste of the fish. Some people have variations of seasonings to add their special touch, but usually it is seasoned with a simple soy sauce based dressing with scallions and ginger. If you want to add a bit of heat, some dried chili can be added.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Steamed Fish
Steamed Fish
Cook Angry Flaming Spaghetti
Serve Angry Flaming Spaghetti
Angry Flaming Spaghetti
Chickpea Spaghetti
Serve Spaghetti
Make Jollof Rice and Drumsticks
Jollof Rice is a traditional dish from West Africa, especially familiar in Senegal, Nigeria, and Ghana. It's often cooked altogether in one pot with long-grain rice, vegetables, spices, and even meat, and is packed with flavor! Don't hesitate to make this recipe with drumsticks and plantains for parties and celebrations, but it's perfect for family dinners, too.
Serve Jollof Rice and Drumsticks
Jollof Rice and Drumsticks
Cook Scrambled Eggs with Bacon
Scrambled Eggs with Bacon
Serve Scrambled Eggs with Bacon
Cook Roast Chicken
Bake Rice Cake
Traditionally called 年糕 (Nian Gao), it is also simply known as &quot;Rice Cake.&quot; While it can be eaten all year round, traditionally it is most popular during the Chinese New Year. It is considered good luck to eat during this time of the year because Nian Gao (年糕) is a homonym for &quot;higher year&quot; or &quot;grow every year&quot; (年高), which means &quot;a more prosperous year&quot;. Every family enjoys this treat in the hopes of having a better year ahead. It is also a great gift when visiting family during the holiday.\n\nVegetarian-Safe, Lactose Free
Rice Cake

Make Pão de Queijo
These are not merely cheese buns, these are THE cheese buns to go for. Pão de queijo or literally translated to Cheese Bread, is a popular snack and/or breakfast food in Brazil.\n\nIts origins date to when Minas Gerais cooks replaced the non-existent wheat with starch derived from cassava shown to them by tupiniquins indigenous groups. Added this was grated hard cheese similar to Parmesan later at the end of the 19th century.\n\nCuriously, this recipe is also widely eaten in northern Argentina and is inexpensive, often sold from street-side stands by vendors carrying a heat-preserving container. In Brazil, it is also very commonly found in groceries, supermarkets and bakeries, industrialized or freshly made. Enjoy!\n\nVegetarian-Safe
Serve Pão de Queijo
Pão de Queijo

Serve Pan Fried Tilapia
Pan Fried Tilapia

Make Mucenici
Mucenici is a traditional Romanian pastry prepared for the Christian feast of the 40 Martyrs of Sebaste on March 9th. They are created by rolling and shaping dough into figure eights, which represents eternity and remembrance of the soldiers who were persecuted. The pastries embody the cultural heritage of those who observe the day and celebrate culinary tradition, bringing families together to honor the past and welcome spring.\n\nThe preparation method of mucenici varies depending on the region. In Moldova, the famous Moldavian mucenici are made from sweet bread dough. They are baked in the oven, then coated with honey and sprinkled with walnuts. In Muntenia, Oltenia, and Dobrogea, the dough for mucenici is much simpler, with only three ingredients. These are boiled in water with sugar, walnuts, and cinnamon—the water symbolizing the lake where the soldiers were thrown. Although the preparation method differs, their shape has remained unchanged—the figure 8. The enjoyment of mucenici is a communal activity that strengthens family bonds and cultural identity, making it a cherished part of Romanian heritage.
Serve Mucenici
Mucenici
Make Minced Pork Noodles
This recipe traditional name is 炸酱面 (Zha Jiang Mian) - fried sauce noodles - and is a dish full of flavor. Often found best in back street humble cafés, aside from Peking Duck, this dish is treasured by everyone who tries it.\n\nThe dish consists in three components: minced pork cooked in a salty, fragrant sauce, then served with fresh cooked noodles and various vegetables. Knowing these components have allowed many  to get creative with the ingredients, some people have made this in a vegetarian version with tofu, others have used other meats such as beef or chicken.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Minced Pork Noodles
Minced Pork Noodles
Cook Matzo Ball Soup
Matzo Ball Soup isn't just a staple at many Pesach celebrations; it's also the food your bubbe or zayde might make for you when you're feeling a little under the weather as a cure-all.\n\nThe recipe for matzo ball soup has roots in Ashkenazi Jewish cooking in Eastern Europe and is a type of chicken soup with large dumplings made of matzah meal and eggs; the broth has what's known as schmaltz (chicken fat). Matzah on its own is a flatbread served at Pesach, when Jews refrain from eating leavened bread for the duration of the holiday as of a celebration of their escape from enslavement in Egypt.\n\nHistorically, the matzo balls have actually been called knoedel (or knaidel, or kneidel... exact spelling varies) instead of matzo. Now you can enjoy a soup that's as nourishing for the spirit and soul as it is for the body.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Matzo Ball Soup
Matzo Ball Soup
Make Mămăligă
Mămăligă is a cherished traditional dish found in many Eastern European countries, and some hail it as the national dish of Romania. Originally made with millet flour, today it is a polenta crafted from yellow maize flour. It can be prepared to various consistencies, serving as a comforting porridge or a delightful bread substitute.\n\nMămăligă is incredibly versatile and pairs well with cheese and other toppings. Our own recipe includes cottage cheese, tomatoes, and basil. Rich in history and flavor, mămăligă continues to be a staple in Eastern European cuisine, celebrated for its simplicity and adaptability.
Serve Mămăligă
Mămăligă

Make Knafeh
This Arab dessert is a sweet and savory treat that is quite popular with many cultures.\nKnafeh is made with a traditional shredded pastry that is mixed with clarified butter and includes a layer of cheese. Once cooked, it is soaked in a sweet syrup made from sugar that can be infused with either orange blossom or rose water and is sometimes topped with crushed pistachios.\nThere are many different variations of this dish across the various Arab regions and cultures, but all are quite tasty!\n\nVegetarian-safe.
Serve Knafeh
Knafeh
Hallaca
Some say the word Hallaca comes from the indigenous word &lt;i&gt;ayacá&lt;/i&gt;, which means lump. Others say that the word came from the Spanish word for &lt;i&gt;there (allá)&lt;/i&gt; and &lt;i&gt;here (acá)&lt;/i&gt;, referencing both Spanish and Venezuelan ingredients coming together.\n\nThe Hallaca represents a gesture of friendship, and if you ever visit a Venezuelan around Christmas time you have to try their Hallacas, and you can't say no. Every family and every region of Venezuela have their own version with their own stew or fixings and fillings, but one thing is certain and that is that everybody can say &lt;i&gt;&quot;Las mejores Hallacas son las de mi mamá&quot;&lt;/i&gt; - The best Hallacas are the ones that Mom makes.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Hallacas
Hallacas

Salmon
Smoked, sauced, and savory, this pork rib dish will be sure to please all. As well as being a staple food in the southern United States, Rib dishes are especially prepared in honor of Juneteenth, a holiday celebrating Black freedom, heritage, and family in the US. Usually paired with collard greens, baked beans, and a side of cornbread at the family cookout, this hearty meal is quite the showstopper.\n\nLactose Free

Also known in most countries as Peruvian rotisserie chicken, this preparation originated in Peru in the 1950s and has become a staple in Latin American cuisine. This wonderfully roasted chicken is served usually with French Fries and a side of salad. Delicioso!
Grill Pollo a la Brasa
Pollo a la Brasa
Originating from Spain, Pinchos have become part of Latin American culture. Pinchos can often be found in bars, restaurants, as well as on street vendors. In Latin America, Pinchos are made with a variety of proteins, a favorite is chicken marinated in different sauces or spices.

Were you bitten, or were you born into a werewolf family? However it happened, now you’ve got to decide what kind of wolf you want to be. Find a pack to prowl the night with, meet your fated mate atop Howling Point, or shun all that and try to make it as a lone wolf.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Lycanthrope Lore — There’s a lot to learn about werewolves and their origins. Talk about Holiday Songs
Have a Nice Chat about Holiday Traditions
Ask about Holiday Traditions
For me, the festive season is about getting together with those that mean the most to me. A house full of singing festive songs and dancing together with friends and family is what the holidays have always been about!
My festive traditions? I guess the thing I most fondly remember and always look forward to is getting together and playing some retro video games. They don't make them like they used to!
What do I look forward to the most during the holidays? Definitely the food, and while I enjoy the classics, I like to try traditional foods from different cultures as well.
In my home, you could tell it was that time of the season when all you heard playing on the stereo was the Winter Holiday Station. It was a magical time!
My tradition may seem a little boring to some but since this time of year can be so hectic I mainly look forward to just relaxing with others and watching TV!

Yes, Rebirth now.

Cancel the Rebirth flow.
&lt;i&gt;&lt;b&gt;Is your soul ready to embrace the next chapter?&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/i&gt;\n\nBy choosing to Rebirth, you will set forth on a new journey as a new Sim, leaving your current life behind with no chance of return. You will be taken to Manage Worlds to select the household where your new life will unfold and will have the opportunity to fully customize your reborn self in Create a Sim. While funds, relationships, and achievements from this life will be lost, if you have already unlocked the coveted &lt;b&gt;Burning Soul&lt;/b&gt; trait, you’ll be able to retain one personality trait with the &lt;b&gt;Recall Past Life&lt;/b&gt; self-interaction, along with certain others using the &lt;b&gt;Peer Into Soul&lt;/b&gt; interaction available on mirrors. If you choose to Rebirth as a younger Sim, certain developmental skills will be immediately unlocked!\n\nNow the threads of fate lie before you. The choice to weave a new destiny can be made when you are ready. &lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Will you choose to Rebirth now?&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/i&gt;
{0.SimFirstNameWithPrefix} has passed away!

Now put your heart at rest: they’re just bows, after all. But still, they are sublime in their simplicity and decorative presence. You need them, you want them: Your house will never be the same without them.

The &lt;b&gt;Sulani Preservation Society&lt;/b&gt; officially recognizes you as a collector, archiver, and protector par excellence of Sulani Islands historical artifacts.\n\n&lt;i&gt;&quot;Moon and Sun find rest in Sulani&quot;&lt;/i&gt;\n\nWith the treasure securely in the hold of The Red Annie, her captain, the Dread Pirate Morgan, sailed to oceans unknown to pursue the next grand plunder while behind her, the Ohan'ali Town port lay razed to the ground after the calamitous parlay with Princess Cordelia the Bold, her captain, Rodrigo De Pablo, and the hapless Captain Sam Handwich.\n\nFrom the ashes, Ohan'ali Town was reborn as the prominent destination it is today, and the Mutiny of Ohan'ali became a significant page in the Sulani Islands' history.
The Unshellfish Collector
Well done! The Elder Crustacean Court has sent you this plaque to commemorate your gallant service in the ongoing battle against the mollusks. They are impressed by your fearsome collection that almost rivals their own. Confining so many husks of their sworn enemies to your over-water dwelling is no easy task and surely worthy of this high honor.
It wasn't about the gilded and jeweled treasure. That wasn't the reason you trekked through dangerous jungles and trap filled temples. No, it was this plaque. This plaque is your ultimate reward. Display it with pride.
&quot;Forlorn Frog Friend&quot;

The SimValley Frog Fan &amp; Appreciation Society thought you deserved a reminder that frogs have feelings too. Remember to feed them often!

Ode to Jazz 5: “Ivory”
Princess Cordelia loved piano most of all. Though she had cut her jazz band adrift during her escape from her kingdom, she continued to ache for their music, and so found herself painting instruments. The piano keys in this tribute seem to arch up toward the light, almost as if lifted by the current. Apt, isn’t it?

Ode to Jazz 4: “Feeling Blue”
When The Great Sloth Invasion forced Princess Cordelia to flee, she simply couldn’t fit everyone on her submersible. But firing her beloved jazz band remained a regret so sharp, she painted a series of pictures to honor them. This wistful silhouette portrays one of her musicians still playing blues in the deep blue (purplish) sea.

Even a submersible as grand as the Eppsilon has its limitations. Princess Cordelia had to cast out many employees, including her beloved jazz band. She longed for their music so deeply that she painted a series of pictures as a tribute. This silhouette portrays bass player Martin Maxwell still playing in the depths of the sea. So poignant!

When Princess Cordelia was forced to flee her kingdom, she had to leave her beloved jazz band behind. This wistful silhouette portrays the sax legend Jacob Goldentips still playing in the depths of the sea, which was how the Princess liked to imagine him.

Sea Glass Wall Sconce
The glass of this wall sconce was once clear and crisp. A special machine on the Lady Cordelia’s Submarine processes the glass and gives it this opaque, soft feel. The machine blasts the glass with sand, salt, and steam which weathers this sconce in the same way as natural sea glass.
Cast Iron Flood Light
It can get dark under the sea, particularly when pirates keep toppling into your lamps. This cast iron wall sconce is nearly indestructible, especially when mounted above hat-level. It casts a light so intense that Princess Cordelia’s 2nd pirate boyfriend was known to use it for tanning, until she dumped him for being so vain.
Anemone Wall Sconce
Princess Cordelia was known to lounge by a tide pool for hours, just watching the fragile beauty entrapped within. One of her favorite creatures was the anemone, its petal-like tentacles waving innocently as it waited to ensnare its lunch. With subtle curls and an organic, unassuming form, this elegant wall sconce was created in the anemone’s honor.

If you can't live under the sea like Princess Cordelia, bring the ocean life to you! The Tunicate Wall Sconce is modeled after one of the most beautiful types of sea sponges. It was Princess Cordelia's favorite sconce. She often parked her submarine outside a reef and just soaked in the sea life, metaphorically.

3 Senses Oil Lamp
Light bulbs are good for a lot of things, but they haven’t come close to replicating the rich, golden ambiance of a true antique oil lamp, until now. Handcrafted in the artisan tradition, this electric-powered lamp casts the same flickering lamplight, warmth and even smell of yesteryear’s kerosene companions. Battery compartment is concealed in the base for a cord-free effect.

A Story of Three Candles
Three candles who stand still, save their flickering lights, sought refuge from the impending night. Said one to three, the tallest was he, excuse me please, but I don’t see why we should fear the night, we shine, we glow, we light up so bright. Said three to one, the smallest of thee, it is true we shine so bright, but my wicks height is low, and soon, out of sight.
Four Festive Candles, ho, ho, ho!
Chandlers have long sought the elusive fourth candle display. Three is a magic number, its placement always perfect, but four… the placement never feels right, the function never flows properly, the je ne sais quoi was always off. But now, beauty has frozen in time, form and function have come together as one! “Four Festive Candles, ho, ho, ho,” is testament to that journey, that perfection CAN be found, even in the elusive “four.”
Bright Idea Robot Lamp
Imagine, if robots could actually think, what bright ideas they’d have! This playful little bot is a glowing addition to any tot’s desk or nightstand. Simply flip the switch for a brilliant idea that lights up the room.
Kid's Soccer Ball Light
Is better lighting a GOAL in your kids’ room? Give it a real KICK with this sporty table light! (It’s a soccer ball.)
Kid's Table Light
Worried about the “tone” in your kids’ room? Lighten up with this lovely table light!

Koi is actually a shortening of nishikigoi meaning&quot;brocaded carp.&quot; A pretty name for a pretty fish.

Unlike a domestic cat, this fish uses its whiskers to taste its surroundings. Like thin little tongues.

OK (Get 50,000 Simoleons)

We can offer you this one time gift of 50,000 Simoleons to help you on your way.\n\nDid you know, you can also...\n\n&lt;ul type=&quot;circle&quot;&gt;&lt;li&gt;Pick up the phone to start a Career to earn a steady income&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Or take up a Hobby like Painting, and sell your Sims' creations!&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;
