Your Sim's first Aspiration!  What does your Sim aspire to?  Will they be a Bestselling Author, Serial Romantic, Fabulously Wealthy, or the Chief of Mischief?
&quot;Hello, My Name Is…&quot;\n&#xD;&#xA;Name your Sim!  Who are they?  Click on the text to expand the Name Panel, and type in First and Last names for the Sim. No idea what to name your Sim?  Click Randomize Name and let us pick one for you!
Click on the Pick an Aspiration button to make your selection. Most Aspiration categories have multiple options. For instance, click on Food and choose between Master Chef and Master Mixologist!\n&#xD;&#xA;Once you select an Aspiration, your Sim receives a Bonus Trait that you can see next to your selected Aspiration.
Who is your Sim?\n&#xD;&#xA;Click on the Personality button to begin answering just who your Sim  is.  You can choose your Sim's Age, Gender, Walk Style, Voice, and if you have more then one Sim in your household, their Relationships to one another.
Outfits
Maybe you noticed the Outfit Slots that appear when you select an Outfit Category?  Every category can have up to 5 slots!  Just click the [+] button to add a new Outfit Slot and begin customizing a host of outfits for your Sim!\n&#xD;&#xA;Note:  You can delete the slots by clicking the [x] button that appears on hover, but you can't delete the currently selected Outfit!
Each category sets a preset filter of clothing options to choose from.  This filter is only a suggestion of appropriate items per occasion.  Feel free to change or remove the filters as you wish!
To change the clothes in an outfit, select that outfit category and start trying new clothes on!  What the Sim is wearing is the current outfit.
Every Sim has several outfit categories they can customize for themselves:  Everyday, Formal, Athletic, Sleepwear, and Party!\n&#xD;&#xA;Click on the occasion icons at the top of any clothing catalog to begin customizing that outfit!
Your Sim can have outfits for all occasions.  Learn more?   NOT USED, IF YOU SEE THIS ITS A BUG
Muscle and Fat Sliders
Modifications to the body can be added to enhance or hinder the effects of the Muscle and Fat sliders.\n&#xD;&#xA;Try dragging the Fat slider all the way to the top, and then drag the parts of your Sim's body to create a unique shape that suits your desires!
Muscle and Fat adjustments apply to the entire Sim.  Muscle controls define shape and size, while Fat controls a layer of 'soft' bulk.\n&#xD;&#xA;Click on your Sim's body to access the Muscle and Fat sliders. Click and drag the sliders to adjust them.
How Filters Work
Filters are additive, all items conform to the filters on the list.  If nothing shows up in the catalog for your selection (your desire for a Red and Blue, Cotton blend, Designer Basics Sleep outfit may be too specific), try turning off some of your filter options.\n&#xD;&#xA;To remove a filter, click on the [x] for the one you wish to remove, or click the Clear All button to start over.
Pro Tip:  Filters can be used to modify Outfit Categories.  If you don't want to be limited to Sleepwear for sleeping, turn off the Outfit Category filter, and find exactly what you want with other filter options.
Clothing, Accessories and Styled Looks have a powerful filter system that lets you find the exact piece of clothing you're looking for!\n&#xD;&#xA;Click the Open Filter Panel arrow at the top of a clothing catalog to view the Filter options.
As filters are turned on, they are added to the list above the catalog. So even when the panel is closed, you'll know what's being filtered.
Filters can be very helpful. Learn More?    NOT USED, IF YOU SEE THIS ITS A BUG
Face Modifiers
You can adjust the scale and position for each part of your Sim's face!\n&#xD;&#xA;Click and drag on any part of your Sim's face to customize their look to match your imagination!
Rotate your Sim to the side to access even more drag options for your Sims!\n&#xD;&#xA;Note:  Some parts of the face can only be modified from a side view, such as nose length!
If you don't want to start from scratch, click on your Sim's face and choose the Face option from the context menu to access the Faces and Skin Tone catalog. Or click on the individual parts of your Sim's face to see their catalog (click on the nose!).\n\nTip: Try various parts from the catalogs to get a shape you want before adjusting it by hand.
There are unique facial archetypes that you can select to make your Sims look appropriate for different ethnicities.  You cannot achieve the look of one shape by manipulating another -- Choose an archetype carefully!\n&#xD;&#xA;Tip:  Accentuate the presets for dramatic effects!
There is an important lesson on how the New Face parts work.  Check it out?   NOT USED
Detail Edit Mode
Detail Edit Mode exposes a separate layer of adjustments on most parts of your Sim's face.\n&#xD;&#xA;Activate Detail Edit Mode by zooming into the face (click on the face) and then clicking on the Detail Edit Mode button or Double Click on any facial feature
Once you have finished playing in Detail Edit Mode, click Exit Detail Edit Mode or click on an open spot on the screen to return to Face Mode, where your adjustments remain for overall scaling and position.
Face Sculpting is powerful in The Sims 4.  Get the most out of the new tools.   NOT USED
Learn More   NOT USED
Adding Sims
You can add more than one Sim to your Household by clicking on the Add a Sim button.  Choose Add New Sim to add a random Sim to your household.
You can't have a household of more than 8 Sims.  And only households of young adult or older will be valid for moving into a home.
You can add Sims to this household in Household management.  Learn more?  NOT USED, IF YOU SEE THIS ITS A BUG
Create a Sim
Expand your household with the Add a Sim button.  You can Play with Genetics to add a child, sibling (twins!), or parent.\n&#xD;&#xA;Click the Edit Relationships to define relationships between the members of your household.
Select an Aspiration, Traits, Voice, and Walk Style for your Sim! Don't forget to name your Sim!
Welcome to The Sims 4 Create a Sim!\n&#xD;&#xA;This lesson will provide a quick overview of the features available in Create a Sim!  To learn more, select any lesson from this Lessons panel.  Or, click on the buttons to see what happens.
Once you've found a starting point, you can directly interact with your Sim!  Click on what they are wearing to see clothing choices. Click and drag on the body or face to shape them.\nRotate your Sim using the arrows to modify the body from different angles. Pro Tip: The [&amp;lt;]/[&amp;gt;] keys can also rotate your Sim.
Like what you've made?  Share your creations to the Gallery!\n&#xD;&#xA;Click the Save Household button to save your Sims to your personal Library, or share them to the Gallery for others to download and enjoy!
Create a Sim starts you off with a pre-made Sim to mold and transform. Want to see something different? Click Randomize to quickly see what's possible.
Camera Controls
Click on your Sim's Head to zoom in to the face to see more detail.  Click away from the face or click on your Sim’s body to zoom out and see the full Sim.
You can use the mouse wheel to zoom the camera in and out with greater precision.\n&#xD;&#xA;Pro Tip:  The [+]/[-] keys can also be used to control the camera zoom.
Can't drag the part of your Sim you were hoping to?  Rotate your Sims to find and manipulate other points of the face and body.
Use the arrows below your Sim to Rotate to set positions.\n&#xD;&#xA;Or hold the right mouse button and drag to rotate your Sim with greater precision.
Body Modifiers / Presets
Click and drag on any part of your Sim's body, to create uniquely shaped Sims!
If you don't want to start from scratch, click on your Sim's body and choose the Body option from the context menu.  The Bodies and Skin Tone catalog includes common and extreme body shapes that you can simply pick and use!\n&#xD;&#xA;Note:  This will modify your Muscle and Fat settings.
Rotate your Sim to the side to access even more drag options for your Sim!\n&#xD;&#xA;Note:  Some parts of the body can only be modified from a side view, such as belly size.
Add a Genetic Sim
In the Genetics panel, choose a Relationship (Child, Sibling, or Parent), pick who they are related to, select Gender and Age, and roll your new Sim by clicking the Randomize button.\n&#xD;&#xA;If you like the result, click the Checkmark to add the new Sim to your household.
Click on the Add a Sim button and choose Playing with Genetics to add a new Sim to your household that uses the other household members as their 'gene pool'.
When creating a Sim by Playing with Genetics, relationships are automatically applied.\n&#xD;&#xA;Note:  If you select Sibling as their relationship, you have the option of creating a twin!
Creating a Sim with Genetics is a fun and effective way to build a family.  Learn more?  NOT USED
Water Tool
With an empty hole dug into your lot, open the Terrain Tools section in Build Mode, then select the Water Tool category. Here, you'll find four buttons: Raise Water, Lower Water, Fill to Height, and Remove Water.\n\nTo turn a hole into a pond, you'll always start with the Raise Water button. With this button selected, the location you click within a hole is where the water line will fill to. If you click and hold, the water will incrementally continue to fill the hole until the water reaches the top.
If you want to reduce the amount of water that's filling a hole, use the Lower Water button. With this button selected, you can click on any water surface created by the Water Tool, and you will lower the water a small amount. You may also click and hold to continue lowering the water line until it reaches the desired depth within the hole.
Ponds can be decorated with a variety of objects, which can be found within the Outdoor Water Décor, and Water Features sections of Build Mode. In addition to placing decorative objects, you can select a Water Style to change the appearance of the water itself. In the Pond Effects category, you'll find cards you can place on the surface of a pond, which will attract designated wildlife or other effects to their location while in Live Mode.
When the Remove Water button is selected, any water surface you click on that was created by the Water Tool will be removed, and an empty hole in the terrain will be left behind. Any objects that were floating on the surface of the water will automatically be moved to your household's inventory when the water is removed.
The Fill to Height button allows you to select a specific height that you want the water line to be set at. This can be useful when you want the water line to be at the same height across multiple separate ponds.\n\nWith the Fill to Height button selected, you will see a white square adjacent to your cursor, which indicates the height at which water will fill to when clicked. A tooltip will also automatically appear that explains how to raise and lower the height of the white square, so that you can specify the precise height at which you want the water line set to.
Sims can fish in ponds that have been stocked with fish and have a Fishing Sign in them. Ponds can be stocked with any discovered fish in your Household Collections. Explore the world to find different types of fish, bring them back, and stock them in your home's pond for convenient future fishing!
Before using the Water Tool to add a pond, lake, tributary, or any other naturally occurring water feature to your lot, you're going to need a hole to put all that water in. Visit the Terrain Manipulation lesson if you need additional information on how to dig a hole into your lot's terrain.
Having areas of shallow water along the edge of a pond is essential if you want Sims to interact with the pond. In addition, some objects (&lt;i&gt;for example - Water Emitters&lt;/i&gt;) are only allowed to be placed in shallow water within ponds. To help with this, you can enable the Water Depth Map, which is a checkbox located within the Water Tool. This visualization will show the shallow areas of your pond in bright green, and will fade to blue in deeper water.\n\nYou can also use the Terrain Manipulation tools while the Water Depth Map is turned on, allowing you see how shallow or deep a pond is as you adjust the terrain underneath it. You can press the &quot;P&quot; key to toggle the Water Depth Map on and off in either of these two Build tools.
Lot Info Panel
If the lot currently isn’t occupied by any Sims, you can also change the lot’s type by clicking the Lot Type button. This will expand a dropdown list with all the currently available lot types.
You can click the Gallery button next to each lot type to open up “My Library”, pre-filtered to only show lots of that type.
Click the Lot Info button to open the Lot Info Panel.
From here you can modify various details about your lot such as bedroom and bathroom count, and the lot’s name. You can also view details about the Lot’s current Value and Dimensions.
Click to learn more about the Venues button.
The Lower Terrain tool will lower terrain by clicking and holding your cursor over any empty terrain on the loaded lot. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; while clicking will reverse the effects. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Use the Speed Slider to determine how fast or slow the terrain will lower.
The Flatten Lot button can be found in 2 places. In the terrain Tools UI panel it is the tool that is colored Blue to denote that it is actually a one click button. It can also be found in the Bulldoze  drop down at the top of the screen.
The Flatten Terrain tool will adjust terrain to the denoted height of the Height Widget. The Height Widget will snap to the small Topography Lines by default. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; will make the height widget snap to the large Topography Lines.
The Smooth Terrain tool will smooth terrain by clicking and holding your cursor over any empty terrain on the loaded lot. The Smooth Terrain Tool is very helpful for making terrain routable for Sims. To ensure a specific area of terrain is routable make sure you turn on your Topography Lines by clicking &quot;G&quot;. Any Terrain that does not have Topography Lines will be routable for your Sims.
The Raise Terrain tool will raise terrain by clicking and holding your cursor over any empty terrain on the loaded lot. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; while clicking will reverse the effects. The &quot;[ ]&quot; keys will change the size of your brush. Use the Speed Slider to determine how fast or slow the terrain will rise.
The Flatten to Height tool although similar to the Flatten terrain tool give you more control over the specific heights. Using the Height Slider in the UI you can raise and lower the Height Widget to set the terrain to your desired height. You can also hold the &quot;Ctrl&quot; Key and press the &quot;[ ]&quot; buttons to raise and lower the height widget.
Objects by... Catalogs
The Build Catalog is the home to all of the architectural elements found in Build Mode.\n\nHover your mouse over the various house parts in the catalog, and click to select the highlighted sort.\n\nProTip: [F3] is the shortcut for navigating directly to the Build Catalog.
New home builders might want to start in the Empty Rooms and Walls catalog, where you can find blocks, rooms, and walls to begin building.\n\nThe first two items in this catalog are the Wall and Room Tools. Use these to draw a custom room. Or select any of the other options to place pre-shaped rooms which you can customize to your liking.
Choose Objects by Function and use the pop-up menu to view items by function, such as Electronics, Decorations, or Plumbing. Then click one of the sub-sort buttons to further narrow down your options.\n\nUse the Show All sub-sort to view all of the choices within your function category selection.
Click on Objects by Room and select a room style from the options at the top such as Kitchen, Bedroom, or Study. Then click on the Room Portrait to find furnishings appropriate to your chosen room sort.
Once you've built your house, you'll want to furnish it. Click on Objects by Room or Objects by Function to find everything you need to fill out your home.
Wall and Foundation height can be adjusted from within the Build Catalog.\n\nYou can adjust both of these at any time without worrying about damaging your home, though you may have to clean up your staircases if you remove your foundation.
Click to learn more about Navigate Catalog by Function.
Move House
You can also use the Move House tool to quickly sell your home by clicking on the Sell button that appears when you pick it up.\n\nTo end the Move House operation hit [Esc] or select a different tool from the toolbar.
Click on any room or wall to select all connected rooms and walls.\n\nUse the Rotate and Move options in the context menu to reposition your home.
Selecting Move House will set the floor to the maximum floor level in order to see your entire structure.\n\nDe-selecting the tool will return you to your previously selected floor level.
Click the Move House tool to move an entire structure to a new location on the lot.
Click to learn more about Move Whole House.
Wall Tool
Select the Wall Tool and click to begin drawing a wall. Click again to complete the action.\n\nIf you draw an enclosed space with the Wall Tool, it will turn into a room with a floor. You can convert a wall into a room by selecting the wall and dragging the side arrows.\n\nNote: Hit [Esc] to cancel any in progress Build action, such as drawing a wall.
Click on the Rooms and Walls catalog and choose the Empty Rooms sort to find the Wall Tool. Use the Wall Tool to draw individual walls. The cost for placement is attached to the top of the Wall Tool as you drag.\n\nNote: There is also a Room Tool that you can use to draw custom rooms.
When drawing walls, you may notice green and yellow highlights.\n\nGreen indicates the wall has passed through architecture that will be modified in some way.\n\nYellow indicates an object that will be moved to the Household Inventory, or sold.
While using the Wall Tool, you can hold the [shift] key to draw a rectangle instead of a single wall. You can also hold the [ctrl] key to destroy any wall it is drawn over.
Click to learn more about the Wall Tool.
Lot Traits
To apply Lot Traits, enter Build Mode and select the Lot Info Panel. You can view traits currently slotted, replace or remove any traits that aren't locked. 
Gold lightbulbs and pluses appear around Sims doing actions related to Lot Traits and Lot Challenges.\n\nHave fun playing with different combinations of these Traits and Challenges!
Lot Traits can be applied to all types of venues. Besides apartments and residences, you can apply traits to commercial venues as well. For example, you can make a Bar with Great Acoustics that is good for performers, since they gain skill faster!
Lot Traits are like Sim traits; they give personality to your lot or venue. Most of the traits are great for specific types of Sims and cater to their Skills. They also provide opportunities to tell your own stories.
Household Inventory
Household Inventory is only available in Build Mode for lots you own. Objects that you don't want to sell, that the game has moved for you, or in some cases that were delivered to you, can all end up in the Household Inventory.\n\nNote: You will get a quick notification when an item is added to the Household Inventory.
Similar objects added to the Household Inventory will create a stack. You can see how many a stack contains by the number next to the objects picture. Click on the number to expand the inventory to see the entire stack.
Some actions will cause objects to be moved into the Household Inventory. These objects will highlight yellow. Completing the action will move all of the yellow highlighted objects to the Household Inventory.\n\nYou can also place objects into the Household Inventory by picking them up and clicking Place in Inventory.
Click on the Household Inventory to open the catalog. Use the Function sort pop up and Filters to manage your view within the Household Inventory.\n\nNote: Search will not find objects in the Household Inventory.
Click to learn more about the Household Inventory.
Filter Panel
Filters can also be used to find all of the objects that have been unlocked. Select the Content Filter category, and choose Unlocks.
Turning on Build Mode Filters will find all objects that satisfy any of the Filter choices within the current catalog.\n\nTo remove a filter, click on the [x] for the one you wish to remove, or click the Clear All button to start over.
To pass Quality Assurance, each shirt had a tester mashing the buttons repeatedly for 48 hours. We are now confident that this shirt is bug free and will not freeze with excessive use.

Some reward traits will make your Sim build skills faster. Morning Sim boosts skill gain during the day, while Night Owl boosts skill gain during the night. Choose wisely!

“{M0.Prince}{F0.Princess} of Pranks.” “Destroyer of {1.String}” All titles bestowed upon {0.SimFirstName} for {M0.his}{F0.her} maniacal ingenuity when decorating the gym for the {1.String} Dance. Sure, {M0.he}{F0.she} got in a bit of trouble with the teachers, but that’s part of the fun! All of the school thinks {0.SimFirstName} is hilarious and the dance was way better than it would have been otherwise.
Why decorate for a {1.String} Dance when you could sabotage it instead? That was the thought anyway. {0.SimFirstName} probably should have just decorated like {M0.he}{F0.she} said {M0.he}{F0.she} would. Not only were the pranks disappointing rather than funny, but when the teacher bit into a cookie covered in ketchup—they knew exactly who to blame. {0.SimFirstName} spent the rest of the day sitting in the hall while everyone else had fun.
{0.SimFirstName} might have been tasked with setting up for “a {1.String} Dance,” but instead, {M0.he’d}{F0.she’d} be setting up for “THE {1.String} Dance.” With a flurry of banners, streamers, cookies and punch (not literally—that would be messy), {0.SimFirstName} decorated the gym for a {1.String} Dance that would be remembered for years to come!
{0.SimFirstName} went in with hopes ablaze! {M0.He’d}{F0.She’d} planned to make this the best {1.String} dance ever! That was before {M0.he}{F0.she} saw what {M0.he}{F0.she} had to work with. Crumpled decorations. No snacks. Polka music! To make matters worse, nobody else had volunteered. When the dance started, everyone blamed {0.SimFirstName} for the lame time they had.
It took most of the day for {0.SimFirstName} to work up the nerve and ask that special sim to the party, but it was totally worth it! {0.SimFirstName} stole shy glances at {M0.his}{F0.her} date as they congregated along the wall and awkwardly chatted about their classes, school sports, and the weather (which oddly had been much more active as of late)! By the time the party was over, {0.SimFirstName}’s heart was a flutter!
It took courage! That’s what {0.SimFirstName} would have to keep telling {M0.himself}{F0.herself}. The moment {M0.he}{F0.she} asked that special sim to the {1.String} Party, was the exact same moment {M0.he}{F0.she} got shot down. The response “No” had been instantaneous and followed by the cruel snickers of {M0.his}{F0.her} classmates. {0.SimFirstName} spent the party hiding in the bathroom. Embarrassed. With a llama cookie—which was delicious but didn’t make up for what had just happened.
{0.SimFirstName} wasn’t interested in inviting anyone in particular. Instead, {M0.he}{F0.she} decided to focus simply on being the life of the party! While {M0.his}{F0.her} classmates indulged in awkward banter and ‘wallflowering,’ {0.SimFirstName} lead the charge for fun! Who delivered flowers to everyone in attendance? Who started a Chubby Llama competition? And who talked the teacher into playing the cool music? {0.SimFirstName}, of course! It was an epic school party that begged only one question: Whatever did {0.SimFirstName} do with the chaperones?
Was it the fact that {0.SimFirstName} went alone that made it the worst {1.String} School Party of all time? OR was it the fact that {M0.he}{F0.she} spilled punch all over {M0.himself}{F0.herself}, slipped on the floor, and then accidentally knocked down a teacher! Because, although {0.SimFirstName} felt pretty awkward standing along the wall alone, the whole knocking down a teacher thing was really bad.
“Sensitive, Sweet, Charming, Thought-provoking”—these are a few of the descriptors kids are whispering about {0.SimFirstName} in the halls. Some say, the school bully renounced his previous ‘taxation” on school lunches, the popular girls are allowing anyone to sit with them (even if they aren’t wearing pink), and nobody has been stuffed in a locker today—and all because of {0.SimFirstName}’s cards! Is this what being a teen legend feels like?

The glass lives encased in a window frame made of parts salvaged from the wreck of the infamous pirate galleon, Maraudade, symbolizing the country's harmony with their piracy culture.

Gibbi Point
It's been many years since Gibbi Point experienced the Great Wave, a seismic event that swept through and helped carve out unique landmarks and created lush flora and fauna the likes of which many Sims had never expected to see! Once a part of a jellyfish processing industry, Jellyfish Junction more recently rebranded itself as an eccentric, artsy neighborhood with scenic harbor views. Crystal Valley has been transformed from a gold mining community into more subdued spot home to a large, feathered creature and the fabled Electric Lagoon. Wanderwood Wilds is a secluded, woodsy neighborhood where you can find Hothead Rock Geyser. The locals say it's a real blast. A peculiar climate, Gibbi Point's weather sees all seasons (even snow!); however, its many underground hot springs keep the waters tepid and inviting, allowing for swimming and water activities year-round.
Fluttery and Feathery
You'll want to fly over to Gibbi Point as fast as you can once you hear that it hosts many winged delights; from its unique butterfly and moth population to the storied Peculiar Plumbird, there's a flock-o-fun to be had here.
Outdoor Activities
Looking to spend a little more time taking in some fresh air, or looking to take on some new activities in general? Try your hand at archery or kayaking, or go for a little dive off the diving board at a pool. Unique festivals will have you dipping your toes into all sorts of outdoorsy endeavors. 
Natural Wonders
Wend your way towards awe-inspiring natural landmarks such as Hothead Rock Geyser, the jellyfish-filled Electric Lagoon, and Underlight Bay.
Adventure Around Every Corner

Evergreen Harbor
Sandwiched between rolling hills of evergreen forest on one side and the waters of the Willupette Sound on the other, Evergreen Harbor used to be the industrial hub of the region. However, as the world changed around it, the region has struggled to keep up. A place where Sims value their community and neighborly love isn't just a pastime, Evergreen Harbor now stands on the precipice of making its own future. The only question is: what kind of future will it be?

Grims Quarry

StrangerVille
Welcome to StrangerVille: &quot;The only thing stranger than the people is the flora!&quot; StrangerVille is a quiet little town with a strange problem. The residents are very friendly, but at night things start to get more interesting. If you want to find out more about this town you can find Military Personnel hanging out at the Local Bar, Scientists researching at the Local Library, and that Curio Shop stand is sure to have some strange odds and ends by the trailer park.
Interesting Locals
You’d be hard pressed to find hospitality like this anywhere else. Just try not to let them get too close…
Shady Acres Vista

Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Dine Out
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Cozy Bistro Kit
Nectar Bar Stories
Serve the finest Nectar by night and the richest coffee by day. Fill your bistro with candlelight and classic décor to create the perfect spot for Sims to connect with friends or dates.
A Neighborhood Favorite
Craft a space that’s all about good Nectar and great company. Decorate with all the trappings of a treasured local bistro including wood paneled walls, polished metal accents, and vintage furniture that has been beautifully maintained. 
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Silver Screen Style Kit

Embody an unstoppable persona. Dress for the moment you discover a scandal, reveal your secret plot, or get away with your prize. These are dramatic looks for when you want to feel iconic.
Bold, Beautiful, and Dangerous
Look confident and capable in sparkling jewelry, a faux fur-trimmed coat, and sleek shoes in addition to gowns and suits that create classic silhouettes.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Comfy Gamer Kit
A Little Sims-y
Who wouldn’t want a mini cow plant hanging over their head? This kit has all kinds of callouts to The Sims, including a grilled cheese mini-library and an adorable alarm clock.

Use the décor in this kit to make your computer area feel homey, relaxing, and completely yours with plants, clutter, and gaming accessories. There are even cubed cubbies for displaying knickknacks and other treasured items that make you happy!
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Modern Menswear Kit
Experiment with Style
Refined and subversive, these looks reinvigorate the basics. Play with scalloped or pleated skirts and latticed sweaters, or pair a polished shirtdress with iconic loafers to model up-and-coming culture.
Get into the Details
Update your Sim’s closet with trendy wardrobe staples. Fluid shapes add intrigue to any outfit, while zippers, cutouts, and pleats lend everyday outfits a touch of the contemporary. 
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 &lt;i&gt;Star Wars™&lt;/i&gt; : Journey to Batuu
Get Your Own Lightsaber and Droid 
Explore Batuu to find kyber crystals and hilts for the most coveted &lt;i&gt;Star Wars™&lt;/i&gt; artifact: a lightsaber. Collect every piece to construct a blade that’s all your own. Or visit the Droid Depot and purchase your very own droid to help you on your adventures.
Unite with Iconic Characters
The possibilities shift depending on your Sim’s actions—will you choose to support Kylo Ren in his efforts to uncover the Resistance base, or will you join Rey and Vi Moradi in the fight against the First Order?
Create Your &lt;i&gt;Star Wars™&lt;/i&gt; Story
The Resistance, First Order, and scoundrels are fighting to control Batuu, but your Sims' actions determine who will succeed. As Sims undertake challenges and special missions, you’ll tip the balance of power.
Experience the Edge of the Galaxy
Your Sims are definitely not at home anymore. From the &lt;i&gt;Millennium Falcon&lt;/i&gt; to the bustling Cantina and unique attire of Batuu, Sims will be surrounded by the iconic sights and sounds of &lt;i&gt;Star Wars™&lt;/i&gt;.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Storybook Nursery Kit
A Legacy of Elegance
Raise your little one among ornate furniture including shelves and a changing table. Some of these items, like the crib with the sweeping canopy and the tasteful chandelier, may have been passed down through the generations.
A Touch of Whimsy
Inspired by classic fairy tales and the elegance of ages past, this collection features delicately crafted toys, pleasant wallpaper, a dreamy mobile, and a dollhouse modeled after the traditional home of an old, prominent family.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Werewolves
Lycanthrope Lore
You have a lot to learn about werewolves. Unravel werewolf, vampire, and spellcaster lore as you read books, discover secret tunnels, and interact with denizens of Moonwood Mill.
Alpha or Lone Wolf?
Craft your werewolf identity. Were you bitten, or were you born into it? Decide what kind of wolf you want to be. Find a pack to prowl the night with or shun all that and try to make it as a lone wolf.
Life on the Wild Side
What big teeth you’ll have! Transform into a werewolf and embrace (or fight) your animalistic nature. Werewolf Sims will have unique temperaments and abilities as they experience wolf-specific life events.

This kit has all the essentials your Sims need to share some good times. Throw a birthday party, a big bash complete with a disco ball, or a chill hangout session with friends. 
Celebrate Anything
These decorations don’t just fade into the background – not even the backdrops! Coordinate with matching pieces or mix and match to create the perfect mood for any occasion.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Artist Studio Kit
Artful Décor
Add an artistic flourish to your canvas and your studio. Add paint splatter to the ground and clutter items like palettes, cans, tubes, brushes, and stacked sketch books to every shelf and corner.
An Artist’s Tools
Give your Sims more ways to express their creativity. There’s a new easel, tablet, and woodworking table for Sims to use in their artistic endeavors. Place inspiring still-life references, a backdrop, and other props to really help your creativity flow.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Lovestruck
Date Nights in an Unforgettable City
Fall in love in a city made for romance! Ciudad Enamorada has plenty of places for Sims to meet, flirt, and more. The Singles Hangout Lot Trait attracts available Sims to mingle.
For Lovers of Love
Romance Skill unlocks seductive interactions like Scan the Room for finding compatible Sims. Romance Consultants make a career out of loving love!
All About Attraction
Turn-Ons and Turn-Offs determine how attracted Sims are to each other. Get to know their partners, build up Romantic Satisfaction, and experience different Relationship Dynamics.
Plan hotter dates
Find matches on Cupid’s Corner via phone or computer to set your Sim’s heart racing. Plan your own date. Learn about each other over Party Games, dress up with the Costume Trunk, and enjoy the Romantic Blanket for that special moment.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Get Together
Discover Windenburg!
Explore this beautiful new world with its scenic neighborhoods and lively hotspots including local pubs, cafes, and discotheques, as well as the mysterious ancient ruins, picturesque bluffs, and the sprawling Von Haunt Estate.
New Dancing &amp; DJ Skills
Pump up the crowd by creating the perfect mix on the DJ Booth. Then jump on the dance floor, challenge other Sims to a dance battle, and show off your dance moves.
Get Together
Meet up with other Sims for exciting group activities including bonfires, foosball, darts, Don’t Wake The Llama, and more! There’s always a great reason for your Sims to get together! 
Create &amp; Join Clubs
Create and join unique Clubs where you set activities, select the members, choose their style, and customize their hangouts. Playing with your Clubs also unlocks Club Perks for you to enjoy!
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Discover University
Express Your Campus Style
Develop your Sim's personal style in any way you choose – whether wearing late-for-class sweatpants or their best-self slacks, there’s always a way to show school spirit or impress a classmate.
Meet, Mingle, and Explore
How your Sim embraces college life is up to them. Study all night or chill out. Embark in many activities like juice pong, soccer, and hang out with roommates. Sims can join school organizations, or even a mysterious secret society.
Class...with Class
Attend a class or work on term papers and presentations – the more your Sim learns, the better they will be in careers like teaching, law, and engineering. Going to classes or blowing them off will affect your Sim’s grades, so time management is a must.
Settle into School
Enroll in the historical University of Britechester or modern Foxbury Institute. Live in a dorm room or off-campus, explore Britechester on a bicycle, spend time in the student commons, and have a study session at the library.

Make the most out of your Sims’ space with the Murphy Bed combo. This medium-sized furniture combo comes with a Two-Seat Loveseat attached to a large Storage Compartment.
Build Your Small Space
Downsize your Sims’ dwellings with this brand-new, residential lot that provides fun-sized challenges and unique benefits to your Sims when they meet the tiny home requirements.

Trendy yet playful kids clothing and hairstyles let Sims showcase their individual style, or highlight their obsession with the latest tween heartthrob.

Build kids bedrooms that are both expressive and full of style. Excite your Sim’s imagination with colorful new furniture and themed decorations ranging from space robots to fun flower flourishes.

With the all-new puppet theater and a bit of imagination, Sims can tell a variety of whimsical stories to entertain an audience of family and friends.
Battle with Monsters
Collect and trade monster cards featuring your Sim’s favorite magical creatures. Use cards in the electronic battle station to bring them to life and challenge friends to a monster duel that’s sure to excite.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Horse Ranch
Enjoy a Thriving Community
Chestnut Ridge has a lively social scene. Your Sims can go into town to meet friends at the bar, blow off steam at the dance hall, or train at the equestrian park. They can host cookouts and dances on their ranch, and hire a Ranch Hand to help when the work builds up. 
Make a Life on the Ranch
Spend your days keeping your animals happy and clean, harvesting Prairie Grass to feed them, collecting Manure to fertilize your plants, and making your own Nectar. Do it all on a ranch you design.
Bond with Animals
Fill your ranch with adorable Mini Goats and Mini Sheep and invite neighbors to see how cute they are. Raise foals to become lifelong companions and champions.
Own and Train Horses
Ring the bell to summon your Sim’s own live-in butler who can cook meals, tidy the home, greet guests, and fulfill most every request. Praise the butler to receive quicker service that’ll keep your Sims living luxuriously.
Welcome to The Sims™ 4 Adventure Awaits
Adventure Around Every Corner
Explore Gibbi Point's neighborhoods: Wanderwood Wilds, Crystal Valley, Jellyfish Junction. Meet unique Sims, uncover quests, and see the Underlight Bay. Attend festivals, start a Park Worker Career, or enjoy themed Getaways. Find the Plumbird!
A Life of Play
Fun is for all ages. Build skills with Papercraft, Entomology, Diving, and Archery. Make Papercrafts, raise Butterflies, Trade Collectables, and go Kayaking! Spin Bikes and Free Weights keep adults active. Refresh with smoothies from the Blender.
Adventure Starts at Childhood
Childhood fun shapes life! Kids develop traits through Formative Moments and Childhood Sentiments. Customize playgrounds, play games, and have Imaginary Friends with unique personalities. Choose from Goofball, Competitive, Creative, or Evil dolls.
Time for a Getaway?
Embark on new experiences with Getaways and Custom Venues. Plan activities for Sims to recharge or compete with Elimination Rules. Build unique venues and share them on the Gallery. Adventure Awaits wherever you plan your Getaway!

When it’s finally time, feel the love and live out every fantasy. Exchange vows, rings, and kisses at the altar before the real celebration starts. Kick it off by serving tea for the family, or head right to the reception.
Bring Your Vision to Life
Get into the details of upcoming nuptials as Sims select their wedding day attire and everything else they’ll need for the big moment: menu, décor, schedule, venue… all of it!
Prep for the Big Day!
Popping the question is just the beginning of your Sim’s wedding experience. Once they’ve said yes, the excitement and nerves set in—there’s so much to plan!

Outfit your kitchen with small appliances like a stand mixer, waffle maker, or countertop pizza oven to expand your culinary horizons. As Sims upgrade their skills, they’ll be able to do more with these new appliances and discover more delicious recipes.

Good-enough-to-eat style.
You can’t have a kitchen renovation and then show up in yesterday’s fashions. A variety of new hairstyles and trendy, casual apparel will ensure your Sim is eating their ice cream in style.

From cabinets with frosted glass doors to new stainless steel appliances, create the coolest kitchen worthy of a master chef for your Sims to cook and chill in.

Welcome to The Sims™ 4 StrangerVille
Secret Lab
Locals say ever since the Secret Lab got built, the town has been…acting weird. But the only way to find out is to investigate! Traverse the lowest levels of the Secret Lab and see what hides behind the curtain.
Leave No Stone Unturned
With the new StrangerVille Mystery Aspiration, your Sims will be in headfirst into the investigation. Can your Sims uncover what is truly behind what is plaguing the town?
Roger That
Join the all new Military Career, where your Sim can become a Grand Marshall. Or maybe take the path of a Covert Operator to keep tabs on suspicious (or maybe, not that suspicious *wink*) Sims in the world.
Welcome to StrangerVille!
A seemingly normal world shrouded in secrecy. Watch the world change before you as you dig deeper and deeper into the mystery. Unravel its secrets to the world, fall in love with its charm.

Decorating should be fun and carefree! Give your room a quirky side with irregular, but simple, shapes in dreamy pastel colors. This collection has heart chairs, mirrors shaped like puddles, and even more ways to incorporate whimsy into everyday design.

Sims with adventurous tastes can dig into new experimental cuisine that looks almost too good to eat! Serious foodies can snap food selfies to memorialize these edible masterpieces or learn to cook them at home.

Take your Sims out to enjoy a delicious meal with exceptional service. Restaurants are the perfect place to catch up with friends over brunch, spend time with family, or have a romantic date, all without having to do the dishes.
Become a Restaurateur 
You are in control of owning and running a restaurant. Hire and outfit staff, set the menu and prices, and chat up diners to improve customer satisfaction!
Build a variety of restaurant venues from a classic diner to an upscale Italian bistro, or customize pre-made restaurants using new objects and décor. Personalize your space by adding an outdoor patio, comfy booth seating, or unique signage.

Advanced stages of Rabid Rodent Fever are highly contagious, and left untreated will result in death.
Keep your pet rodent well fed and their habitat clean, or they’ll start to dislike you.
Don’t fret if your pet rodent escapes their habitat. They’ll be back, and they may even send you a postcard from their travels!
Pet rodents age faster than Sims. Order an Anti-Aging Treat from a PC or the Vet Clinic if you can’t bear losing them.
Tired of your pet rodent’s shenanigans? Order an IQ Limiter Treat from a PC or the Vet Clinic.
Try adding laundry additives to your Washing Machine for some extra fragrance… or funk.
Dryer lint traps are infamous for starting fires. Remember to clean yours before it becomes a problem.
Looking for an eco-friendly laundry alternative? Try using the Wash Tub and Clothesline.
Piles of used clothing will start to stink. Place them in a Hamper to keep your home fresher longer.
Successfully completing all of the endurance climb challenges on the Rock Wall grants access to a dangerous fire climb.
You don't need expensive and bulky workout equipment to stay in shape; try a workout video on your TV.

Sims will show up to bowl at Bars, Nightclubs, and Lounges that are equipped with bowling lanes.
Sims improve at bowling as they play. Highly skilled bowlers will wear bowling gloves on the lane.

Vampires gain experience, rank up, and unlock more powers.

There are ways to tame Vampire thirst without drinking from Sims.

Completing more Milestones as an Infant gives them a head start on their Toddler Skills.
Milestones are a collection of your Sims' experiences. Try achieving as many as you can!
Achieving Milestones unlocks new interactions and behaviors for your Sims!
Increase your Fabrication Skill by using the Fabricator or the Candle Making Table.

One way Sims can gain Influence is through job promotions!

You don't need Kava Roots to make Kava, but it is preferable.

If you want to be covered when it rains, don’t forget to place the Umbri Umbrella Rack on your lot and take an Umbrella!

Gnomes love fun stuff – try appeasing them with a toy! Or else feel their wrath…
Have a green thumb? Join or make a career out of Gardening.
Grow your own flowers? Make arrangements for free!
Sims can use friendly socials to declare love or hate for a particular weather or temperature.

Be careful of those mud puddles, they are quite slippery.
The Sprinkle-O-Matic is an easy way to keep your garden watered consistently, and is not a bad way to cool off from the heat.
If you rake enough leaves you’ll get a large pile of leaves that your Sims can Burn, Play In, or even Woohoo in.
Your gardening plants will grow based on the seasons, so check out their growing information in the tooltips and Notebook.

Welcome to Your Getaway
This lot is the temporary home for all Sims on this Getaway, complete with a Schedule to guide the adventure ahead. Each day includes main activities and role activities, which can be viewed or adjusted anytime from the top-left panel in Live Mode. Follow the plan or break away, the outcome still brings special rewards based on how the Getaway unfolds!\n\nSelect &lt;b&gt;Learn More&lt;/b&gt; below for a quick overview!

No functioning Ticket Kiosks! To collect Ticket Sales from customers, place a new Kiosk, replace any broken Kiosks, and make sure the lot is connected to the utility grid.
Ticket Kiosk is Inaccessible
No accessible Ticket Kiosks! Close the Small Business and place a new Kiosk or move an existing Kiosk to a location where the customers can reach.
Close Small Business
A Hobby Class is still running! If you close the Small Business now, the Class will cancel without payment.

 • {0.String}
Resident Grant
For teens and young adults, the place they live may offer grants providing students financial help in pursuing a university education. Each location has its own grant amounts, and students are encouraged to apply and represent their community!
Sports &amp; E-Sports Scholarships
There are a few scholarships that require Sims to participate in an after-school activity as part of their requirements. An Athletics scholarship requires the Sim to be a Soccer Team Player, while the E-Sports Scholarship requires the Sim to be E-Sports Competitor. A Sim cannot be accepted by both of these scholarships at the same time.
Career Scholarships
Universities want to encourage younger Sims that may already be dipping their toes in the job market. These scholarships offer teen and young adult Sims who have achieved some amount of career success with a way to help pay for a university education that can boost them in their career of choice in the future.
Skill Scholarships
Sims who have developed any number of practical skills are eligible to apply for a variety of skill-based scholarships. Those hours spent working on cooking, fishing, handiness, and many other skills can turn into scholarship funds! However, these scholarships are targeted at younger students and so are not available to adult or elder Sims.
Need-Based Scholarships
Every Sim deserves a university education, and the need-based Education for All and Helping Hand scholarships are designed to give Sims from households with less a chance to attend. Sims with less savings and assets are encouraged to apply!
Distinguished Scholarships
Sims who have been accepted into distinguished degree programs will automatically receive scholarships, with an amount based on how many distinguished degrees they’ve gotten into. Working on a Sim’s grade and skills before applying can lead to more degree acceptances and, in turn, more scholarship money!
{0.SimFirstName} has the best chance of earning these scholarships:\n\n{1.String}

Start of Term
{0.SimName}'s university term begins today and will last for 5 weekdays! {M0.He}{F0.She} should take a look at {M0.his}{F0.her} class schedule and plan on when to do {M0.his}{F0.her} homework and study, when to eat, and - if there's time left - when to kick back and have some fun.

Course Name
Final Grades
Suspended!
Smooth Fox Terrier
The Smooth Fox Terrier is a highly energetic dog, and thus not recommended for first time dog owners. As the breed was originally bred to go after small animals they also have a high prey instinct, they are very friendly dogs and don't mind strangers.
Pit Bull
Pit bulls were created by breeding bulldogs and terriers together to produce a dog that combined the gameness and agility of the terrier with the strength of the bulldog.
Newfoundland
The Newfoundlands have webbed feet and a water-resistant coat. Known for its calm and docile nature and its strength. They are highly loyal and make ideal working dogs. It is for this reason that this breed is known as &quot;the gentle giant&quot;.
Burmese
Originally, all Burmese cats were dark brown (sable), but are now available in a wide variety of colours; formal recognition of these also varies by standard. Both versions of the breed are known for their uniquely social and playful temperament and persistent vocalisation.
Boxer
Boxers were originally bred to be medium-size guard dogs. Today, although they are a part of the AKC’s Working Group, they mostly find homes as loving family companions. Jill will change this later.
Pharaoh Hound
Pharaoh Hounds have no link with Ancient Egypt. However, a popular myth holds that the breed is descended from the Tesem, one of the ancient Egyptian hunting dogs. Some believe that there are similarities between the breed and images of dogs found on the walls of ancient Egyptian tombs.
A tame feline descended from multiple/unknown breeds, often propagating without any intervention, record-keeping or selective reproduction. Commonly known as Domestic or Tomcats.&#xA;
Japanese Bobtail
The Japanese Bobtail is a breed of domestic cat with an unusual &quot;bobbed&quot; tail more closely resembling the tail of a rabbit than that of other cats. 
Alaskan Malamute
Alaskan Malamutes are still in use as sled dogs for personal travel, hauling freight, or helping move light objects; some, however, are used for the recreational pursuit of sledding, also known as mushing, as well as for skijoring, bikejoring, carting, and canicross.
Havanese
The Havanese is a toy dog. It is smart and can be easily trained. It is best to train this dog at a young age, because some habits will stick as they become older.
Chartreux
Chartreux cats are also known for their &quot;smile&quot;: due to the structure of their heads and their tapered muzzles, they often appear to be smiling. Chartreux are exceptional hunters and are highly prized by farmers.
Oriental Shorthair
Orientals are social, intelligent, and many are rather vocal. They often remain playful into adulthood, with many enjoying playing fetch. Despite their slender appearance, they are athletic and can leap into high places.
English Springer Spaniel
The typical Spaniel is friendly, eager to please, quick to learn and willing to obey. In the right circumstances they can be an affectionate and easy-going family dog.
Russian Blue
The Russian Blue is a cat breed that comes in colors varying from a light shimmering silver to a darker, slate grey. They develop close bonds with their owners and are sought out as pets due to their personalities, beauty and coat.
King Charles Spaniel
The breed is highly affectionate, playful, extremely patient and eager to please. As such, dogs of the breed are good with children and other dogs. Cavaliers are not shy about socialising with much larger dogs.
Bengal
The Bengal is a domestic cat breed developed to look like exotic jungle cats such as leopards, ocelots, margays and clouded leopards. Bengal cats were developed by the selective breeding of domestic cats and hybrids of the asian leopard cat.
Siberian Husky
The original Siberian Huskies were bred by the Chukchi people — whose hunter-gatherer culture relied on their help. It is an active, energetic, resilient breed, whose ancestors lived in the extremely cold and harsh environment of the Siberian Arctic.
American Wirehair
American Wirehairs are similar to American Shorthairs, with the exception of a springy, wiry coat, including ear fur, and whiskers. This coat is similar to the wire coats of some dog breeds, such as terriers. Their fur requires little grooming, although lighter cats may require sunblock.
British Shorthair
The British Shorthair is the pedigreed version of the traditional British domestic cat, with a distinctively chunky body, dense coat and broad face. Jill will change this wikipedia sourced text.
Shih Tzu
Although a Shih Tzu's temperament varies from dog to dog, the breed has a personality and temperament that is loyal, affectionate, outgoing, and alert. Training and proper socializing must start at a young age for the Shih Tzu to obey basic commands, for the Shih Tzu is prone to stubbornness when it comes to training.
Bernese Mountain Dog
Bernese are outdoor dogs at heart, though well-behaved in the house; they need activity and exercise, but do not have a great deal of endurance. They can move with amazing bursts of speed for their size when motivated.
Samoyed
Samoyeds' friendly disposition makes them poor guard dogs; an aggressive Samoyed is rare. The breed is characterized by an alert and happy expression which has earned the nicknames &quot;Sammie smile&quot; and &quot;smiley dog&quot;.
Akita
The Akita is a powerful, independent and dominant breed, commonly aloof with strangers but affectionate with family members.
Tuxedo
A bicolor cat or piebald cat is a cat with white fur combined with fur of some other color, for example black or tabby.
Shiba Inu
The Shiba is a relatively fastidious breed and feels the need to maintain itself in a clean state. They can often be seen licking their paws and legs, much like a cat. They generally go out of their way to keep their coats clean.
Schipperke
Known for a stubborn, mischievous, and headstrong temperament, it also chases small animals. The Schipperke is sometimes referred to as the &quot;little black fox&quot;, the &quot;Tasmanian black devil&quot;, or the &quot;little black devil&quot;. They are naturally curious and high-energy dogs and require ample exercise and supervision.
Ocicat
Ocicats are friendly and sociable and are not often shy around strangers. This makes them good family pets, and most can also get along well with animals of other species. Their temperament is similar to that of a dog and are often referred to as a &quot;dog in a cat's body&quot;.
German Rex
The German Rex is a medium-sized breed with slender legs of a medium length.It is considered a very friendly cat and quickly bonds with its owner. It is lively, playful, and intelligent.
Rhodesian Ridgeback
Rhodesian ridgebacks are loyal, intelligent, and somewhat aloof to strangers. This breed requires positive, reward-based training, good socialization and consistency; it is often not the best choice for inexperienced dog owners.
Somali
The Somalis are recognized for their bushy tails, large almond eyes, and large pointed ears, earning the breed its nickname of &quot;Fox Cat.&quot; Their ticked coats, containing between four and twenty colors on each hair, are very fine in texture, making their coats softer to the touch.
Irish Terrier
Irish Terriers are active dogs and need and enjoy consistent mental and physical challenges. Full of life, but not hyperactive; it should be able to relax inside the house and be roused to full activity level quickly.
American Eskimo
The American Eskimo is an affectionate, loving dog. The breed is easy to train and they are excellent with children because of the dog's high intelligence and its willingness to please.
Shetland Sheepdog
The general appearance of the Sheltie is that of a miniature Rough Collie. They are a small, double coated, working dog, agile and sturdy.
French Bulldog
The French Bulldog, like many other companion dog breeds, requires close contact with humans. They have fairly minimal exercise needs, but do require at least daily short walks. The French Bulldog is sometimes called &quot;Frog dog&quot; or a &quot;Clown dog&quot;.
Yorkshire Terrier
The ideal Yorkshire Terrier character or &quot;personality&quot; is described with a &quot;carriage very upright&quot; and &quot;conveying an important air.&quot; Though small, the Yorkshire Terrier is active, very overprotective, curious, and fond of attention. 
Savannah
Some Savannahs are reported to be very social and friendly with new people and other cats and dogs, while others may run and hide or revert to hissing and growling when seeing a stranger. Exposure to other people and pets is most likely the key factor in sociability as Savannah kittens grow up.
Turkish Angora
Turkish Angora cats are playful, intelligent, athletic and involved. They bond with humans, but often select a particular member of the family to be their constant companion. They are in turn, very protective of their person.
Irish Wolfhound
Irish wolfhounds have a varied range of personalities and are most often noted for their personal quirks and individualism. An Irish wolfhound, however, is rarely mindless, and despite its large size is rarely found to be destructive in the house or boisterous.
Bluetick Coonhound
Bluetick Coonhounds are bred to be hunting dogs. They are athletic, hardy, and need a full-time job or activity such as hunting, obedience, or agility to stay happy. They can be challenging to train and they should be monitored around cats or other small animals.
Australian Cattle Dog
Like many working dogs, the Australian Cattle Dog has high energy levels, an active mind, and a level of independence. The Australian Cattle Dog is a sturdy, muscular, compact dog that gives the impression of agility and strength.
Bombay Cat
The Bombay cat breed is a type of short-haired cats developed by breeding sable Burmese and black American Shorthair cats, to produce a cat of mostly Burmese type, but with a sleek, panther-like black coat.
Collie
The collie is a medium-sized, fairly lightly built dog, with a pointed snout. Many types have a distinctive white pattern over the shoulders. Collies are very active and agile, and most types of collies have a very strong herding instinct.
Balinese
The Balinese is a long-haired breed of domestic cat with Siamese-style point coloration and sapphire-blue eyes. The Balinese is also known as the purebred long-haired Siamese, since it originated as a natural mutation of that breed, and hence is essentially the same cat with a medium-length silky coat and a distinctively plumed tail.
Jack Russell Terrier
Jack Russells are first and foremost a working terrier. Originally bred to bolt fox from their dens during hunts, they are used on numerous ground-dwelling quarry such as groundhog, badger, and red and grey fox.
Border Collie
Considered highly intelligent, extremely energetic, acrobatic and athletic, Border Collies frequently compete with great success in sheepdog trials and dog sports.
Devon Rex
The Devon Rex is a breed of cat with a curly, very soft short coat similar to that of the Cornish Rex. They are often associated with being one of the most hypoallergenic cats available because of their type of coat. However, they are technically not hypoallergenic.
Dalmatian
Dalmatian serves as a firehouse mascot and is sometimes used to educate the public in fire safety, but in the days of horse-drawn fire carts, they provided a valuable service, having a natural affinity to horses.
Labrador Retriever
Labradors have a reputation as a very even-tempered breed and an excellent family dog. This includes a good reputation with children of all ages and other animals.
Kurilian Bobtail
In the wild, this cat is an excellent fisher and hunter, which may explain why the Kurilian loves to play in water. The Kurilian's wild look is not reflected in the temperament of the breed. It is known for its clever and gentle nature.
Bloodhound
This breed is gentle, and is tireless when following a scent. Because of its strong tracking instinct, it can be willful and somewhat difficult to obedience train and handle on a leash.
German Pointer
The German Shorthaired Pointer was developed to be a dog suited for family life as well as a versatile hunter. Therefore their temperament is that of an intelligent, bold, boisterous, eccentric, and characteristically affectionate dog that is cooperative and easily trained.
Egyptian Mau
Egyptian Maus are a small- to medium-sized short-haired cat breed. Along with the Bahraini Dilmun cat, they are one of the few naturally spotted breeds of domesticated cat. The spots of the Mau occur on only the tips of the hairs of its coat.
Chow Chow
Chow Chows tend to display discernment of strangers and can become fiercely protective of their owners and property. For these reasons, some owners have attributed a cat-like personality to the Chow Chow.
Black Cat
The folklore surrounding black cats varies from culture to culture. Some see them as a symbol of prosperity, while others see them as a symbol of luck; either good or bad.
Greyhound
The Greyhound is a breed of dog, a sighthound which has been bred for coursing game and Greyhound racing. Since the rise in large-scale adoption of retired racing Greyhounds, it has seen a resurgence in popularity as a family pet. Jill will change this wikipedia sourced text
Keeshond
Keeshonden tend to be very playful, with quick reflexes and strong jumping ability. They are eager to please and very quick learners, which means they are also quick to learn things their humans did not intend to teach them.
Foxhound
A foxhound is a type of large hunting hound bred for strong hunting instincts, great energy, and, like all scent hounds, a keen sense of smell.
Lhasa Apso
Having been bred as an indoor monastery sentinel dog by Tibetan Buddhist monks, Lhasa Apsos are alert with a keen sense of hearing. The ideal Lhasa temperament is to be wary of strangers while being loyal to those closest to them. 
Beagle
Beagles are noisy hunting dogs. They look best while wearing old timey detective hats. This is placeholder text that Jill should change. It will be seen in CAP, probably the gallery, and perhaps in live mode.
Mixed Breed
A domesticated canine descended from multiple breeds, often propagating without any intervention, record-keeping or selective reproduction. Commonly known as Mutts.&#xA;
Bulldog
The Bulldog is a breed with characteristically wide head and shoulders along with a pronounced mandibular prognathism. There are generally thick folds of skin on a Bulldog's brow; round, black, wide-set eyes; a short muzzle with characteristic folds called a rope or nose roll above the nose; hanging skin under the neck; drooping lips and pointed teeth, and an underbite with an upturned jaw.
Norwegian Forest
Norwegian Forest cats have a quiet voice but can develop a loud voice if kept in a house with a dog. They are friendly, intelligent, and generally good with people. The Norwegian Forest cat has a lot of energy and can be very demanding of attention.
Pekingese
The Pekingese breed is over 2000 years old and has hardly changed in all that time. The Pekingese's flat face and large eyes are some of the breeds most obvious characteristics. The body is compact and low to the ground.
Pug
The breed is often described by the Latin phrase multum in parvo, or &quot;much in little&quot; or &quot;a lot of dog in a small space&quot;, alluding to the Pug's remarkable and charming personality, despite its small size.
Whippet
Items on the table are preventing your order from being delivered. Clear the table to receive your order.

Unknown Satisfaction
This Sim's Romantic Satisfaction is unknown. This can be learned by &quot;Asking about Romantic Satisfaction&quot; which is found in the &quot;Relationship&quot; pie menu category beneath the &quot;Learn More&quot; subcategory.
Amazing Compatibility
Like two perfect pieces of a puzzle, these Sims just click! Based on their Likes and Dislikes, they have the &lt;b&gt;highest level of social compatibility&lt;/b&gt;. Building a strong friendship between these two Sims should take much less effort than usual.
Good Compatibility
Hey, not bad! Based on their Likes and Dislikes, these Sims have pretty &lt;b&gt;good social compatibility&lt;/b&gt;. They might not become best friends instantly, but it certainly won't be a challenge for them to get along.
Bad Compatibility
Based on their Likes and Dislikes, these Sims have &lt;b&gt;bad social compatibility&lt;/b&gt;. Their affinity from the start won't be great, but it could certainly be worse. While building a friendship will be a challenge for them, that doesn't mean it's not worth trying!
Awful Compatibility
Oh no! Based on their Likes and Dislikes, these Sims have &lt;b&gt;awful social compatibility&lt;/b&gt;. To grow this relationship, both Sims will need to put in more effort than usual as they seek to overcome their many differences.
Unknown Attraction Level
There needs to be more information to tell how this Sim feels. Get to know them better, and you can ask.

New Horse
Congratulations! You have a Horse! Owning a Horse is a way of life that requires hard work, training, and lots of care.\n\nTo properly care for a Horse, you'll need a handful of items. Stock up from Build Mode through &lt;b&gt;Objects by Room&lt;/b&gt;: go to the &lt;b&gt;Outdoors&lt;/b&gt; section and then &lt;b&gt;Animals&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nHelpful items may include:\n\n⚒ &lt;b&gt;Hay Now! Animal Feeder&lt;/b&gt;\n⚒ &lt;b&gt;Hay Now! Horse Water Trough&lt;/b&gt;\n⚒ &lt;b&gt;Hay Now! Horse Bed&lt;/b&gt;\n⚒ &lt;b&gt;Hay Now! One Big Ball&lt;/b&gt;\n⚒ &lt;b&gt;Horse Jumps or Barrels&lt;/b&gt;&#xD;&#xA;

Story Scenarios
Start your gameplay with a unique story and household, and choose your Sims' fate!
Learn how to achieve amazing things step-by-step and take charge of a Sim's story!
Welcome Scenarios
Use your creativity and Sims-skills to triumph over unique circumstances!

Unlocks to change the way other Sims in the world will interact with your Club while socializing.
Club Status (Only 1 Allowed)
Unlocks to gain interactions to set a Club Vibe. Club Vibes will change the mood of all the members in your Club Gathering!
Club Vibe
Unlocks to improve overall Club management and efficiency.
Club Management
Unlocking Club Perks will cause members to build the associated skills faster while in Club Gatherings.
Skill Bonuses
Unlocks to receive better social outcomes while your Sims are socializing during a Club Gathering.
Social Bonuses
Unlocks to allow Sims in your Club to perform a special Club Handshake. Your Club can only have 1 Handshake.
Club Handshake (Only 1 Allowed)
Unlocks to allow access to Club specific Clothing and Objects.
Clothing and Décor
Unlocks to increase the number of Club members you can invite into your Club.

Handcrafted Holiday Etchings

And you think to yourself &quot;Is this the find?&quot; And you pick it up, looking for flaws, imperfections, and there are none. And you toss it in your cart, thinking &quot;It is, I found the holiday find!&quot;\n\nYea, I made that.

Live music by an impoverished artist? An abundant supply of garish household décor? No, one can never have too much decor! Add “This” to your collection, and be envied by all!
