CletusBobs
Player
Castellano
Blueee
Zoe lights up every room she enters. She's been passionate about dance since preschool, and her natural curiosity has led her to explore many difference dance forms and techniques. As a young Latinx woman, family and community are incredibly important to Zoe. She brings her values to life by volunteering as a youth dance teacher at a local community center. Someday, she may even manage to teach her boyfriend Jayden to dance as well!
These two are quite the couple. Gladys is always out looking for excitement in all the wrong ways and Vernon usually finds himself glooming over the tiny details in life.
While Valeria spent her early years with her mother's family in Japan, she left with her mom and dad to travel the world for her father's research work when she was still young. They haven't stopped moving since! Thankfully, she's kept in contact with her best friend, Emiko Mori! Now that she's an adult, she needs to figure out what to do with her life: adventure, explore her father's Venezuelan heritage, or take on a new challenge?
Tristen grew up an only child in Brindleton Bay. Despite being a quiet Sim, rural life never appealed to Tristen, so he moved to the city the first chance he got. Will his sarcastic wit shine through and help him make new friends despite being a loner? Who knows! But if not, a dog or cat are always an option... maybe even a roommate!
Tommi never really liked the name 'Tomasina,' so she's been 'Tommi' as long as she can remember. She's a business professional with big dreams! Unfortunately, she keeps getting passed up for promotions (that Sydney Wright gets). It must be Sydney's quick wit and huge vocabulary! Will a friendship ever develop or is it all downhill from here?
Tim Johnson, reared in the suit-and-tie world of metro Washington, D.C., secretly keeps a still-working skateboard under his bed to pay homage to his birthplace: sunny, gnarly, hella-good California. And every now and again, when no one is looking, he still rides it.
With a quick wit and a huge vocabulary, Sydney is quietly competitive, focused, and ambitious. She works at one of the nation's premiere business firms, where she's been promoted twice in under two years. As an only child, Sydney craves the real conversation and deeper connection you get in one-on-one friendships. Ever loyal, with incredibly high standards, Sydney is slow to let people into her inner circle. Once there, you're a friend for life.
Somewhere in an alternate dimension, a Steve Fogel exists that's a big-rig trucker. In this reality though, Steve has bigger career goals in mind... He dreams of being a space trucker, hauling cargo across the cosmos. It's this bold ambition that attracted his wife, June, to his side. With her healthy cooking, he will be spaceworthy in no time. As a natural goof, you may find him at a comedy club practicing his (harmless) one-liners on the crowd.
Sophia is a unique artist, as she's gifted with synesthesia. She's overwhelmed by colors as she walks through the world, which causes her to scurry home and put paint to canvas while images are still vivid in her mind. Though she tends to focus on her art in lieu of a social life, she still holds lingering feelings for Ollie Purdue, who she once had a brief fling with before he settled down.
For Sean, social norms are there to be broken. Of course, there isn't much to to rebel against in the idyllic neighborhood of Willow Creek, so Sean resorts to... unconventional means... On weekends, he beats children at chess in the park (cheating, if necessary.) He once made out with an elder, just to freak out his mom. He loves to self quote himself; his favorite being, &quot;I eat plaid for breakfast. Spikeburgers for lunch. No authority for dessert.&quot;
For Ross, everything needs to be clean, he doesn't like kids (aka germ-monsters), and he has a quick temper. That said, there was never a Sim who loved doing laundry quite as much, he's great around adults, and he doesn't let interpersonal-relationship problems fester! Perhaps the most frustrating aspect of his life is that spoiled Kierra Tilo won't stop messaging him, and his beloved Brent Hong doesn't know he exists. Such is life!
On the surface, Daniel and Mary-Sue Pleasant seem to have the perfect life, but is their love a flimsy façade? And can Angela and Lilith make the right choices when it comes to love? Celebrate the 19th year of The Sims with the Pleasant Family.
Is that a Silver Dollar Pancake? Nope, it's just the newest little addition to Bob &amp; Eliza's pancake stack! Meet their son Iggy, a charming toddler who's bringing a small measure of harmony to the Pancakes' household.
Oh Ollie... He's always been a bit of a dreamer in life. His family worried he was destined to be destitute, his artistic talents going unrecognized. It turned out, he simply needed his muse. While nursing a drink in The Blue Velvet Nightclub one evening, he locked eyes with Babs—his life was never the same again. A whirlwind romance with Babs led to marriage and fatherhood; Ollie would never be called a starving artist again!
Bold and dynamic, Noah is all about using photography &amp; film to evoke emotion and get people talking. Both on and off set, he's happiest when he's calling the shots, or making people laugh. He will admit that he's maybe a little too obsessed with his Simstagram followers, but they've certainly helped expand his career. Witty, confident, and motivated by success, Noah can sometimes come across as having a little too much ego—but it's all in the name of his art.
Bob and Betty Newbie are back in a Sims 4 iteration of the family inspired by past Sims games. Celebrate the 19th year of The Sims with these classic characters.
Morgan is all-in, all the time. Driven by her life-long love of sport, Morgan believes life is meant to be lived, not spent behind a desk. She's always up for any adventure her friends suggest, and always pushes herself to do more. With her track and cross-country scholarships, she was always a top performing athlete at university. She's currently training for her first Iron Man competition, which means a lot of time in the pool and on a bike.
Sul, Sul! Here is the Sim of actress and trailblazer, Millie Bobby Brown!
With a head for numbers, and a creative eye, Mia splits her time between freelance programmer and artist gigs. Being both a bit of an introvert, and a bit of a rebel, this independence suited her outlook in life. Mia has a unique way of attracting creative, high-energy friends like Noah, and her girlfriend Dela. They love her genuine, almost kid-like enthusiasm. She is the glue that bonds her social circles together.
Marco is a painter who has never really known what he wants in life. What he does know is that he's happy with a brush in his hand and a cup of coffee at his side. More than anything he likes painting people. Wrinkley Sims, round Sims, youthful Sims, Sims with no hair, Sims with blue hair! He believes distinctions are what make Sims so beautiful, and he wants to capture every small detail.
Celebrate the Lunar New Year and Year of the Pig with the Zhao family!
Some Sims dream of being a master chef, but not Li Loh. He wants to master the Art of Mixology. Dazzle patrons near and far with fantastical drinks, bizarre concoctions, and gift them with the art of his moves. He's spent years studying, traveled around the world experiencing the drinks of different cultures, and he's ready. Oh, he's ready.
Lacey's parents frequently tell her she needs to grow up. She's teetering on the brink between party girl and socialite, has distinctly different social groups in each category, and hasn't committed to either path yet. To keep this double life in check, she calls herself Stacey whenever she's attending a highbrow affair.
Kurt comes from an impressive lineage of lumberjacks. While forestry is in his blood, his real passion lies in apiculture (or Beekeeping)! Kurt loves his little bumblies. He even tried to make a shop selling bee products called Kurt's Bees–which didn't go over super well. As long as he's stuck in Granite Falls, he knows he will never get out of the family business, so Kurt is off on an adventure, beyond his comfort zone, to chase his dreams!
Kierra is your average-run-of-the-mill-heiress who grew up in a beach-mansion. It's hard being Kierra! She's has always had to wonder if people don't just like her because of her money, or her hot tub, or her hair. It -is- fabulous! Occasionally, she likes to dress down and pretend to be 'normal.' It doesn't help that her crush Ross Valentin snubs her whenever he gets the chance. He's the only guy that's never been interested!
Quirky, creative, a hopeless romantic... Kat is a sweetheart who has aspirations to chase a career in fashion. Her dark secret: She's obsessed with dinosaurs and other buried secrets. While part of her would like to give up fashion and pursue archaeology, it's a little out of her comfort zone. For now, she's content to collect as many dino-curios and fossils as she can and display them around the house... or is she?
There are those who might say Kasen is a bit materialistic... He'd say he has good taste (but let's face it, they wouldn't be wrong). Designer shirt §300 Simoleons. Designer Glasses: §450 Simoleons. His haircut: §200 Simoleons. Maybe someday he will achieve his goals of becoming a famous DJ, but for now... he's glad to just look good.
A bit of a flirt, Kaiden is a sweetie looking for genuine connections. He's easily likeable and not afraid to show off his silly side. Kaiden's biggest flaw: he's a little too obsessed with Thorne Bailey's music. (It horrifies his friends when he shows up dressed like Thorne to parties.) Even still, Kaiden hopes he can overcome his timidity and make it big in the entertainment business just like his role-model.
Kai doesn't need a weight bench to workout—the world is his gym. Whether he's jogging, swimming, or competing in sports, he's never not moving. His questionable sense of social cues has yet to hold him back in life; case in point—he doesn't receive pushback (or complaints) despite his proclivity to walk around shirtless. His physique is practically a walking billboard for his side hustle of mentoring other Sims in their exercise regimens.
Nothing will deter June from accomplishing her goals in life, even if they are a bit erratic. She once got WAY into woodworking... random, right? But she followed through; months of hard work in the gym built the muscles she needed to carve every piece of furniture in her home from a solid oak tree. Something else she realized she wanted was Steve Fogel—they're an odd couple, but ambition is a trait this pair will never find themselves short of.
Jayden is a personal trainer, with an easy and charming approach to life. Starting in childhood, he found camaraderie through sports, and satisfaction through challenging himself to do his best in any physical feat. Ultimately, that's what drew him to his work as a personal trainer. Always curious and down for anything, Jayden's mellow attitude is a great complement to his girlfriend, Zoe—a feisty, outgoing professional dancer.
Big hearted and expressive, Hunter is an outspoken activist for the LGBTQIA community; he's passionate about creating space for people to come together and feel supported. He's cultivated a huge social media following, and his followers count on him to document every moment for the world to see. When he's not authoring content for his channel, he partners with his bestie Camille on a nutrition and wellness series.
Holly likes to daydream about becoming a famous country singer, but in reality she's a down home southern girl. From sun up to sun set, you'll find her in the great outdoors—typically with a fishing rod in hand.
The Grunts from Sims 2 Strangetown are back! Tank has always lived under the hard thumb of his father, Grand Marshal Buzz Grunt. In this domesticated boot camp, can Tank prove his worth to this demanding dad? How will Ripp and Buck fair in a family not quite their 'style'? Celebrate the 19th year of The Sims with these classic characters.
George is a buttoned up kind of guy. He keeps his head down, works hard, and wants the world to recognize his vast array of skills. At home though, it's a different story. That's when any noble pursuits get cast aside in favor of junk food and video games. His darkest secret? He keeps voodoo dolls of his friends, observes them from afar, and waits for the perfect opportunity to torment them. His second darkest secret? He wishes he was a cowboy. 
Gael is a bit clumsy and kind of messy, but he always has the best intentions! So what if he accidentally set his sister's beloved bowler on fire three times? Those things are ridiculously flammable! He thinks his twin sister, Gabby, and her friends are the best, so he regularly tags along—even if they don't have a lot in common. Deep down, what he really wants is to meet a group of buds to watch the next big game together.
Something of a hipster, Gabby changed her name when 'Gabriela' became the new baby name sensation of the year. She loves going to festivals with friends! Unfortunately, her twin brother Gael regularly tags along, trying to fit in. It's weird, but she loves him. Though she used to be uptight... years of taking care of Gael's messes have mellowed Gabby, and now she'd rather spend a chill evening, listening to the best undiscovered artists.
Erroll fancies himself a musician, but he really needs a manager to provide better direction to his career. In his last get-famous-quick scheme, he applied to a reality music competition. When he lost in the final episode, his star faded. Ultimately, people just don't remember second place. Ever since then he's overhauled his wardrobe to dress himself just like the producers did on the show, hoping to be recognized around town. Sadly, nobody has yet.
To Emiko, duality is a lifestyle. She's both cutesy and rebellious. Sweet and tough. Her pastimes include: playing with dolls, doing makeup tutorials online, chasing the Flower Bunny (who she adores), and throwing the best parties. Technology is an important aspect of Emiko's life, especially since her childhood best friend, Valeria Lopez, moved away from Japan at a young age. It's allowed them to keep in touch.
As a kid, Dela lived all over the world, shadowing her mum-a globally sought-after fashion photographer. That experience gave Dela an inherent sense of optimism and a deep entrepreneurial spirit. She recently launched her first fashion line, and her unique pieces and global style is starting to get press. Her girlfriend Mia-a designer in her own right-helps keep her informed of trends outside the fashion industry.
From a young age, it was obvious that Cassidy would blossom as a musical prodigy. She would fight with her brother, Ollie, over her need to diligently practice the piano—Ollie just wanted a quiet home to draw in. As a teen, she took up the guitar and quickly mastered that as well. To Cassidy, technology is a bore... She'd much rather spend an afternoon exploring a vintage record store.

Ingredients reduce the cost and can improve the Quality of a dish. Fresh Ingredients can be gathered, grown or purchased from various locations throughout the world. Prepped Ingredients are created in the Stand Mixer and can be used to replace Fresh Ingredients as well as decrease the cooking time of selected recipes.

Enter Create a Sim
Milestones
Milestones mark memorable moments across a Sim's life. Hover over the different categories to learn more.\nSome categories and Milestones are only available for certain Life Stages. Select &lt;b&gt;View Milestones&lt;/b&gt; to see all completed Milestones.
Luck
Lifestyles
Lifestyles are an expression of a Sim's behaviors and habits over time.
Lifestyles
This Sim has enough Character Values to receive this Trait when aging up to Young Adult:
Upon aging up to Young Adult, this Sim can earn one of the following Traits:
Character Values
Character Values determine a Sim's ability to adapt and behave effectively in everyday life. Each value can be positive or negative.\n\nHover over each of the Values below to view interactions that the child can do to influence Character Values. Parents can also influence these values by using Parenting Interactions.
Explore the Ghost Mastery panel to track progress, stamina, and access the perks panel. Ghost Mastery is categorized into Evil, Neutral, and Good, shaping the type of ghost a Sim can become. Hover over each ability in the perks panel to learn more.\n\nGhosts use stamina when performing abilities. As stamina depletes, ghosts will appear more faded, which can be monitored using the stamina meter.\n\nTo reset unlocked abilities, visit the the Well of Longing and Regret in Crow's Crossing neighborhood of Ravenwood at anytime.&#xD;&#xA;
Ghost Mastery
Fame Points:
Staying Out of the Spotlight
Fame Info
A Sim's Public Image is comprised of &lt;i&gt;Reputation&lt;/i&gt; and &lt;i&gt;Celebrity Level&lt;/i&gt;.\n\nReputation is what others think of them, and can be changed by doing certain behaviors while being observed by others.\n\nCelebrity Level measures how famous they are, and can be increased by performing actions that gain fame. Attaining levels gain Fame Points, which can be spent in the Fame Info Panel to unlock new Fame Perks. The panel may also be used to opt a Sim out of fame gain entirely.
Public Image
Celebrity Level Lost
{0.SimName} has lost fame and is now a {1.String}.
Batuu Reputation
This panel displays your Sims reputation with the 3 factions of Batuu. Scoundrel Reputation can be gained and lost independently of the other 2 factions. However, Resistance and First Order cannot be gained without losing reputation in the other. Hover over each reputation bar to see what the next level will provide your Sim.
Elder
Elder
Puppy
Puppy
Adult
Adult
Voting Is:
&lt;font color='#38A666'&gt;Open&lt;/font&gt; 
Closed
The Repeal Process
Start the Repeal process on an active N.A.P. by selecting &lt;i&gt;Petition for Repeal&lt;/i&gt; from a public Voting Board or Mailbox. Sims must gather enough repeal signatures from their neighbors to successfully repeal an Action Plan. If enough signatures are collected, the Action Plan will be repealed once voting closes for that period.
Currently Repealing:
{0.Number}/{1.Number}
None
Influence Points:
While the voting period is open, Sims can vote on Neighborhood Action Plans and Community Space Projects to make an impact on their neighborhood.\n\nSims can vote at either their &lt;b&gt;Mailbox&lt;/b&gt; or a &lt;b&gt;Community Voting Board&lt;/b&gt; placed at any Venue. Sims who live in Evergreen Harbor can also use the &lt;b&gt;Community Voting Board&lt;/b&gt; that's out in their neighborhood.\n\nVoting requires &lt;i&gt;Influence&lt;/i&gt;. Sims can get &lt;i&gt;Influence Points&lt;/i&gt; by following behaviors promoted by enacted Neighborhood Action Plans, by making new friends, and by being an overall stand-up member of their community.
Neighborhood Action Plans
Elder
Elder
Kitten
Kitten
Adult
Adult
Unlock
Applies to:
Sims can earn Mastery Perks when using skills at high levels. With their life experience, elders are more likely to discover them; however, any Sim can get a perk with persistent practice. Receiving mentoring and attending Hobby Classes helps as well.\n\nFor a more direct approach, elders can Bestow their perks upon other Sims. Mastery Perk Bestower and Remover Potions can also be purchased in the Reward Store.

Requirements
Vote by clicking on any of the Neighborhood Action Plans your active Sim supports. With enough &lt;i&gt;Influence Points&lt;/i&gt;, Sims can cast multiple votes.\n\nIf a N.A.P. that your Sim doesn't support is enacted, Sims have the option to &lt;i&gt;Petition to Repeal&lt;/i&gt; at their &lt;b&gt;Mailbox&lt;/b&gt; or a public &lt;b&gt;Voting Board&lt;/b&gt; while the next voting period is open. Just make sure they get out and talk to Sims to &lt;i&gt;Gather Repeal Signature&lt;/i&gt; enough times before the voting period ends!

Sims Delivery Express
Cool, Thanks!
Game Options
Welcome to Sims Delivery Express our new Base Game content drop system!\n\nThis system will be able to deliver short bursts of content without requiring a Game Update so everything will be done in the background. You just need to restart after the downloads are completed and enjoy!\n\nYou can expect the following:&lt;ul type=&quot;circle&quot;&gt;&lt;li&gt;New Build mode or Create A Sim content&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Tiny game fixes, those that don't need a Game Update to be delivered.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;\nIn the future, we hope to maybe expand this list but for now we hope you enjoy every upcoming Sims Delivery! To find out more, check out the settings for this system in the Game Options Menu.

Glowing tattoos can only be applied to Fairy Sims.
Tattoos can't be applied to Sims in Beast form.
Tattoos can only be applied to Teen and older Sims.
Cannot merge Household while at an active career lot.
Cannot apply Gallery templates in this game mode.
Insufficient funds to place Lot.
Cannot apply Households in this mode of Create A Sim.

Unavailable

Notification Wall Full
The Notification Wall displays a maximum of 200 notifications. \n \n If you do nothing, the oldest notifications will automatically be deleted as new notifications appear. \n \n You can make room by deleting individual notifications from the wall at any time, or by clicking on the trash can on the wall to delete all currently stored notifications.

Buying a new home can be stressful, but never fear!\n\nThe Lots with the &lt;b&gt;bouncing icons&lt;/b&gt; are the perfect &lt;b&gt;starter homes&lt;/b&gt; for you! Click on one of them to &lt;b&gt;move in.&lt;/b&gt;
Is this the one?
If this is the starter home for you, &lt;b&gt;click confirm!&lt;/b&gt;\n\nDon't worry though, you can always &lt;b&gt;move to a new home later!&lt;/b&gt;
How to Select your Lot
This is the &lt;b&gt;map&lt;/b&gt; of the world, where you pick exactly where your &lt;b&gt;Household will live!&lt;/b&gt;
Interactions
Interacting with the world is how you play in The Sims.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Click objects&lt;/b&gt; in the world and inside houses to use them or begin activities.\n\nTry clicking on a &lt;b&gt;refrigerator&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;stove&lt;/b&gt; to &lt;b&gt;cook a meal,&lt;/b&gt; or click on a &lt;b&gt;toilet&lt;/b&gt; and...relieve your Sim.
UNUSED - &lt;b&gt;Interactions&lt;/b&gt; are things that Sims can do with objects, other Sims, or even themselves.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Social Interactions&lt;/b&gt; are how you can build relationships with other Sims, try clicking on another Sim that's around!
Thanks for Learning
Those are the basics to playing The Sims 4!\n\nFeel free to explore &lt;b&gt;Lessons&lt;/b&gt;! The &lt;b&gt;Getting Started&lt;/b&gt; section is a great place to learn more stuff!
Controlling Time
Controlling time is easy as 1, 2, 3! &lt;b&gt;Control time&lt;/b&gt; by &lt;b&gt;clicking the buttons&lt;/b&gt; or with shortcuts:\n\n&lt;b&gt;Pause the game&lt;/b&gt; - Press ` or P\n&lt;b&gt;Normal Speed&lt;/b&gt; - Press 1\n&lt;b&gt;Fast Speed&lt;/b&gt; - Press 2\n&lt;b&gt;Ultra Speed&lt;/b&gt; - Press 3
Finding your Sim
Clicking your Sim’s portrait, large or small, will move your camera to where they are.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Left-Click&lt;/b&gt; to center your camera on them.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Right-Click&lt;/b&gt; for your camera to follow the Sim.
Camera Zoom
Scroll the &lt;b&gt;Mouse Wheel&lt;/b&gt; to Zoom in and out
Moving the Camera (Default)
Press &lt;b&gt;W/A/S/D&lt;/b&gt; or Hold &lt;b&gt;Left-Click&lt;/b&gt; and move your mouse to move your camera.\n\nHold &lt;b&gt;Right-Click&lt;/b&gt; to rotate your camera.
Need a Refresher?
If you ever need help, select the &lt;b&gt;Lessons Button&lt;/b&gt; for more tutorials!\n\nHere is &lt;b&gt;§5,000&lt;/b&gt; to get you started. Thanks for learning!
Control Time
&lt;b&gt;Control time&lt;/b&gt; with these buttons by using &lt;b&gt;shortcuts&lt;/b&gt; as easy as &lt;b&gt;1, 2, 3&lt;/b&gt;!\n\n&lt;b&gt;Pause&lt;/b&gt; - Press ` or P\n&lt;b&gt;Normal Speed&lt;/b&gt; - Press 1\n&lt;b&gt;Fast Speed&lt;/b&gt; - Press 2\n&lt;b&gt;Ultra Speed&lt;/b&gt; - Press 3
Control Your Sim's Action
Your Sim's queued up interactions are in the column beside your Sim's portrait.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Cancel an interaction&lt;/b&gt; by selecting it in the &lt;b&gt;queue&lt;/b&gt;.
&lt;b&gt;Click objects&lt;/b&gt; in the world and inside houses to use them or begin activities.\n\nTry clicking on a &lt;b&gt;Refrigerator&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;Stove&lt;/b&gt; to cook a meal or click on a &lt;b&gt;Toilet&lt;/b&gt; to relieve your Sim.
Find Your Sim
&lt;b&gt;Select your Sim's portrait&lt;/b&gt;, large or small to find them.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Left-Click&lt;/b&gt; to center your camera on your Sim.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Right-click&lt;/b&gt; for your camera to follow your Sim.
Moving the Camera
&lt;b&gt;Move&lt;/b&gt; the camera by pressing &lt;b&gt;W/A/S/D&lt;/b&gt; or hold &lt;b&gt;Left-Click and drag&lt;/b&gt; your mouse.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Rotate&lt;/b&gt; by holding &lt;b&gt;Right-Click/Cmd&lt;/b&gt; and dragging.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Zoom&lt;/b&gt; using the mouse wheel or pinch zoom.
Play (or cancel) when you're ready
When you're done making changes, you can hit &lt;b&gt;Play&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;save&lt;/b&gt; your newly created Sim.\n\nOr you can &lt;b&gt;Cancel&lt;/b&gt; and reset your Household or return to the main menu.
Create more Sims for your household
You can add more Sims to this household! Create up to &lt;b&gt;8 Sims&lt;/b&gt; with different relationships, such as: &lt;b&gt;parents, children, siblings, roommates&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;spouses.&lt;/b&gt;
Traits &amp; Aspirations
Customize your Sim's Traits &amp; Aspirations by &lt;b&gt;clicking on the icons here!&lt;/b&gt;\n\n&lt;b&gt;Traits&lt;/b&gt; are the basis of a Sim's personality. New traits can be &lt;b&gt;earned&lt;/b&gt; during gameplay but &lt;b&gt;changing existing traits may be difficult.&lt;/b&gt;\n\n&lt;b&gt;Aspirations&lt;/b&gt; are mid-to long range goals throughout your Sims life. You can &lt;b&gt;change these at any time&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;after completing an aspiration.&lt;/b&gt;\n\nYou &lt;b&gt;cannot change&lt;/b&gt; Traits &amp; Aspirations here for Sims made using &lt;b&gt;Create a Sim Story&lt;/b&gt;
Randomize, undo or redo
Feeling stuck? You can &lt;b&gt;randomize&lt;/b&gt; your Sim's appearance! You can also &lt;b&gt;undo&lt;/b&gt; or &lt;b&gt;redo&lt;/b&gt; any changes you made to your Sim while on this screen.
Physical features and outfits
Click on the category icons to change your Sim's &lt;b&gt;face, hair. body&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;outfits.&lt;/b&gt;
Adjust your Sim's appearance
&lt;b&gt;Click on your Sim&lt;/b&gt; to adjust their appearance!\n\nWill your Sim look like you, a friend, or even your nemesis? &lt;b&gt;Click different parts on your Sim&lt;/b&gt; to adjust fine details and their outfit.
Name, Gender, Pronouns, Age and More
Use these menus to choose your Sim's &lt;b&gt;name, gender, pronouns, age, voice, walking style,&lt;/b&gt; and more! You can always change these later if you want.\n\nYou can &lt;b&gt;hover&lt;/b&gt; over each icon to learn more!
Change your Sim's name and personality
Great! It's time to create a Sim! How exciting!\n\nClick on the &lt;b&gt;Plumbob icon&lt;/b&gt; to change aspects of your Sim's &lt;b&gt;name, identity,&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;personality.&lt;/b&gt;
Return to Live Mode
Return to Live Mode at any time by &lt;b&gt;clicking the button&lt;/b&gt; above or &lt;b&gt;pressing F1.&lt;/b&gt;
Main Build Tools
&lt;b&gt;Move House (U)&lt;/b&gt; - Reposition your house\n\n&lt;b&gt;Bulldoze&lt;/b&gt; - Flatten terrain or an entire lot\n\n&lt;b&gt;Time of Day (L)&lt;/b&gt; - Changes the time of day in Build Mode so you can preview your lot at different times of the day
Useful tools live up here in the toolbar.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Design Tool (R)&lt;/b&gt; - Change an object's style.
Main Build Tools
&lt;b&gt;Undo/Redo (Control and Z/Y)&lt;/b&gt; - Undo or redo actions.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Save to My Library&lt;/b&gt; - Save your lot to your Library.
Main Build Tools
These are your main tools in build mode! From left to right they are:\n\n&lt;b&gt;Select (H)&lt;/b&gt; - Make an object or element active.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Eyedropper (E)&lt;/b&gt; - Copy an object.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Design Tool (R)&lt;/b&gt; - Change object's color.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Sledgehammer (K)&lt;/b&gt; - Remove an element or object.
Opening the Catalog
Quick Legend
Here you can select a room or object type to browse. Feel free to open any of the objects!
The quick legend on the top right has lots of useful tools that change throughout Build/Buy mode. Pay attention to it for useful controls!\n\nYou can access things to buy from the Catalog navigation on the left.\n\nTry selecting &lt;b&gt;Objects by Room&lt;/b&gt;
Sell and store objects
&lt;b&gt;Sell objects&lt;/b&gt; by dragging them from the world to the &lt;b&gt;bottom left panel&lt;/b&gt; labeled, &lt;b&gt;&quot;Sell&quot;.&lt;/b&gt; Or press the &lt;b&gt;Delete&lt;/b&gt; key.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Store objects&lt;/b&gt; for later use by dragging them to the &lt;b&gt;bottom left panel&lt;/b&gt; labeled, &lt;b&gt;&quot;Inventory&quot;.&lt;/b&gt; You can find these objects later from the Household Inventory.
Rotate and Place Objects
&lt;b&gt;Rotate an object with right click&lt;/b&gt; while it is selected. Or use &lt;b&gt;keys &quot;,&quot;&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;&quot;.&quot;&lt;/b&gt;\n\n&lt;b&gt;Left click to confirm placement.&lt;/b&gt; Don't worry, you can always change the placement &amp; rotate later!
Selecting objects
&lt;b&gt;Select an object with left click.&lt;/b&gt; If you &lt;b&gt;hover&lt;/b&gt; over an object, the &lt;b&gt;color swatch!&lt;/b&gt; will show on the left of the object. &lt;b&gt;Click&lt;/b&gt; the &lt;b&gt;Color Swatch&lt;/b&gt; to pick out a color!\n\nOnce an object is selected, &lt;b&gt;move your mouse&lt;/b&gt; and hover over the area of your lot where you want it, and &lt;b&gt;Left Click&lt;/b&gt; to purchase it!
Search
You can &lt;b&gt;search for objects&lt;/b&gt; in the catalog. Try typing in &quot;&lt;b&gt;desk&lt;/b&gt;&quot; to see what you get!
Catalog navigation
Use the &lt;b&gt;buttons on the left&lt;/b&gt; to open different parts of the &lt;b&gt;Catalog.&lt;/b&gt; Hover over a button to learn more. Click a button to open.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Build&lt;/b&gt; - Browse objects by using a visual representation of a house.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Objects by room&lt;/b&gt; - Click parts of the house below to view related items.\n\n&lt;b&gt;Objects by function&lt;/b&gt; - Use the drop down to browse object by function (Decorations, Appliances, Electronics, etc.)\n\n&lt;b&gt;Household Inventory&lt;/b&gt; - Store and retrieve objects for later use.
You can &lt;b&gt;buy, sell, place,&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;customize objects&lt;/b&gt; for your Sims and their homes using the &lt;b&gt;Catalog menu&lt;/b&gt; below.
Buying objects
Romantic Boundaries control the factors that make Sims become Jealous and if their Jealousy triggers can change!
Determine your Sim's Romantic Boundaries by customizing them in the Sim Customization Panel.
Romantic Boundaries
Travel using your Phone

Open the Skill Panel here
Use your Phone to order a pizza

Open the Phone to Chat or Play a Game

Satisfaction
Aspiration
Items that support Off-the-Grid gameplay can be found in their own Off-the-Grid category in Build Mode. This section can be accessed within the Objects by Function drop down.\n\nAnywhere within Build Mode, Water and Power objects that have unique Off-the-Grid functionality are marked with a “Functional Off-the-Grid” tooltip note when you hover over them.
To apply the Off-the-Grid Lot Trait go into Build Mode and click on the Venue Info button in the top left corner. Open the Traits Panel from the pop-up menu. Then, click on the Off-the-Grid icon to slot it into your active lot. 
When Power or Water utility is acquired as a surplus on an Off-the-Grid lot, Water and Power objects will function normally again.\n\nWhen this happens, a new interaction will appear on Functional Off-the-Grid objects to Turn On/Off Utility Usage. Toggling this option allows the player to determine which objects will pull from the excess utility and which will solely retain their Off-the-Grid functionality. 
The Off-the-Grid Lot Trait disconnects a lot from the utility grid. Most objects that require Power or Water will not work, supporting interesting new story themes and challenging gameplay elements. 
Playing on an Off-the-Grid lot means access to new gameplay elements!\n\n• Click on a grill or Off-the-Grid supported oven to view exclusive recipes. Some require ingredients and provide powerful moodlets.\n• Water utility can be collected from various locations around the world.\n• Functional Off-the-Grid objects have unique interactions that allow them to fulfill needs.\n• Add Ice to supported Fridges. Just be sure to replace the ice before it melts!\n• Bills on Off-the-Grid lots do not charge for Water or Power utility. They also provide a Tax Break discount!
Sims Sessions
Speaking of where, Magnolia Blossom Park in Willow Creek is the place to be for the festival!\n\nThere are many ways to get there. Select the festival ticket in your inventory, it has an option to travel. You may get a phone call invite to attend the festival, or you can travel from the phone menu, or by zooming out and selecting the travel button. Then select Willow Creek, and find Magnolia Blossom Park. It will be the one with the animating music button over it!
Sims Sessions are only available for limited time engagements!\n\nFestivals normally take place every in game Sunday at 12pm during their real time window! Don't worry if you miss a Sunday, the festival occurs every Sunday within it's limited real time window.\n\nIf for some reason the festival hours change, check the ticket in your inventory for all the latest details on when and where.
The Sims Sessions music festival has come to town!\n\nIt's a place to enjoy exclusive musical performances by top name artists. Where you can hang out all day, and in to the night. Soaking in the music, atmosphere, buying swag, eating your favorite festival foods, or just celebrating with friends!\n\nIt's sure to be the summer hit!
It's performance time! Gather around the stage, get hyped for your favorite performer, and enjoy the music!\n\nIn between performances, be sure check out the area - we've got bathrooms, food stalls, tents to nap in, and there are sure to be plenty of other Sims around to socialize with.\n\nAnd don't worry, you'll know when the next performance is about to begin... so, don't miss out!
Stop at the Festival Shop for some limited time swag, like fan and festival t-shirts! Grab a snack at the food stall, we're sure one of those are your artists favorite snack!\n\nOr you can bring your own collectibles and crafted items to stock the crafting table with, and sell your merchandise to the other festival goers!
Lot Challenges
You can change the Lot Challenges in the Venue Info panel in Build Mode. We've moved some classic Lot Traits such as Off-the-Grid to a new section of this panel dedicated to challenges. Check them out by clicking on the trophy.
Lot Challenges change up the experience of playing on a lot, adding an element of difficulty. The challenges are stackable so you can mix and match to cater to how you want to play. Apply as many Lot Challenges as you want and share your favorite combinations with other players when you upload the lots to the Gallery.
Fishing Skill
Increasing your Fishing skill will unlock Fish with Bait and increase the likelihood of catching bigger and better fish.\n\nProTip: There are some fish only found in hidden locations.
Fishing Holes can be found all over the world. Click on the Fishing Hole and begin Fishing to raise your Fishing skill.\n\nFishing skill is also improved by Fishing, and Reading about Fishing.
Fears
Every time your Sim wakes up while having a Fear, they will have a chance to get a confrontation goal to appear. Helping your Sim complete this confrontation goal will help them overcome their Fear. Some Fears may take multiple confrontations in order to be fully removed.\n\nWhen your Sim overcomes their Fear they will become proud of what they did and the Fear will be removed from their traits! \n\nYou can also purchase a &quot;Fear-Be-Gone&quot; potion from the Reward Store to quickly remove a Fear that your Sim has gained.
With Wants making a comeback, so are Fears: \n\nFears are traits that your Sim may obtain through gameplay. Sound a bit vague? \n\nHere is an example of a possible Fear that your Sim may get! Let's just say for some reason your Sim caught on fire and survived. Well, that can be quite terrifying and your Sim will most likely gain a Fear of fire.\n\nThere are numerous ways of getting a Fear on your sim and each one will have an interesting effect on how your Sim behaves in the world. Be careful! Sims are not limited to just one Fear at a time.
What are the consequences of having a Fear trait on your Sim? Well, it will depend on what Fear your Sim gets. Fears will come with permanent negative effects until your Sim is ready to overcome them. The effects will vary and are not limited to: negative moodlets appearing, higher chances of failing interactions, and some changes to their behavior in certain situations.\n\nThat sounds awful! Don't worry, Fears are meant to be overcome! It may take some time and hard work, but you can help your Sim overcome their Fear when the time is right!
Environment Effects
Some decorative items will affect your Sim's current emotion. For example, if a painting is inspiring, have your Sim view the painting to become inspired.\n\nNote: An objects catalog hovertip will inform you if it will have an emotional impact on your Sims.
Sims are affected negatively by things like dirty dishes, broken household items, and puddles. 
Experiment by designing rooms in your Sims' homes to improve their moods when creating, exercising, and more!
Groups
You can start a Group by selecting another Sim, selecting Actions, and Add to Group. Disbanding the Group or Removing Sims from the Group can also be found in Actions.
Groups will automatically be formed when you travel with other Sims, or Invite them over to the current lot. Dates will also form an exclusive Group for the duration of the date!
Sims love to do things together, and what better way than to do them in a Group? Group behavior is much easier to control and more visible than ever.
Sims in a Group will be represented by a clear Icon over their head. You can have up to eight Sims in a Group.
Death
Upon death: the Grim Reaper comes to usher them from the game, leaving behind a memorial Urn or Gravestone which nearby Sims can use to mourn.
Sims can die if their Needs are neglected for too long, if they push their Sims too far down an emotional path, or as the result of failing certain risky interactions.\n\nOr fire. Fire can kill too. Yep, fire.\n\nI mentioned fire, right?
Dying isn’t the end! When Sims meet their untimely (or timely) demise, a Sim can begin a new chapter by becoming a Ghost.\n\nBy choosing &lt;b&gt;Become a Playable Ghost&lt;/b&gt;, the Sim will remain in the Household and continue to be playable as a Ghostly presence.\nChoose &lt;b&gt;Become a Freeroaming Ghost&lt;/b&gt; if you would prefer this Sim &lt;i&gt;live on&lt;/i&gt; as a Ghost in an unplayed Household. These Sims will no longer be a played Sim but can still be found in the World.
Plan Outfit will take you to Create a Sim, however you will not be able to edit some parts of your Sims.\n\nYou can modify Outfits, Accessories, as well as Hair.
Outfit Planning
When you are done modifying your Sims, click the Play button to return to Live Mode.
Body &amp; Facial Modifications are off limits.\n\nThe Muscle and Fat sliders in Create a Sim update based on your Sims experiences, you can see how your Sims are doing.
Click on your Sim or a Dresser and choose Change Outfit... to change the outfit your Sim is currently wearing.\n\nTo modify the outfits, click on a Dresser and choose Plan Outfit.
Changing Outfits
Sims will &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; their Outfits to suit different &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;situations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;, such as wearing their Swimwear when going in the pool, but you can also &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; their current Outfit yourself. This is great for storytelling and screenshots!\n\nIf your Sim has aged up and you’re not a fan of their new clothes, or you’re just looking for some change, you can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;customize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim’s available Outfits.
To &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;change&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim’s current Outfit, either click on the Sim themselves and choose Outfits &gt; Change Outfits, or interact with a mirror and choose Change Outfits.\n\nTo &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;customize&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; your Sim’s Outfits, interact with a mirror or dresser and choose Change Sim. This will open Create a Sim. When customizing an already existing Sim, you can change things like their clothes and hair, but not sculpt their face and body, or change their Traits.
Careers
The &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Business app&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; on your phone has a lot of useful functionality. Here you’ll find options to take a vacation day, quit, or get a new job.\n\nOnce your Sim becomes an Elder, you can use the Business App to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;retire&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. They will get a pension every day, based on their salary. Freedom at last!
Once your Sim has a Career, you can find everything you need to know in the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career panel&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.\n\nThe top half lists your title, salary, schedule, and available vacation days. The bottom half lists your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Promotion Requirements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;.
Having a &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; is one of the best ways to make &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Simoleons&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! The starting salary can be a bit on the low side, but when you climb the career ladder you can make big bucks.\n\nAdvancing in Careers will also unlock unique Objects and Clothes, and allows your Sim to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;retire&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and get a pension upon becoming an Elder.
Your Sim can &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;join a Career&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; by using the Business app on their phone, or by opening the Career panel selecting Join a Career.\n\nCareer &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;success&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; depends on different Skills. It’s a good idea to base your choice on your Sim’s current skills, or any Traits that help them build Skills. But with hard work, any Sim can succeed in any Career!
Let’s talk about &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;promotions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;! Promotions mean new &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;rewards&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and better &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;salaries&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. To get promoted, you need to fill the &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Performance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; bar and fulfill any &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Requirements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; (usually reaching specific Skill levels).\n\nThe best ways to increase your Performance are completing your &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Daily Tasks&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; and going to work with a positive &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Emotion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. \n\nWhile they’re at work, you can also select the Away Action icon on Sim’s thumbnail and order them to &lt;b&gt;&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;Work Hard&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt; for an extra boost!
Bugs
We apologize if you find a bug. We hope that you can forgive us for not finding it ourselves.
What is a bug? Everything from a software crash, a freeze, or a memory leak; to grammatical errors, missing user interface data, and clipping.
Software has bugs. The etymology of the term &quot;bug&quot; is greatly debated, although it is an accepted fact that it predates software.
Moodlets
Each Moodlet has an emotion strength associated with it.  Your Sim determines their current Emotion based on the Moodlets they have.
Interactions in the game can push different Moodlets upon your Sims. Brush your teeth, and you might be feeling Minty Fresh. Neglect your hygiene, and you might be Grungy.
Some Moodlets will be multi-colored, these are Happy Emotion Moodlets, or Bonus Moodlets. If you are currently in any Emotion other than Happy, Bonus Moodlets will enhance your current Emotion.\n\nNote: Hover over your Moodlets to see their effect, how you got them, and what Emotion they are boosting.
Your Sims are emotional beings. And their Moodlets drive their emotions.
Bonfire
The Bonfire allows Sims to hang out with friends or cozy up next to that special someone. It'll burn bright and colorfully!
Find all the secrets that the bonfire holds! Sims with high mischief can use the voodoo doll to mess with other Sims. Having a ghost possess it can also be a sight to behold.
Try burning different things in the bonfire! You can live drag objects in the Sim's inventory to experiment. Sims with traits may even react to what's being burnt!
Aging &amp; Birthdays
Any cake can be a Birthday Cake.\n\nBake a cake, click on it and choose Add Birthday Candles.
You can also use the Birthday Cake to age up your friends and neighbors, just in case you want them to always be the same age as you.
When your Sim is ready for the big moment, have them Blow Out the candles on their Birthday Cake and watch them transition to their next set of life experiences!
Negative Emotions
Negative emotions should be seen as a challenge and a goal to solve. Experiment as your Sims cruise the emotional landscape!
New interactions become available and others disappear based on your Sims' emotions.
Negative Emotions like Sadness and Anger will change your Sim's behavior and outlook on life. At least temporarily.
When your Sim is in a negative Emotion, you can help them recover\n\nThe Emotional Whim can always help you find a way to deal with your emotions.
Baby Care
Be sure to bottle or breast feed babies to provide nourishment.
Babies will need to be cleaned often as well as they aren't yet potty trained.
And don't forget, give babies plenty of love!
Aspirations
Achievements
Achievements are goals for you to work towards across multiple households and save files (Achievements are saved per EA Account).\n\nNote: In some cases, you will be unable to gain an Achievement by playing only one household.
You can also use the Achievements tracker to help guide you in your exploration of The Sims 4.  Maybe you'll find out something you didn't know existed in the game by reading the Achievement goal.
To view all of your Achievements, enter Live Mode, open the Options Menu, and choose Achievements from the menu.
Scenarios
You can start a new Scenario from the Main Menu. When choosing a Scenario you will be able to start a scenario with new, existing, and pre-made households. Some Scenarios will have options to start with new or existing households, while some will require either a new or premade household.\n\nPre-made household scenarios will be indicated in red text on the Scenarios menu.
Scenarios put your household in an interesting situation with some initial setup and long-term goals for Live Mode. Completing these goals will progress you through the Scenario to an outcome and reward your Sims!\n\nMore types of Scenarios will be added over time, so check back periodically for new, updated, or limited-time Scenarios.
The Bassinet is an essential object expecting parents should purchase for their newborn.\n\nIf you don't purchase a bassinet, don't worry, your baby will still arrive in their very own (or maybe two if you have twins!).
So, you want to know if you are having a baby... your Sim can take a Pregnancy test by interacting on the toilet to really be sure, or, you can just wait to see what happens.
When your Sim's pregnancy is at an end, the baby will be born. Be ready at any moment! Your Sim will receive a Birth Certificate that you can place on the wall!
Pregnant Sims will have adjusted physical needs and Emotions. It may get rocky at times, but it's worth the effort!
Neighborhood Stories Settings
To configure custom settings for all Sim households in the tab, select the top right icon. Remember that My Households and Other Households have separate settings. Sim households that move from one tab to the other will only be affected by Neighborhood Stories settings for their current tab location. You may wish to configure custom Neighborhood Stories settings for Sim households you do not want to undergo independent life changes.\n\nTo configure custom settings for individual Sim households, select the left icon at the bottom of each household.
To see Notifications of what life changes have taken place recently, enter Live Mode and go to a Mailbox, then select Check Recent Neighborhood Stories. Visit a Neighbor Sim to check in on them as their lives change and develop over time!
Select either My Households to configure households you've played, or Other Households to configure households you haven't played. By default, Neighborhood Stories is only enabled for Other Households, with all types of life changes allowed. 
Once you select the Neighborhood Stories configuration button, you can toggle on or off each type life change. Click the check button to confirm changes.
Neighborhood Stories can be quickly configured for all Households and/or individually per Household. Select Manage Worlds in the Options Menu, then select Manage Households.
Neighborhood Stories Life Changes
Neighborhood Stories allows Neighbor Sims and Households that you aren't actively playing to experience life changes. There are various types of life changes that can occur, as long as the given life change is enabled in Neighborhood Stories settings under Manage Households.
Neighbor Sims can also join and leave careers, with some Elder Sims choosing to retire. 
Neighbor Sims can expand their families by becoming pregnant or adopting young Sims. If your active Household is friendly with the Neighbor Sims, they may get a call to announce the new additions to the household.
Neighbor Sims may even die before their time. While unfortunate, accidents happen! You may want to visit the family of a deceased Sim to offer them condolences.
Neighbor Sims may move in or out of Lots in the world. The lot must be set as Residential with enough beds for Sims to sleep in. Build your own houses or download houses from the Gallery for Neighbor Sims to occupy.
Social
In a pinch, call a Sim or chat via the computer to fill your Sim's Social Need slightly.
Call a Sim over to your Sim's home or travel to a community lot (like the gym!) to meet Sims in person.
Sims require Sim-to-Sim interaction, else they go a little crazy.
Sims will take care of their Social Need on their own if you let them and they are able to do so!
Hygiene
Washing your hands via the sink is only a temporary solution, but every bit helps!
Hygienic Sims will be happier and more successful socially.
Sims require the occasional splash of water on their skin. Try taking a Bath or Shower. 
Sims will take care of their Hygiene Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Hunger
Sims who take the time to cook a proper meal will not only enjoy it more, but they'll learn in the process!
If your Sim is low on time, Have a Quick Meal from the Fridge or Microwave. 
Sims will take care of their Hunger Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims need to eat food a few times every day or they might die of Hunger! Eat snacks or prepare meals for increased nourishment.
Fun
Better fun items cost more Simoleons, but are well worth the investment!
Sims can have fun playing games, reading, watching TV, and more!
Sims will take care of their Fun Need if you let them and they are able to do so!
Sims require entertainment from time to time, else they grow miserably bored!

These Sims will actively avoid eating foods that contain meat products and can become sick if they eat such foods.

Toddlers prefer to sleep or nap in a toddler bed.
Infants need more sleep than most Sims. They can sleep on the floor, but much prefer the comfort of a crib!

Set your Sim up for Success
Launch your Sim's Career
To place Nova's laptop in the house, click on her Sim Inventory. Find the laptop and select Place in World. Alternatively, you can drag and drop it in any desk, dining table or counter island.
Nova's promotion requirements include leveling up her programming skills. Click on the Computer and select any interaction under the Program category. You can always check what skill your Sim needs for work by clicking on the Work Panel.
When the phone is ringing, click on it to answer the call.
To become a Tech Guru, click on the phone and select Find a Job under the Business App, or on the computer and select the Find a Job interaction under Career.
Negative emotions, like Anger, can block a Sim from learning skills. Angry Sims can try interactions like Taking a Cold Shower, Calming Down in a Mirror... or even Taking an Angry Poop in the Toilet! These will make the angry moodlets disappear faster!

Missing Grandmother
You know, perhaps it was best to keep a low profile. It would be stupid to antagonize the neighbors &lt;i&gt;already&lt;/i&gt;, right? That’s what Farrah is telling herself, at least…
You won... but at what cost?
Nova's rival is gone
Lewis Moved in with Nova
Kindness Ambassador
When two ambitious Sims combine forces, they can achieve great things. Encourage Nova and Lewis to grow their new-found relationship and support each other... or let them fall back into their old, bickering ways. Whatever you choose, with a pair like Nova and Lewis, drama will surely follow.  
They say the best way to defeat an enemy is to make them your friend. Nova went a bit further than that and made Lewis a part of her household. The day may come when she questions her decision to live with an insufferable know-it-all, but today, she's happy to have regained a long lost friendship. 
Lewis Sancho is dead.
Twisted Heart
Nova's journey continues as she learns to live with Lewis's death. She can climb the corporate ladder as she originally intended, or find a new path in life. 
Nova won the rivalry and her old childhood friend-turned-enemy is no more. Will she mourn the bond they once shared, or rejoice that her adversary will never insult her again? 
Nova Has it All

Talk to Plants is a great way to fill your social needs while increasing your gardening skills! Plus, you get to know your plants better!
Have your PlantSim Talk to Plants
Watering, weeding, fertilizing and spraying for bugs are all ways to care for your plants! Garden Pots and Planter Boxes are great ways to get started! You can use the starter vegetable seeds found in your inventory. Make sure to care for your plants that aren't Oversized Crops while you're a PlantSim.
Care for Plants as a PlantSim
Satisfy your PlantSim's water needs by drinking water, swimming, showering, bathing, and splashing in puddles! PlantSims love water just as much as they do sunlight, which can grant special moodlets to happiness.
Satisfy Water Needs
Have your PlantSim head outside on a sunny day to start converting light and water into food, but remember to stay hydrated!
Photosynthesize by absorbing sunlight
Absorbing solar energy from a plant is a great way to fill hunger on cloudy days while you're a PlantSim. However, each interaction will make that plant smaller. Be careful!
Absorb solar energy from plants

Windenburg
Take ye olde deep breath and enjoy the mountain air. This green, expansive playground has it all; lush countryside, serene and rocky island cliffs, a quaint village with remnants of the old world all nestled around the modern shore side business center.
Magalog 9 Lot World
Magalog 9 Lot World
Batuu
This remote outpost on the galaxy’s edge was once a busy crossroads along the old sub-lightspeed trade routes, but its prominence was bypassed by the rise of hyperspace travel. Now home to those who prefer to stay out of the mainstream, it has become a thriving port for smugglers, rogue traders, and adventurers traveling between the frontier and uncharted space. It was once a safe haven for those intent on avoiding the expanding reach of the First Order, but the struggle between the First Order and the Resistance has made it's way to Batuu.
The Magic Realm
The Magic Realm
An oasis nestled in the austere beauty of the western desert, this haven of eclectic culture is fringed by countless soaring palms, and lent vibrant color through impossibly lush landscaping. Oasis Springs offers relaxing retreats from the sun to any traveler who discovers it.
Willow Creek
Willow Creek is a lush bayou of rolling hills intertwined with marshy riverways. It's home to long-standing reputations and simple lifestyles full of coastal hospitality. Convenient with town comforts, lively neighbors, and a grandeur of property possibilities, Willow Creek is the idyllic place to settle down and settle in.
The gorgeous Sulani island chain welcomes all to a life of blue oceans and friendly neighbors. The main islands show off the many walks of life from the community centered Ohan'ali Town, to the more lavish upscale Lani St. Taz, and even down to the seemingly vancant Mua Pel'am. All around is the beauty of nature no matter where you look.
Office Site
San Myshuno
This city is made up of four distinct districts: the Spice Market, the Fashion District, The Arts Quarter and Uptown.\n\nIn addition, Myshuno Meadows is a large city park tucked beneath the skyscrapers if your Sims need to get away for a touch of nature.\n\nDepending on where your Sims choose to live, you’ll get a very different flavor of the city. You might find yourself in a cramped, roach-infested studio apartment in the Arts Quarter… Or you might be enjoying a breathtaking view of the city from your very own tricked-out rooftop penthouse Jacuzzi in Uptown.

Vegetarian-Safe.\n\nElotes are the classic and ever-popular Mexican corn on the cob charred on the grill. This mouth-watering dish is served usually with condiments such as salt, chili powder, butter, cheese, lemon juice or lime juice, mayonnaise, and sour cream (or crema). You can find these in street vendors or in restaurants, but wherever you do, it will be an instant favorite.
Grill Elote
Elote
The Choripán as a name comes from the combination of the names of its ingredients: a grilled chorizo sausage and a crusty bread (in Spanish called pan) such as a baguette, or francés. For some it might be just a sandwich, but it is more than that... it is almost part of the culinary identity for various countries in South America, specially Argentina. Commonly served during an Asado and street vendors, Choripanes have become one of the most sought out street food.
Grill Choripán
Choripán
Perfectly balanced, as all things should be. These are instant crowd pleasers for their taste and visually inviting appeal as they are pretty colourful. Usually made with grilled peppers, onions, chicken, and of course a herby chimichurri sauce, this recipe is a new classic on the grill.
Grill Chicken Chimichurri Skewers
Chicken Chimichurri Skewers
Commonly called Chimi Burger, Dominican Burger, or just Chimi/Chimichurris - Chimichurris is made from ground pork or beef, grilled and served on a pan de agua and garnished with chopped cabbage, of course, you cannot forget the Salsa golf. Each vendor throughout the Dominican Republic has its own recipe; flavors and ingredients can substantially vary the texture and taste, so we recommend trying a few to see which is your favorite.
Grill Chimi
Chimi
Grill Chicken
Grilled Chicken
Asado for some is a technique, but it can also be an event in itself when it comes to barbeque in various South American countries. An asado usually consists of beef, pork, chicken, chorizo, and morcilla which are cooked on a grill, or an open fire. A personal favorite is some beef and Guasacaca (an avocado based sauce from Venezuela). Buen provecho!
Grill Asado
Asado
In Native American tradition, &quot;the three sisters&quot; are corn, beans, and squash. They grow best together in the same plot. The eldest sister, corn, provides a strong foundation for the beans to climb. The beans enrich the soil with nitrogen. The youngest sister, squash, covers the ground, protecting all of their roots.\n\nVegetarian-safe, Lactose free\n
Grill a Pot of Three Sisters Chili
Three Sisters Chili

Cook Galbi-jjim
Also known as Kalbi Jjim / Galbi-jjim (갈비찜), this dish is typically served during the festive holidays such as Korean lunar new years' day (seollal) and harvest festival days (chuseok), or a special occasion such as a birthday or at a wedding. Whatever the occasion, it can definitely be one of the highlight dishes.\n\nIf you enjoy stews or braised meat dishes, this one is a must. The tenderness of the beef short ribs with the amazing sticky, sweet - and salty sauce - makes for a fantastic dish that warms the heart.\n\nLactose Free
Serve Galbi-jjim
Galbi-jjim

Boiling Frog Hot Pot
The essence of comfort food, this delectable dish is crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside. Besides being mouth-wateringly delicious, it’s history on a plate! Preparing fried fish is a tradition carried on at Juneteenth cookouts, a US summer holiday which celebrates Black freedom, heritage, and family. Fried fish is typically paired with grilled corn, coleslaw, and cornbread for a delicious, well rounded meal.\n\nLactose Free

Cook Cioppino
Cioppino
Churrasco is a Brazilian barbecue method where juicy pieces, slices, steaks, and chops of beef, veal, lamb, pork, and chicken are placed on big skewers and grilled over wood fire. This practice started in the early 1800s when the Gaúchos (people that settled in the Rio Grande do Sul area) would get together and start a fire, adding large portions of meat on skewers and slowly grilling the meat.\n\nAs a bonus, this item is Lactose Free!
Grill Churrasco
Churrasco

Cook Chicken Stir Fry
Serve Chicken Stir Fry
Challah is a type of bread often baked for Jewish celebrations such as Shabbat. Typically, challah is prepared in a way that's pareve in that it doesn't combine dairy products with egg. The bread loaves are braided and, on Rosh Hashanah, are often presented in a round &quot;turban&quot; form. On Shabbat, two loaves of challah are covered with a cloth that can be rather elaborately embroidered or decorated and Kiddush blessings are recited before the bread is sliced and eaten.\n\nDepending upon the occasion, challah may be served sprinkled with salt or with honey and in some cultures raisins, dates, or other ingredients may even be added! No matter how you slice it, this rich and eggy bread is a delicious treat that helps unite people all around the world.\n\nVegetarian-Safe, Lactose Free
Bake Challah
Challah

Make Brigadeiro
The origin of the dessert isn't certain, but the most common theory is that it was created by a confectioner from Rio de Janeiro, Heloisa Nabuco de Oliveira, to promote the presidential candidacy of Brigadier Eduardo Gomes, hence the name &quot;Brigadeiro.&quot;\n\nThe dessert is made of condensed milk, cocoa powder, butter, and chocolate sprinkles covering the outside layer making it the perfect bite type of dessert. Given it is very easy to make - and well, absolutely delicious! - it made its way into being a staple in parties and any kind of festivity really. So don't be surprised to spot these at any Brazilian celebration!\n\nAnd don't forget, this is a Vegetarian Safe dish!
Serve Brigadeiro
Brigadeiro

Shoe rails are less sturdy than other railing options but add an understated, airy elegance to your stairwell interiors.
Shoe Rail with Square Newels
Shoe rail designs place a small space between the stairs and their balusters, just big enough for the toe of someone's shoe to poke through. No, we don't know why.
Handsome Knuckled Banister
Hefty balusters adorned with a large turned-wood &quot;knuckle&quot; in the middle present an imposing barrier to careless stair-walkers.
Galvanized Horizontal Railing
Long horizontal lines lengthen the look of your stairwell.
Horizontal Aluminum Railing System
Horizontal stair rails are an unusual design choice best suited for child-free households.
Mega Railing

Mega Railing (Budget DeLite)
Did you think we were just going to sell you stairs and not offer a railing to go with them? Please! We’re not jerks! Oh, did you think that the railing would just come with the stairs when you bought them? Oh. Well… we don’t do that.

Balusters of turned wood with decorative knuckles are a timeless classic.

Multicolor Pool Trim
A pool is the only place where having a trim adds and doesn’t subtract.  No one would go to a barber, say “I just want a trim” and leave with more hair than they came with. They should call it a border. So get a border and go for a dip. Let no weird nomenclature get in the way of your relaxing swim.
poolTrim_bm
Remove Water
&lt;i&gt;Use this tool to completely remove the water from a hole.&lt;/i&gt;\n\nWith this tool selected, click on any natural body of water on your lot to remove the water, leaving behind an empty hole in the terrain.
Raise Water
&lt;i&gt;Use this tool to add water to a hole.&lt;/i&gt;\n\nThis tool will add water to, or raise water within a hole that's been carved into the terrain. You may use individual clicks, or hold the mouse button down to continue to incrementally add more water. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; while clicking will lower the water instead.
Lower Water
&lt;i&gt;Use this tool to lower the water level in a pond.&lt;/i&gt;\n\nThis tool will lower the level of any water that's been added to a hole carved in the terrain. You may use individual clicks, or hold the mouse button down to continue incrementally lowering the water level. Holding &quot;Ctrl&quot; while clicking will add or raise the water instead. If you lower the water all the way to the bottom of a hole, the pond will be removed.
Fill to Height
&lt;i&gt;This tool is useful when attempting to set the exact same water level across multiple separate ponds.&lt;/i&gt;\n\nThis tool will set the water level to a specific height within a hole carved into the terrain. Adjust height using the Fill to Height slider in the UI, or hold &quot;Ctrl&quot; and press the &quot;[&quot; or &quot;]&quot; keys to raise the pre-determined level higher or lower.

The festival will last all day, and into the night. After, your Sims will have the chance to get up on stage and perform!\n\nWhile you're here, don't forget to grab some swag, make friends, cheer your heart out, and soak up the musical inspiration all around.\n\nIf your Sims party a bit too hard, there are tents to catch a quick nap and change outfits, food stands to grab a snack, and a merch stall to pick up some handy items and fan t-shirts! The Sims Sessions @ Magnolia Blossom is over! Please come back next Sunday at 12pm to see the superstar Sims perform again! \n\nYour Sims have collected new Sims Sessions T-Shirts to wear. 
The festival will end in 1 hour. Finish up any activities before it closes. Be sure to come back the next time the festival is in town!

Reach Level 8 of the Culinary Career
Click on the Refrigerator, select Cook, and select a recipe from the list.  Hover the cursor over the food to check its quality! Sims with high Skill are more likely to create higher quality food.
To join the Culinary Career, click on the Phone or Computer and select the Find a Job interaction. To get promoted, complete Promotion Requirements and attend work in the Career's Ideal Mood.
Reach Level 4 of the Culinary Career
To Celebrate, click on the stove to select the Cake Recipe. Afterwards, add Birthday Candles and then Celebrate the moment!
Click on the Phone to Plan a Dinner Party Event. Once the Event starts, complete the Goals that pop-up to earn a higher score!
To cook a gourmet meal, a Sim must have Level 5 Cooking Skill. Click on the Refrigerator, select Cook a Gourmet Meal, and select a recipe from the list.
Cook a Gourmet Meal
To increase Sim's Cooking skill, use the Refrigerator or Stove to make food, Watch the Cooking Channel on a TV, or read a Cooking Skill Book. Skill Books can be purchased directly from a Bookshelf by using the Purchase Books interaction!

Research Ambrosia
Ambrosia is a Gourmet dish that can bring a loved one back to life. It is difficult to make and requires 3 rare ingredients.\n\nIf you want to learn more, be sure to read the Ambrosia Society Newsletter!
The Death Flower is the Grim Reaper's favorite flower. If you offer it when a Sim is dying, the Grim Reaper will allow the dying Sim to continue living.\n\nIt can be grown by grafting a Pomegranate to an Orchid.

Believe it or not, this priceless bowl is the result of a lucky accident. Lulled by the hum of the potter’s wheel, the artist nodded off and dropped the bowl, causing the distinctive divot along one edge. Amazed at the effect, the potter tried to replicate it, but to this day has never achieved such a delightfully perfect flaw.

West African Aloe Plant
This beloved West African succulent features sharp, triangular teeth along its leaves, while its fiery blooms stand tall. Known as Aloe buettneri, its flowers have a fleshy, firm texture, and the leaves contain a soothing gel renowned for treating burns and bites. It thrives in hot, sunny conditions, making it ideal for Oasis Springs homes!

Retired Mangrove Palms
These palms were born and raised in a sheltered mangrove off the sea. Their days were spent among the fishes and animals, an active participant in the complex ecosystem of their home. From time to time, the palms dabbled in their favorite hobby: warding off hurricanes from the island's shores. It was a good life, but as time passed, the palms grew tired and yearned for a quiet retirement. After selecting a trendy pot, they packed up and resettled in a new home—less densely-populated and complete with low-oxygen soil.
