&lt;font color= '#199C2C'&gt;From the Nature's Calling Event&lt;/font&gt;\n\nThe debut issue of Touch Grass Weekly! Inside: The Secrets of Mt. Komorebi
Twinbrook: Postcard
Thinking of you from Twinbrook, where style is invented!
Sunset Valley: Postcard
Admiring the skies of Sunset Valley, where it all began!
Sixam: Postcard
Greetings from Sixam!
Midnight Hollow: Postcard
Eerie Greetings from Midnight Hollow, a Uniquely Eccentric Town.
Lunar Lakes: Postcard
Come experience Lunar Lakes! A place like nowhere else!
Isla Paradiso: Postcard
Fun in the Sun &amp; Under the Sea! Relaxing at tropical Isla Paradiso!
Bridgeport: Postcard
Touring the bright lights of Bridgeport!
Appaloosa Plains:  Postcard
Horsing around with furry friends! Come Visit Appaloosa Plains!
Moonlight Falls: Postcard
Moonlight Falls, home of all things Magical &amp; Supernatural!
Dragon Valley: Postcard
Huzzah! Come tarry a while in Dragon Valley. Here be Dragons!
Champs Les Sims: Postcard
Bonjour! Enjoying fine juice and frog legs in Champs Les Sims! 
Barnacle Bay: Postcard
Ahoy! There be a fine breeze ‘n plenty ‘o plunder here in Barnacle Bay! 
Riverview: Postcard
Gone Fishin' in Riverview! Havin' a Reel Good Time!
Lucky Palms: Postcard
What Happens in Lucky Palms, Stays in Lucky Palms!
Littlehaven: Postcard
Having a lovely holiday in Littlehaven. Wish you were here!
Bunchapals Postcard Corkboard
Getting too many penpals? The Bunchapals Postcard Corkboard will help you manage that growing stack of thoughtful, scenic mementos. Now with free thumbtacks!
Magic PlantSim Stump
This stump will house the magic beans that have been collected from the PlantSims you've met. Place six unique magic beans into the stump nodules, add a little water, and see what happens!
Big Star
The comet is the prima donna of space. Look at it, trailing its beauty across the sky, taking up 75 percent of this entire painting. In fact, the artist was trying to capture a blank, night sky, and the comet totally photobombed that scene. What a diva!
T-Rex Nebula
It's silly for us as humans to project shapes we recognize onto the random, ever-changing patterns of the cosmos. That said, this nebula totally came together to resemble a T-Rex, right? (Not to be confused with T. Rex Nebula, star of children's sci-fi cartoons.)
End of Time
Oh, no! Someone just flushed the universe. Jiggle the handle! Jiggle the HANDLE!
Standard Space
Yup. Here's some space. Looking space-like. It's got the stars. And the dark, gassy looking stuff. And some more stars. Hang it on a wall, to give that wall a real spacey feel.  
Saturn Return
Hubba hubba! Check out this glamour shot portrait Saturn had done a few years back, when it went through a divorce and lost all that weight (who's the second largest planet NOW, Uranus?). The slight blue glow really brings out its rings. Rumor has it that it's dating again and has recently attracted a sixty-third moon.
Twinkle
Is it a rainbow? A cloud? Stars? You might want to sit down, because it's actually a rainbow-colored cloud filled with stars! If you do not enjoy the unbelievable union of magic things in this painting, well then, sorry there's a cold hunk of obsidian where your heart should be.
Rosie the Riveting
Gasses such as helium and hydrogen pool together with interstellar dust to create this riveting, rose-colored nebula. Why ARE gasses and dust so attractive way out there in space? Here on earth, this helium balloon covered in dirt—well, it's just not the same.
Animal's Planet
In the X57 region of the 1245P-Brock galaxy, there is a planet populated entirely by giant hamsters. Here, two monster-sized hamster balls glisten in the sun, awaiting the return of their fuzzy inhabitants, who are busy running on a Ferris wheel (not pictured).
Star Crossed Lovers
This fantasy painting captures the mythical union of a crystal rock formation with a sizzling comet. Theirs was a love affair that defied gravity, physics and, well, probably several other laws. No one thought it would last. In fact, it didn't. But at least it burned out, before it faded away.
Seeing Red
Mars is the red planet. The dirt is red. The air is red. Want to wear blue pants on Mars? Too bad! There are only RED pants on Mars. This painting shows the Mars sky, with its fiery red clouds. Beautiful to an Earthling. Martians, however, have coined the saying, &quot;Let's go out and paint the town green!&quot;
Out of This World Style
Like cars, rockets come in different models. The sleek sports rocket. The SUV soccer mom rocket. And this—a reproduction of an ad for the tricked out luxury sedan rocket. Its style is inversely proportional to its aerodynamic qualities. Get to the moon slower. And look good doing it!
I Dream of Plesiosaur
A cloud formation looks deceptively like a wandering plesiosaurus, set against a stunning early-evening vista. What might the cloud plesiosaur be searching for? The gentle stratus doesn't answer, but floats on, unaware of its inevitable demise.
Battle Stars
Since ancient times, we have scanned the night sky for signs of things to come. This star-spangled horizon contains countless constellations, each of which can be read for information about the future.  (The small U.F.O.s under the stars, for example, can be read as a sign of imminent attack.)
Surfacing
Just imagine this strange world as it would look viewed by an alien returning to its home planet. Oh the longing in that alien's five heart chambers, the tears in its 22 eyes. Back on the surface, it will no longer be “alien.” It will visit its neighborhood bar, where everyone knows its name: “XF2&amp;23%tY.”
Cloudy Vision
In space, cloudy days trump sunny ones. That's because the clouds are made of green glitter! The sun, on the other hand, is made of fire and radiation. Before visiting space, definitely check the space-weather forecast. Or just stay home and marvel at this painting.
Blemish Blossom
This artwork chronicles the awkward adolescent stage of plant cell development, where they are tormented by embarrassing acne. Absorbing enough rainwater can really help, and fortunately, a cell can just divide to create its own prom date.
Crystal Palace
At the crux of hard science and new age woo-woo lies the crystal. Here, we can see both the distinctive crystal geometry, revered by scientists for its electrical, optical and mechanical properties, and the glittery crystal sparkles, known for their harmonic love vibrations and aura cleansing magic.
Cell Block
Look at the precision fit of these bright cells. No wonder they’re called the “building blocks of life.” In fact, the only difference between toy blocks and living cells is that organisms are not assembled by children. (Except for the platypus; that was built by a third grader named Frank.)
Falling
Evoking all the colors of autumn, this mineral painting represents the diminished glow of youth, and the twilight years of life, when all hope is gone, and the path we have taken slides toward its eventual tear-filled end. Hang it in the breakfast nook or the baby's nursery!
Rhapsody in Blue
Don’t have a green thumb? No problem. Enjoy plants at the cellular level, where they’re actually blue—and in art form, where they require no water, sunlight or “Please don’t leave me!” pep talks.
Hooplankton
This compelling artwork captures the plankton hula hoop performance team mid-rehearsal, for a number that will sink into obscurity when, en route to a gig, the entire team is eaten by a turtle.
Party in Pink
Magnification reveals interesting facts about microorganisms, such as their preference for bubble gum pink décor and festive streamers hung in their living rooms, all year round. If life on earth were a giant party, microorganisms were the first to arrive, and as this painting reveals, they may be the last to leave!
Psychedelic Rock
If there’s one thing we've learned through microscopic explorations into the mineral world it’s this: Rocks sure are trippy! Here we have Dunite, magnified fifty zillion percent and captured in bright tempera. Hang it in a college dorm room! 
Leaf Meat
Isn't it strange how zooming in on a fossilized leaf actually makes it look similar to a piece of steak? Are plants and animals more alike than they seem? Do leaves also feel love and fear? What does this say about veganism? Should we eat anything at all? Art raises some serious questions.
Snow Fight
They say each snowflake is unique. Up close, these snow crystals, secure in their individual flakiness, appear to be gathering around one deformed snow pyramid, who they will shortly beat up for being TOO different. As this painting reveals, snow is not as gentle as it seems.
The Drifter
Never fall in love with a plankton. Flowing wherever the current takes them, they are total vagabonds. Here’s one such plankton, dancing with groupies after a night playing electric guitar with the Bacteria Band. Fortunately this moment was captured in art. We’ll never see him again.
Trace Remains
Ever just know something in your bones? That’s because the skeleton can act as an antennae, transmitting info to the brain. In this dinosaur fossil, we see the haunting conduits where bone instinct may have cried out, “Run! METEOR!” Dinosaurs had brains the size of peas. That’s why they all died. Enjoy your painting.
The Moon's Meteor
Every 10 years, the meteor &quot;Bob&quot; skim's this moon's surface. Friction from the atmosphere causes the meteor to ignite. Scientists predict that in time the meteor will dissolve fully, so enjoy it while it lasts!
Time-Lapse Moon
Scientists theorize this moon might be capable of hosting life. They've studied it at large, and have many time-lapse photos of it. 
Sixam from the Moon
Many have wondered what the planet of Sixam might look like. Wonder no more, for this is a picture of Sixam from the perspective of its moon. 
Mooooon
When Barnaby B. Cow discovered a moon surrounding Mrafmis 1, his colleagues were dismayed to learn that he had actually named it &quot;Mooooon.&quot;
The Flaming Moon of Flugne
Though the Flaming Moon of Flugne is titled thusly, it does not actually flame. Rather it has surrounding space debris that refracts an orange hue from the sun. Beautiful, yes? Fire, no. 
The Enchanted Moon of Lacigam
Scientists studying the Moon of Lacigam have discovered green energy that seems to emanate from its surface. Radioactive bursts of this mysterious energy are regularly pushed into space. The question remains: is the moon doing this itself or is someone down there? 
Anglerfish
A sneaky predator fish that lures prey into its mouth with a small, glowing tentacle-like growth on its head.
Ice Chest
collectFishChest_01
collectFishChest_bm
collectFishChest_bm
Volenton
Volenton is a beautiful purple Orelloid. It occurs naturally in deposits of volcanic rock and in rib-based fast food sandwiches.
Selium
Selium is a member of the Transition Ores -- not the ironic ska/country fusion band of the same name, but rather the group of elements.
Plumbobus
Trying to describe Plumbobus is like trying to bite your own neck. It is impossible! Plumbobus is so unique. It is… amazing.
Peryllium
Peryllium, chemical symbol Ll, is a beautiful pink Orelloid. Many describe it as something that could only come from a unicorn’s magic, and that's scientists talking!
Ozinate
Ozinate is a member of the Transition Ores. They say just a sprinkle of it can help make casserole night a family favorite again!
Oxypin
Oxypin is a member of the Transition Ores. The scientist who discovered this group of metals was going through some tough times, hence the name Transition Ores. Oxypin is blue, which represents the scientist’s sorrow.
Wolfium
Wolfium is a strange element notorious for its smell, which for some reason is similar to that of a wet dog.
Firaxium
Very little is known about the element Firaxium. It simply does not grant very many interviews.
Crytacoo
Crytacoo is prized for its legendary durability. It's so strong, it can't even be manipulated by modern tools. It just has to be found in usable shapes!
Sydrolin
Sydrolin, chemical symbol Sy, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. While Sydrolin looks like grape juice, please do not drink Sydrolin. Seriously.
Plathium
Plathium, chemical symbol Pl, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. Plathium looks a lot like lemonade but tastes more like horrible choking death.
Phozone
Phozone, chemical symbol Pz, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. The scientist that discovered Phozone really loved broth, noodles, and meat with just a touch of carrots, which she often ate while doing experiments.
Melacoo
Melacoo, chemical symbol Q, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. For a long time Melacoo was actually thought to be Sydrolin, but those scientists were just lazy.
Goobleck
Goobleck, chemical symbol Vg, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. Goobleck has been scientifically proven to have the best name out of all elements.
Alcineat
Alcineat, chemical symbol An, is a member of the elite Royal Liquids, which have strong colors but no odor. It was discovered in the 50's when someone found a puddle of it in her backyard.
Elemental Display Rack
Proudly display your element collection on this official Geo Council rack. Now with inert magnetic snap-slots.
Decorative Egg
A beautifully decorated egg. Make your friends envious, be the talk of the town.
Simanite
Simanite is one of the few stones with a true silver color. It has been used in everything from alchemy to utensil polishing.
Sapphire
Bluer than the sky, Sapphire is a sight to behold! Known as the gem of truth, it helped coin the phrase &quot;true blue.&quot;
Rainborz
Rainborz is a rare and unusual gemstone that is multi-colored, but predominantly red. And strangely, it is frequently found near rainbows!
Peach
This small stone is delicate in size with a demure, peachy-pink color. No wonder it is the embodiment of innocence. 
Orange Topaz
Being relatively abundant and durable, Orange Topaz is a very popular gemstone! With its happy color, it can be a symbol of friendship.
Jonquilyst
Jonquilyst is like a glittering drop of sunshine! Its bright, yellow color radiates cheerfulness. 
Hematite
Even though Hematite has a black metallic luster on the outside, it has a dark, blood red color on the inside.
Emerald
Emerald literally means green gem, and the gorgeous green color of emeralds are unparalleled! Having one will surely make others green with envy!
Diamond
Often used in jewelry, these sparkling gems are some of the most valued in the world and are also the hardest known natural material!
Amethyst
Amethysts are purple colored quartz! From soft lilac to royal violet, these purple shades are caused by iron impurities in the stone.
Turquoise
Turquoise is an opaque, blue-to-green stone that has been prized for centuries, as many believe it brings protection and good fortune.
Shinolite
Shinolite is the shiniest stone of them all! Be careful looking at it as you might just get hypnotized by its gleaming silver beauty.
Ruby
Sought after for their brilliant red hues, rubies represent the passion of love. Decorating your slippers with them do not allow you to teleport. 
Rose
Named for its pale pink color, Rose quartz is the stone of unconditional love and exudes a soothing sense of tranquility. 
Quartz
Quartz was once believed to be ice crystals that would never melt, but now we know it’s made of silicon–oxygen tetrahedra. Duh.
Plumbite
While Plumbites are found in varying shades from red to yellow to green, it’s most popular hue is a deep, bright green. 
Jet
Because of its somber coloring Jet is commonly used in mourning jewelry, but it isn’t commonly known that Jet is actually fossilized wood!
Fire Opal
These uncommon opals are generally found in volcanic rock formations and are prized for their shifting warm, fiery colors.
Citrine
Like delicious citrus fruits, Citrine colors range from pale yellow to golden. Perhaps that color is why it’s thought to bring success and prosperity! 
Alabaster
Alabaster is a milky white stone that is soft and smooth to the touch. 
Unlocked at level 3 of the Culinary career or level 2 of the Tech Guru career, or at Gold level of the Dinner Party.
Unlock by reaching level 3 of the Culinary career or level 2 of the Tech Guru career, or by completing a Dinner Party at Gold level.
Stainless Steel Auto-Pot
Sleek, smooth, and impeccably crafted, this heat-regulating coffeepot has enough processing power to put a high-end computer to shame! For cuisiniers and techies alike.
The Caffeininator
Caffeine: a popular pick-me-up in the fields of technology and law enforcement, this wonderful substance can be brewed in your own kitchen thanks to the Caffeininator! Delivered via a hot brown liquid, it's sure to give you the pep you crave! Get Caffeininated!
Joe Jockey
Are you someone who really, really loves coffee? Well, you might want to consider buying the Joe Jockey anyway. It has a feature that squirts hot water over coffee grounds, producing a lightly browned liquid. Is it fancy? No. Does it get the job done? Let’s say “Sure.”
Café Immodéré
This is a premium brew-station for connoisseurs who understand that coffee is a LIFESTYLE, not some bitter swill that only serves as a dunking place for one’s donuts.  Our machine brews fine coffee, for fine men and women. Fine pastries can be enjoyed with, but never IN, our coffee. Enjoy an Immodéré life!
The Schmapple Coffee
Coffee makers come with a variety of different functions and abilities. It can be hard to choose the best one. Ours come in a variety of pretty colors. Looks like your choice just got a lot easier. Introducing: The Schmapple Coffee. It’s Coffee, to the Power of You.

Dodecagon Contemporary Clock
Did you know that a 12-sided polygon is called a dodecagon? Now you do. Makes sense for a clock with no numbers, don’t you think?
Kindermade Clock
Hey, parents! Here’s a cool way to teach your kids how to tell time even when your tablet’s battery is dead! Tiny mechanical “hands” slowly rotate around the clock, pointing to the numbers representing the current time. Funducational!
Industrial Wall Clock
This industrial steel wall clock looks virtually indestructible, and it is if it doesn’t fall off your exposed brick wall, onto whatever industrial-grade flooring you probably have to go with it. So hang it well, k?
Remembrance Clock

Bawdy Language
By: Meomi Here \n\nBody language can be hard to read, so why not learn to send clearer signals? In her sensual and exciting new book, Meomi Here teaches you inviting new poses such as Bye-Bye Booty, Aloha Allure, and Forget-My-Lats Not.
Sleeping Standing Up

I Beg Variations

The Utopiate
Every living creature from the mighty elephant to the tiniest blade of grass needs sanctuary, and we’re no exception. Our beds should be places of safety and comfort that allow our brain to participate unhindered in the magic of dreams. Like all of our furniture, this bed is made from reclaimed garbage. The Utopiate.
Burst of Pride Double Bed
Find the coziest of safe spaces in this colorfully comfy bed, complete with extra blankets and pillows! It's the perfect place to curl up and enjoy a new novel, your favorite show, or dream away the time.
Killer Queen Double Bed
Also available in queen plus, king minus, cal-king, and king.
Casket of Quiet Repose
&lt;font color='#199C2C'&gt;From the Reaper's Rewards Event&lt;/font&gt;\n\nA traditional burial casket adorned with a floral skull inspired by the Grim Reaper himself. This model has been fitted with extra padding and sound proofing, guaranteeing a peaceful rest for the occupant.
Mod Pod Top Bunk
The Mod Pod line has done it again! If you enjoy the clean and simple lines of the contemporary Mod Pod Sleeper Bed, you will definitely like this version. The Mod Pod Top Bunk will make you feel as if you were sleeping in a cloud... quite literally in the sky even! Well... sort of, you know what I mean... I think.
Metal Framed Top Bunk
Fancy sleeping with a view? Top view that is! The Metal Framed Top Bunk brings you the feeling of being in a bunk bed, without the extra... well... bed and all the extra hardware! Why have two when what you need is only one? And by the way, it is the better one!
Jet Set Luxury Bath
An extra-deep bathtub fitted with spa-quality water jets to soothe tired muscles and rejuvenate the spirit.
Triteia Luxury Corner Bath with Jets
This luxury jetted tub guarantees not only cleanliness but your own indoor jacuzzi experience.
My Secret Spa Tub
Don’t let the clean, Spartan lines of this tub fool you. Hidden inside its shiny walls are the tiniest microjets ever created, secretly massaging your tired muscles in true minimalist spirit.
Princess Cordelia's Bathtub
The porcelain for this bathtub was heated by a fire-breathing kraken that regularly attacked Princess Cordelia's submarine! When it attacked, the fire was channeled through a series of ducts before reaching the Eppsilon’s onboard kiln. How many other furniture companies can make this claim? Three or four, tops?
Cask &amp; Barrel Antique Tub
Transport yourself back to the days when baths were taken in wooden barrels, and discover why baths were hardly ever taken.
Rub-a-Dub Tub
Set sail for the best bath time ever in this jolly banded maritime tub! Extra deep body offers plenty of room for a butcher or baker, or just a solo scrub clean.
Captain Mahogany Wood Tub
Splash your way to pure bliss in this delightfully smooth mahogany tub. Extra high back and head rest is angled just right for a soothing rest, and won’t overflow if you nod off and slip in.
Superb Soakster
Supersize your soaking space with this simple tub for the tallest among us. Climb in, lay back, and bask in bubbles from your nose to your toes. 
Floral Hygiene Clawfoot Tub
Smell like a rose after a dip in this classic enameled clawfoot tub.
Spacebucket

The Epicure

As filters are turned on, they are added to the list above the catalog. So even when the panel is closed, you'll know what's being filtered.
Build has a powerful filter system that lets you find the exact object you are looking for.\n\nClick the Open Filter Panel arrow at the top of any catalog to view the Filter options.
Click to learn more about the Filter Panel.
Windows
Windows can be moved vertically and horizontally along a wall to get the perfect placement.\n\nProTip: Holding the [alt] key allows for finer vertical placement of windows.
Windows can be sorted by height to find the proper window for your wall height. You can also use the Show All sort and find the window height information in the hover tip for each window.
Windows can be placed individually by clicking on the By Window option.  Or they can be placed automatically for an entire room by clicking on the By Room option.
Windows are found in the Build catalog by clicking on the Windows sort in the House Portrait.
Click to learn more about Windows.
Styled Rooms
This is a fast and easy way to instantly create a fully functioning venue!
Ladders have three exit points at the top, which means they can be placed up against a wall on any of their three sides (including the landing). So long as one of their three exit points are accessible, Sims will be able to use the ladder.
If you want to change the style of an existing staircase or ladder, choose a new stair or ladder from the catalog and move your mouse on top of the existing stairs or ladder and click.
To add a Railing to your stairs, click on the Stair Railings sort in the House Portrait. Choose a railing style from the catalog and click on the staircase you want to add them to.
To create a ladder between two floors, select a Ladder style and bring it towards the desired location. Hovering the Ladder over a floor tile at either the base or top of a room, will highlight the ladder green when in a valid placement. The Ladder will snap into place when it is close enough. You can click and drag to rotate the Ladder to suit your desired placement.\n\nNote: Ladders do not create floors. You will need to attach them to existing tiles in order to make them useful.
To create a stairway landing, first raise the foundation to the desired height. Select a Stair style from the Stairs catalog, and bring them close to your desired location. They will snap into place.\n\nIf they are not correctly oriented, click and drag to rotate the stairs.
To create a stairway to a new floor, select a Stair style and bring it towards a Room. The stairway will snap into place when it is close enough. You can click and drag to rotate the stairs to suit your desired placement.\n\nNote: Stairs do not create floors. You will need to attach them to exiting rooms in order to make them useful.
Stairs and Ladders are found in the Build catalog by clicking on the Stairs sort in the House Portrait.
Placed stairs can be adjusted much like rooms and walls. Select an existing staircase and use the side arrows to change the width.\n\nYou can also pick up or rotate a placed staircase by selecting the Move and Rotate options from the context menu.
Stairs, Ladders, and Railings
Click to learn more about Stairs, Ladders, and Railings.
Spandrels
You can remove Spandrels by clicking on the wall and choosing the Remove Spandrels option from the context menu.\n\nNote: Choose the  Build Wall or Build Fence option from the context menu to create either after the Spandrels have been removed.
Click on a style in the catalog and then click on the wall you want to apply the Spandrels.\n\nNote: Spandrels can only be placed on a wall and will move anything already placed on the wall to the Household Inventory.
Spandrels are found in the Build catalog by clicking on the Spandrels sort in the House Portrait.
Click to learn more about Spandrels.
Search
Rotate Object
Default camera style rotates object by clicking the right mouse button when an object is held by your cursor ([ctrl + RMB] will rotate in the opposite direction).\n\nSims 3 camera style rotates objects by using the left mouse button and dragging to rotate.\n\nProTip: You can always rotate an object or block held on your cursor by using the [&amp;lt;] or [&amp;gt;] keys.
Rooms and Walls
Click on the Wall Height options that become available once the Rooms and Walls catalog is open. These allow you to adjust the wall height for the current floor.\n\nNote: Some architectural elements, such as friezes, and some doors and windows, require a taller wall.
Roofs
Roofs are found in the Build catalog by clicking on the Roofs sort in the House Portrait.
Selecting a Roof style from the Roofs catalog will change the current floor selection to the first floor that needs a roof. Place the selected Roof on top of a Room, and then use the available adjustments to fine tune it afterwords.
Add extra style to your roofs with patterns and roof trim!  Both options are found in the Build catalog by clicking on Roof Patterns and Roof Sculptures sorts.
Use the arrows to resize width, length and height. Use the knobs to adjust the curve of the roof.
Click to learn more about Roofs.
Pools
ProTip: Pools will merge with each other to create a single Pool if they share the same exterior walls. This allows you to easily move and manipulate your Pools, and customize the look you are seeking.\n\nNote: Pools and Rooms will not merge since they are different block types. 
Click on the Pools sort in the Build catalog to place a Pool on your lot. There is also a Pools Objects sort for additional touches you can add to a Pool.\n\nNote: There are many Pool shapes to start building with. Mixing and re-shaping them can create something new and exciting! &#xD;&#xA;
Unlike Rooms, there are a few things you are unable to do with Pools. You cannot use manipulator to drag terrain Pools into Rooms or structures on another level--this would be super destructive. You are also unable to remove and build Pools walls via context menu. The water would just flood the space!\n\nProtip: You can drag a Pool into a Room if you first remove the room’s wall.
You can place a Pool in two ways: Directly in the terrain or within an existing room. As with Rooms, clicking on the placed Pool will open up a context menu. Use the Move option to pick up and move your Pool. Use the Rotate buttons to rotate the Pool left and right.\n\nProtip: Rotating can be destructive! Pick up your Pool with the Move option and then use the keyboard shortcut [&amp;lt;] and [&amp;gt;] to safely rotate.
Object Economy
All objects depreciate upon returning to Live Mode. Make sure you have things looking the way you want before you exit Build Mode.\n\nNote: Picking up an object will display its current value in the bottom right corner.
Friezes / Exterior Trims
Friezes and Exterior Trims are found in the Build catalog by clicking on their sort in the House Portrait.
Select the Exterior Trims sort and choose a style, then click on the Room you want to apply it to. Use the Sledgehammer Tool to remove an Exterior Trim.\n\nNote: Exterior Trims can not be placed on the first floor.
Friezes can only be applied to medium or tall walls. The catalog tooltip for a Frieze will indicate the required wall height.\n\nSelect the Frieze sort and choose a style, then click on the Room you want to apply it to. Use the Sledgehammer Tool to remove a Frieze.
Click to learn more about Friezes and Exterior Trims.
Foundations
Click on the Walls View button to toggle between Walls Down, Walls Cutaway, and Walls Up Views.\n\nNote: Walls Cutaway View will hide all walls between your current view and the back wall of your home. As well as cutaway to the active Sim if they happen to be behind the back wall.
To add foundation to your lot, use the Foundation Height Widget. This can be found in the center of a block when selecting it. \n\nAll blocks that are touching the selected block will raise and lower together. You can raise and lower separate non touching blocks independent from one another. Only Blocks of the same foundation height and on the same build level can be connected together. Blocks on different foundation heights and levels will never be able to connect.\n\nPro Tip: When trying to match the height of separate block cluster raise and lower the desired cluster until the blocks of the same height and level highlight white.
Build camera controls include an extra option not available in Live Mode, Top Down View. Toggle this option to switch between your normal build camera view and a top down bird's eye view of your lot.
To change the foundation style, choose a style from the catalog and click on the foundation you want to change. The style will apply to all of the foundation for a single Room.\n\nProTip: You can hold shift to only apply the foundation style to one side of a Room.
Click on the Go Down to Lower Floor or Go Up to Next Floor buttons to change the floor you are currently viewing. Walls will default to up on any floor below your current floor, and will be hidden for any floor above your current floor.\n\nProTip: You can use [PgUp] and [PgDwn] to toggle between floor levels.
Foundations are found in the Build catalog by clicking on the Foundations sort in the House Portrait.
Click to learn more about Foundations.
Fences &amp; Gates
If you start drawing on an existing wall, you'll get a wall railing. Wall railings function exactly as walls.\n\nProTip: You can also create wall railings by choosing Build Fence from a Wall context menu. And then apply a new fence style via the Replace Fence tool.
Select the Replace Fences tool from the Fences catalog. Then select a fence style. Click on an existing wall / fence to replace all wall segments along one side of a Room with the chosen fence.\n\nHold [shift] to replace the entire Room, or [alt] to just replace a single wall segment.
Fences and Gates can be found in the Build catalog by clicking on their sorts in the House Portrait.\n\nThere are two ways to build fences:  by placing them on an existing wall / fence or by drawing them with the Fence Tool.
Yard fences are similar to walls, but do not create floors when enclosed, and can't be widened though their length can be adjusted. And their only context menu option is remove them.\n\nNote: You can also delete them with the Sledgehammer Tool.
Select the Place Fences by Drawing or Place Fence Enclosure to begin drawing a fence. When drawing a fence, you can make two types: terrain fence or wall railing.\n\nIf you start drawing on the ground, you'll get a yard fence.
Click to learn more about Fences and Gates.
ProTip: Rooms will merge with other Rooms to create a single Room if they share the same exterior walls. This includes Rooms placed inside of other Rooms, such as inner courtyards. This allows you to easily move and manipulate your Rooms, and customize the look you are seeking.
You can Remove and Build Walls / Fences by clicking on the wall of a placed Room. Click on a wall to see the available options which vary depending upon the walls current settings. You can also Remove and Build Floors this way.\n\nNote: When a wall has been removed, click on the ghosted wall that appears to get the option to re-build it.
Empty Rooms
Doors
Click on a Room from the Empty Rooms and Walls sort within the Rooms and Walls catalog to place it on your lot.\n\nNote: There are many shaped Rooms to start building with, mixing and re-shaping them can create something new and exciting!
Objects cost Simoleons.  Open up the Objects by … catalogs and hover over an object to see its cost. Objects you can't afford will show up with a red background.\n\nAll unlocked objects are sorted in value order; the least expensive to the most expensive.
Fridge? Baby? Contemporary? Rocket? Whatever you might be looking for, type it in the Search field, click on the Search button (or hit Enter) and see what you find.\n\nMisspelled something? Maybe it will still find what you are looking for or click the X button to start a new search.
Doors are found in the Build catalog by clicking on the Doors sort in the House Portrait.
Click on the Styled Rooms sort from within the Rooms and Walls catalog to browse the pre-made Rooms. Selecting the Room sort along the top switches the catalog of pre-made Rooms to the chosen Room type, such as BathRooms, Dining Rooms, or Kitchens.
Click on the Build catalog and then click on the Rooms and Walls sort found in the House Portrait.\n\nTo build any structure, you will need to start here. Here you can find Empty and Styled Rooms, Wall and Room tools, and any Rooms that you have saved.
Click on a placed Room to open up a context menu. Use the Move option to pick up and move your Room. Use Rotate Room to rotate your Room to the left and right. Or click and drag one of the wall arrows to resize the Room.\n\nProTip: Rotating can be destructive! Pick up your Room with the Move option and then use the keyboard shortcuts [&amp;lt;] and [&amp;gt;] to safely rotate.
The more expensive an object, the more likely it is to provide greater benefits to your Sims. Hover over an object in the catalog to see what type of benefits an object may provide.
You can also choose one of the suggested pop-ups that appear as you are typing.
Doors can be sorted by height, or you can use the Show All sort and find the door height information in the hover tip for each door.\n\nNote: If the door you want doesn't fit on your walls, adjust the wall height at any time by clicking on any block and choose a wall height from the block gizmo.
Click on a Room in the Styled Rooms catalog to get a larger view of the Room.  From here you can buy individual objects or buy and place the whole Room to quickly add a new addition to your house.\n\nProTip: Double click on a Room in the catalog to allow for quick placement of the entire Room.
Click on the Empty Rooms and Walls catalog or the Styled Rooms catalog to browse the different Rooms available.\n\nNote: You can create multiple stories by clicking on the Floor Up and Floor Down arrows in the upper right, and then placing a Room on the upper floors.
Click to learn more about Doors.
If you're holding an item on your cursor, you can rotate it by tapping the . or , keys.
Build Catalog
To add a roof, click on Roofs and select one from the catalog. Once you click to place a roof, your floor view will change to make placement easier.\n\nProTip: A Room without a roof will be lit by the exterior lighting, and may not look the way you imagined it.
Make sure your Sims can get inside your creation and add a Door!\n\nProTip: In Live Mode, let the neighbors know where to go when they visit by clicking on any exterior door and choosing Set as Front Door.
Build Camera
Build Tools
Click Undo to undo the last Build action. Click Redo to redo the last Build action.\n\nUndo and Redo are saved per build session. Once you exit Build Mode, you will not be able to Undo or Redo any changes from a previous Build session.
The Design Tool can be used to quickly change the color choice of objects that have already been placed.\n\nSelect the Design Tool. Click on an object and choose a new color from the swatch pop up. You will not be charged Simoleons for changing colors.
Choose the Sledgehammer tool to delete and destroy.\n\nClick on an object to delete it. Or click and drag to remove a group of similar items (all items to be deleted will highlight yellow).\n\nNote: Bulldoze Lot is found in the Lot Info panel and is used to completely empty a lot. A warning, Bulldoze Lot can't be undone.
The Eyedropper tool is used to copy the properties of a placed object or pattern, as well as some architectural elements (such as fences and spandrels).\n\nClicking on what you want to copy will attach a copy onto the cursor, as well as open to the home location of the copied item in the catalog.
The Select tool is used to select objects and architecture found on your lot.\n\nWhile using any other tool, hitting [Esc] will always return to the Select tool.
Build Mode has several tools to help you build your perfect home.\n\nThe toolbar can be found in Build Mode along the top of the screen.
Can't find what you seek? Try Search. Just type what you are looking for and hit enter (or choose from the suggested items that pop up as you type).\n\nFilters can help to narrow down your search to a specific color or style.
To begin furnishing your home choose between the Objects by Room catalog, where you can imagine the décor of your home room by room. Or the Objects by Function catalog, when you would rather search for a specific functional need.
Use the Build catalog to add doors, windows, roofs, floors, adjust the foundation, or add architectural flourishes like spandrels, roof attachments, trims, and friezes.\n\nOr change the patterns of the roof, floor, and walls; add a fence, gate, stairs, columns, outdoor décor and a fountain, or just paint the terrain. Go nuts!
Start in the Rooms and Walls sort to begin building your home by plopping down fully furnished rooms from the Styled Rooms sub-sort.  Or craft your own rooms by clicking on the Empty Rooms and Walls sub-sort.
To get started click on the Build Mode button in the upper right.\n\nProTip: You can also use F2 to jump directly to the Objects by Room catalog, or F3 to get into the Build catalog.
This lesson will provide a quick overview of the features available in Build Mode! To learn more, select any lesson from this Lessons panel. Or, enter Build Mode and just start clicking around to see what happens.
Build Mode
Platforms
Platforms also double as stages! Your Sims can interact with Sims who are on other platform heights within a reasonable distance.

Management

Athlete

The Muscle

By the time {0.SimFirstName} gave up and returned to the cubby, {F0.her}{M0.his} crush’s bookbag was gone and the entire opportunity had been lost.
{0.SimFirstName} secretly dropped {M0.his}{F0.her} card in the cubby. When the other kids came in from recess, {M0.he}{F0.she} watched from across the room as {M0.his}{F0.her} card was opened. Glitter spilled out from the envelope, but it was surpassed in brightness by {M0.his}{F0.her} crush’s smile. Though {M0.his}{F0.her} involvement remained a secret, {0.SimFirstName} went the rest of {F0.her}{M0.his} day with a warm fuzzy feeling inside.

Ciudad Enamorada
A city for the romantics, Ciudad Enamorada is well known for its ample opportunities for romantic getaways and scandalous trysts. Whether head over heels or still looking for love, this city provides passionate moments for each. An aspiring romantic can explore Vista Hermosa for the warm and welcoming suburban life, the lush and picturesque Plaza Mariposa for walking hand in hand at sunset, or the traditional meets modern Nuevo Corazón for those seeking the alluring temptation of the nightlife.
Enchanting Locale
Love is in the air thanks to the romantic vistas, charming park, and passionate Sims.
Looking for Love
Still single? No worry! Find your next flame at the Nightclub, Lounge, or Gym to burn off some pent-up energy.

Life &amp; Death
Life &amp; Death
Ravenwood
Things always get a little spooky in Ravenwood. The Whispering Glen with its nightly Moon Revelry festivities is perhaps the most &quot;normal&quot; part of the area, where locals have settled down for a slice of quiet, country life. Crow's Crossing village, however, is clearly quite haunted—swings swaying by themselves, that Merchant fellow down by the Crypt, scary little Edith guarding the Well of Longing and Regret…but despite the hauntings, the living have certainly made it their home as well with a variety of festivals and places to explore. Mourningvale is where things get extra ethereal! It's well known as a home for Ghosts and those seeking them. Sometimes Grim even stops by!
Chilling Collections
Stop by the Collector Signs in any of the three neighborhoods, explore a Crypt, discover the secrets of the Tarot Tome Shrines, or check out the eerie ruins of Whispering Glen.
Memorial Sites
Crypts, Cemeteries, the Afterlife Anonymous meeting, and little consoling Specters! Ravenwood is the perfect place to lift the spirits.
Ghosts &amp; Grim
Want some Ghosts? Mourningvale is a literal ghost town, and Crow's Crossing village is clearly haunted! Soak in the spooky during Ravenwood's many festivals, become a temporary Ghost by taking a dip in the Baleful Bog, and possibly even run into Grim himself.
A Town Worth Haunting
Friendly or Fiendish?
Goodbye (For Now)

Tartosa
Romantic sites and scenery have long graced the seaside region of Tartosa, creating the perfect setting for love and matrimonial pursuits. It isn't uncommon for vacationers and honeymooners alike to return year after year, seeking to re-experience the intimacy of visits past. They say there's a love story in the making for everyone. Just ask Tartosa's residents, and they'll excitedly gossip about local Wedding Industry shenanigans or the area's love-laced, historical past. But even if a Sim doesn't find their soulmate here, one thing is for certain... they're fated to fall in love with the land. 
Local History
Word travels fast through Tartosa's Grapevine, and myths and legends about the area's history abound.
Romantic Sights
Romance lofts through Tartosa's air, and there's always a new adventure to be had at one of the area's various romantic sites!
Village Square
Visit Porto Luminoso's various shops and market stalls. Just don't forget to try the world-famous fruit tarts!

Innisgreen
The enchanting isle of Innisgreen is renowned for its natural beauty and vibrant communities. Sims from afar are drawn to the idyllic Sprucederry Grove, where Foraging is abundant and life flourishes in harmony with nature. In the mystical forest of Everdew, the pursuit of Fairy life and relationships offers enchanted experiences. Adventure awaits at the Coast of Adhmor, where the isle's rich history and secrets unfold through its engaging residents and monuments. Innisgreen is celebrated for its development of the Apothecary skill, attracting Sims eager to pursue careers in Naturopathy and holistic practices.
An Enchanting World
From the forested Everdew to the Coast of Adhmor, delight and discovery await in the special landmarks, plants, and stories of this world.
Healing Haven
Tap into natural healing and self-care through a strong local connection with Apothecary arts.

Copperdale
Once renowned for its booming mining industry, the town of Copperdale, quaint and historic, lay nestled on the banks of Lake LaSuli. Founder Jasper Prescott had foraged this land for its treasured crystals, hoping Copperdale would one day blossom into a prosperous community for families and travelers alike. And though the mine carts reached an eternal halt, the townspeople continued to flourish. With academics and adventures abound, Copperdale is now home to many families seeking a small-town life with big-city dreams for themselves and their teens. Together they've unearthed a gem far more precious than before - beloved high school memories.
Town Centre
Home to residents and bustling with teens, come enjoy the tea, trends, and tales of Prescott Square, Copperdale's historic central hub.
Academia
Learning is always an adventure! Dive into academics or take a break from studying to cheer on the Womp Womps at a Copperdale High afterschool festival.
Pier Attractions
Bring friends, family, or even a special someone, to enjoy the thrills of Plumbite Pier's waterfront fairground filled with attractions.

San Sequoia
San Sequoia began as a small fishing town, then became a hub of the fishing and canning industry due to the influence of local fisherman-turned-entrepreneur, Bayani Robles. The Robles family is still very much entrenched in the area even as it has expanded over time thanks to Gilbert Gilberts. Today, San Sequoia is home to cozy streets, a beautiful park with gardens, and quiet suburban neighborhoods. It's the perfect place to raise a family!
Family Friendly
Bring the whole family along to enjoy a movie at the wharf or a bit of a nosh at the Around the World in 80 Bites food cart.  There's plenty for all ages to see and explore!
Wharf Wonders
The heart of San Sequoia can be found at Anchorpoint Wharf, where the area's fishing industry history is still visible in the architecture.
Park Paradise
Stomp around at Whalebert's splash pad play area, fish and swim in a pond, or go for a walk on any one of our Gilbert Gardens' three walking paths surrounding Celebration Lake.

If your Pet likes someone you want them to dislike, you can use the Be Mean To interaction.
If your Pet dislikes someone you want them to like, use the Be Nice To interaction. 
Your Pets are bound to misbehave, it’s up to you whether you let that misbehavior continue or teach them to stop.
Pets are loveable animals, don’t forget to hug and kiss them daily.
Each dog will need to learn tricks individually, but you will gain skill for teaching any dog.
Leveling up your Pet Training Skill, you’ll be able to direct your dog to Perform Tricks. With luck, you might get some Simoleons from bystanders.
If you think your pet needs something but you’re not quite sure try asking your pet, “What’s Wrong.”
Pay attention to your pet’s thought balloons. They will give you a hint into what they need.
Don’t forget to keep your pet’s food bowl filled. A full belly pet is a happy pet!

Triple Boost Week: From Farm, to photograph, to Table!
Jasmine returns with a delicious proposition.
Boost Gardening, and Delay Needs!
For two weeks only, take advantage of Jasmine’s potent Moodlets to ratchet up your Sims’ artistic, culinary, and gardening skills. You’ll delight in your Sims’ newfound abilities to cultivate a bountiful harvest, which can then be used in the preparation of a nourishing meal. Alternatively, explore their creative side and create prized paintings, sculptures, or photographs. And while Jasmine can’t yet manipulate the passage of time, she can help slow your Sims’ Hygiene and Hunger decay, giving you more free hours in the day to expand their repertoire. Take advantage of this triple boost to help your Sims prepare for The Sims 4 Seasons Expansion Pack!

Triple Boost Week: Relationships
Find love 3x faster!
Boost Relationships
Love is in the air! Jasmine is back in town, and playing the role of Cupid. This week only, your Sims’ can get that first kiss, hot date, or even married three times faster than usual! Just ask Jasmine for a boost that will help you hit your relationship goals three times faster. Woohoo!
Toddlers Are Here!
Have your Sims love and care for them.
Cute New Objects!
Feed your Toddlers in their high chair, tuck them in at night in their tiny toddler beds, and decorate their room with new furniture and decals. These objects and more can be found in Build Mode.
Help Them Grow!
Show your little Sims love and affection as you teach them to walk, talk, and use the potty. Help develop their minds by reading them stories, playing with flash cards, and stacking building blocks.
New Arrivals!
Toddlers have arrived! There are three ways to bring these adorable little ones into your Sims lives. You can add them to your families in Create a Sim, age them up from a baby, or even adopt them. Bring them into your world and enjoy the special (but sometimes chaotic) moments one can only experience with toddlers.
Triple Boost Week: All About Satisfaction
Earn rewards 3x faster!
Boost Satisfaction, Delay Needs!
This week only, help your Sims earn rewards faster and give them more time for fun! Just find your good friend Jasmine Holiday. She'll give your Sim a triple satisfaction boost and slow down your Sims' physical needs. Less trips to the bathroom, less time sleeping, and less eating means more time to earn points and have fun!

Sugar Skulls

Well now’s their chance!\n\nFor a limited time, your Sims can win a death defying prize by participating in the Day of the Dead Challenge. Interact with Jasmine to start the challenge, then ask the colorfully costumed Sims walking by for a sugar skull. Collect all nine to earn your prize!
Day of the Dead

{0.SimName}'s Spell Book
A Spellcaster is nothing without their trusty Spell Book. Every incantation, ritual, and elixir that a Spellcaster has learned is recorded here.\n\nA Spellcaster can learn new spells and potion recipes from reading Magical Tomes, speaking to Sages, or by Practicing Magic.
The Schools of Magic
A Spellcaster is defined by what they learn and study. What kind of Spellcaster are you?
Alchemy
A student of the alchemical arts studies potions, elixirs, and tonics of all kinds. Who knows what power can be brewed up by a skilled Spellcaster?
Untamed Magic
An Untamed Spellcaster dedicates themselves to only the most powerful and uncontrollable spells. Magic is a force to be controlled!
Mischief Magic
A Mischief Spellcaster loves nothing more than tormenting others with magical pranks. Why take everything so seriously?
Practical Magic
A Practical Spellcaster studies all things helpful and useful. Life is much easier with a bit of magic!

Tassels can be found in many places around Tomarang. Be sure to check around the beaches, the Night Market, and delve into the Sulea Tiger Sanctuary. There's rumors of a cave nearby too, for the brave and adventurous sort. 
Tassels
Every tassel has been found and the collection is complete.\n\nKhun Mae would be proud! Her story is also one that ended in victory, with the people of Tomarang cheering and showering their saviors in gifts and glory. For her bravery, Khun Mae was made Leader of the village. But as she rejoiced, she was also left bewildered by her sacrifice's outcome: a soul split in two. A tiger sat quietly in the crowd, watching her, waiting for her command. This tiger was special, as it now carried the other half of her soul. She knew they would be bonded for life, so she snipped a tassel from her shirt and tied it around its neck. The village embraced them both and Tomarang lived on in peace, thriving under The Great Mother and her other half. Legend has it, these are the very same tassels she once wore!\n\nClick on a tassel in your Sim's &lt;b&gt;Inventory&lt;/b&gt; to combine all 10 colors into a special reward.

The &lt;b&gt;Sulani Preservation Society&lt;/b&gt; encourages the collection of historical artifacts found throughout the Sulani Islands. Among the objects that can be taken home include carved jewelry, out-of-print coins, and hair grooming items.  The coins are of particular interest as ancestral Sulani Islanders were never reported to have printed hard metal currency.\n\nWhen a collection is complete, certification recognizing the curator's efforts will be sent in the mail within the next day or two.

Like what you've made? Save your creations to My Library!\n\nClick the Save Household button to save your Sims to your personal Library.
You can click the My Library button next to each lot type to open up “My Library”, pre-filtered to only show lots of that type.
The &quot;Move Whole Lot&quot; tool allows players to move and rotate the entire contents of a lot. This tool is helpful for lots placed from My Library as well as moving houses along any landscape.
Save to My Library
You can click on the My Library button next to each lot type to open up My Library, pre-filtered to only show lots of that type.
Saved Rooms can be found in My Library, as well as in the Rooms and Walls build catalog sort by choosing the Saved Rooms sort.
Click to open the Save to My Library menu and choose Save Room if you just want to save a single room, rather than your entire lot.\n\nNote: You will need to select the room you want to save before choosing this option.
Open the Save to My Library menu and choose Save Lot in order to save your lot to My Library.\n\nAdd a lot name, description, and set the bed and bath count for your lot, then click on the Save Lot to My Library button to save it.
Save Lot and Save Room are both ways in which you can save your creations for future use.
Or is it? The last Sim in this household has died, but you can create more Sims, choose an existing household to play, or move another household in from My Library.

Travel to Unit
You are already at this Unit. 
Travel to Unit
Select Tenants
There aren't any Tenants in this Unit to Evict.
The distinction between a Just and Unjust Eviction is important. Just Evictions carry no repercussions, while Unjust ones will harm the Property Owner's relationship with the Tenant, lower the Unit Rating, and potentially lead to an Eviction settlement, costing additional Simoleons for the Property Owner.
Go back to Tenant Agreement
Active Rule
Inactive Rule
Rule Broken!
This section shows all active and broken rules for this unit. Property Owners can Post Fine using the mailbox or by selecting the Tenant unit's door. They may also select the Tenant Sim directly to Prosecute a Fine. Tenant Sims have the opportunity to Negotiate Rule Change for any of the active rules as long as it isn't broken. Be mindful that unpaid fines for broken Rules give the Property Owner a chance to Justly Evict the Tenant Household without any consequences.

Remove Sim from Dynasty?
Removing a member from Dynasty affects their relationships, moods and more. Are you sure you want to remove the member? Removing will be finalized when selecting to confirm in Dynasty Settings.
When enabled, Dynasty Prestige will slowly decrease over time to maintain the challenge of keeping a highly prestigious Dynasty. Disabling this will mean only Sim's actions can increase or decrease Prestige.
Enable Dynasty Prestige Decay
If disabled, the dynasty prestige will not decay automatically.

Is someone extorting you? Confront them with a fight, persuade them to stop, or maybe just hope for their untimely demise?
The info broker is mysterious; can you uncover their true identity yourself?
A confident, playful or focused Sim can more easily extort an embarrassed, stressed, or uncomfortable one.
Windows
Grand Ball
Swordsmanship
Cuckoo Clock
Noble Career
